loans.name: Dunia

texts.es: Dunia tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo Santos D. 53 años y su sobrina Cintia D. 10, que está a su cuidado, ellos viven en su casa propia desD. hace ya 30 años. La producción D. artesanías es el negocio al que se dedica Dunia desD. hace 25 años, ella confecciona caretas D. yeso que se colocan en masas para postres con forma D. bebés conocidos popularmente como “Tantawawas” o “panes D. bebé” que se venden mayormente en el mes D. noviembre, en la época D. “Todos los Santos”, mes donD. las personas acuden a los cementerios para visitar las tumbas D. sus amigos o familiares, pero Dunia produce las caretas durante todo el año, ya que obtiene pedidos D. muchos lugares. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo y también hace participar a su sobrina en el pintado D. caretas, porque tiene mucho arte al realizarlo. Lamentablemente en algunos casos, por la fragilidad D. las caretas, estas llegan a romperse, ocasionando una pérdida en la producción D. Dunia, pero ella ha aprendido a afrontar las pérdidas con mucho más trabajo y ganas D. progresar. Atraída por las oportunidades que brinda Microfinanzas Prisma decidió sacar un préstamo, empezando con este primer ciclo, para mejorar su negocio. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cantidad D. insumos para realizar su caretas, además D. colorantes y pinturas para el acabado final.
texts.en:
Dunia is 49 years old and lives with her husband Santos, 53 and her niece Cinita, 10, whom she is responsible for. They have lived in their own home for the past 30 years. For the past 25 years Dunia has worked in the craft business. She makes masks out of plaster molds that she fills with sweet dough. These are in the shape of babies known locally as “Tantawawas” o “panes D. bebé” (baby breads). These are normally sold in the month of November during time of “Todos los Santos” (All Saints), when people go to cemeteries to visit the graves of their friends and family. Dunia makes them year round since she receives orders from many places. She really likes her job and she works together with her husband. Sometimes her niece helps paint the masks because it is a lot of painting. Unfortunately, due to the fragility of the masks, some of them break during the process and that is a loss in Dunia’s production. She has learned to overcome these losses with more work and desires to get ahead. Attracted by the opportunities available with Microfinanzas Prisma, she decided to apply for a loan in order to improve her business. With this money she will buy more supplies to make her masks, including dye and paint for the finished product.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for mask making

loans.name: Alpha Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 39 years old and a father of a one-year-old daughter. He runs a cellphone booth. He has been in business since 1998. Emmanuel started bartering second-hand clothing for fish. He liked that business because it made more profit. Unfortunately he had to stop it to continue his university studies.

After his university studies in 2005, he decided to start his own business. He then opened a cellphone booth with accessories and also sells purified water. Emmanuel is working hard because his ambition is to open a small factory to produce purified water. As he wants to develop and diversify his business, he decided to join one of Hope’s groups in August 2008. He makes a profit of about $30 per day. Emmanuel has succeeded with good strategies to build up permanent customers. He always talks with his customers, he knows them well by their names, and he never runs out of stock.

loans.use: To purchase new cellphone accessories

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ama Déla

texts.fr: Madame K. Ama déla, est une femme veuve qui a perdu son mari, actuellement, elle exerce dans le commerce de sacs de céréales et de charbons de bois dans le quartier d’adidogomé Awatamé à Lomé, elle travaille durement pour pouvoir nourrir ses 03 enfants. Elle a déjà obtenu un prêt de WAGES et sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour s’approvisionner avec dix sacs de maïs, 06 sacs de charbons et 10 haricots. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 2000.
texts.en:
Ms. Ama Déla K. is a woman who lost her husband and is now a widow. She does commerce in grain and charcoal in the Ddidogomé Awatamé district in Lomé. She works hard to feed her three children. She has already had a WAGES loan and is requesting a second loan to supply herself with 10 sacks of corn, 6 sacks of charcoal, and 10 sacks of beans. She has been in this business since 2000.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain and charcoal

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah N. is 56 years old. She is married with four children. At the moment, two are still in the junior high school and the rest are independent. She is a local manufacturer of palm oil and has sells grocery products for the past fifteen years to take care of her family. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil. Palm oil is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale due to capital inadequacy to buy machines for the processing.

In addition to her palm oil business, she also operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, biscuits, evaporated milk, etc. in the community where she lives. She says this has also slowed down due to current food prices in the world market. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities, and for the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, biscuits, and other canned foods so that she can produce daily and supply her customers on regular bases. Hannah again believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her husband to provide food and finance her children’s education. Hannah belongs to a village bank called ‘Yonkodo’, which means 'best of friends'. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make her business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts fruits and grocery products to restock her inventory.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel G. y su esposo el Sr Clemente Delgado  tiene dos hijas que están estudiando la universidad, pero tiene un problema en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la comprar de útiles escolares y pago de colegiatura.
Doña María Isabel trabaja como operaria en una maquiladora y Don Clemente trabaja encargado de la construcción estos son los ingresos que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel Gonzalez and her husband Mr. Clemente Delgado have two children that are studying at University, but they have a problem right now as they don’t have the money necessary to pay for school supplies and tuition. Maria Isabel works as an operator in an assembly plan and Clemente is in charge of construction as the source of income for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School support

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert L. is 29 years old. He is married with no kids. Very hard-working and committed to his work, he has a very good relationship with his customers. He lives in a village in Nkawkaw in the eastern region of Ghana. He has a rented one-bedroom apartment where he lives.

He sells phone cards, phone accessories, phone chips among other things in the village. Robert has been in this business for the past five years. From this business, he has been able to buy himself a motorbike and has erected a kiosk where he sells his products. With the help of the motorbike, he travels extensively to the surrounding villages to sell. The demand for his products is very high because he is the only person who sells such products. He wants loan assistance for expansion to sell in the other communities where there is a communication network. With the loan, he wants to buy a supply of transfer credits, phone chips and phone accessories.

Robert belongs to a village bank called ‘Yonkodo’ which means 'best of friends'. He hopes to receive GH¢400 to make business progress by restocking his inventory.

loans.use: Robert wants the loan to buy mobile phone credit cards, phone chips, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama K. is 49 years old, married, and the mother of three children. All her kids are in school. She lives in a community called Abirem a suburb of Nkawkaw in the eastern region of Ghana. Ama has sold frozen foods in the local market to support her family for four years now. Through this business she has managed to acquire two plots of land for pigs. Through good human relations and customer care, she has maintained quite a number of customers.

She says demand for frozen fish is high but she does not meet the capital requirement to meet such demands. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods to enable her to raise enough income to support her children's education. Ama belongs to a village bank called ‘Asetenapa’ which means 'good living'. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc.

loans.name: Nelsa  Zulema

texts.es:
Nelsa  es socia del Bancomunal Fuerza y Poder.
Nelsa es de Huanuco, es conviviente tiene 30 años dos hijos de 12 y 6 años ambos estudian en la escuela estatal. 
Nelsa desde pequeña vio a sus padres en los negocios de ventas; para ella siempre fue una inspiración   empezó vendiendo tripita de pollo, anticuchos, ahora se dedica a la venta de salchi-papas, en la puerta de su casa hace siete años, a los sábados, domingos y lunes, partir de las 3pm hasta 12 pm, los días que no sale a vender trabaja limpiando casas, una vez al mes  lleva ropa a la provincia de Huanuco, lleva polos, buzos, chompas, lanas, botas, ella también hace trueques  da su mercadería  a cambió de cuyes, gallinas  y las trae a Lima para su consumo.   

Necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para su negocio de salchi-papas y comprar mercadería de ropa para llevar a provincia.  
En Finca recibe orientación a través de charlas para su negocio, a pasado dificultades entraron a robar en su casa, llevándose  todo, hasta su carretilla de trabajo, pero a pesar de todo ella sigue adelante por que tiene un sueños que es poner una bodega en su casa, para ya no estar viajando y que sus hijos sean mejores que ella.
texts.en:
Nelsa is a member of the community bank “Strength and Power”. Nelsa is from Huanuco. She is in a common law marriage and is 30 years old. She has two children of 12 and 6 years old. They study in the state school. Since she was small, Nelsa saw her parents in the business of sales. For her it was an inspiration. She began selling chicken tripe and kabobs. Now she works selling salchi-papas (French fries with sliced sausage on top) in the door of her home for 7 years on Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays, from 3pm until 12pm. The days she doesn’t go to sell she works cleaning the home, and once a month she takes clothing to the Province of Huanuco. She takes polo shirts, sweaters, fleece, boots, and she barters her merchandise in exchange for guinea pigs, chickens, and she takes them to Lima to eat. She needs a loan of 1200 soles for her business of salchi-papas and to buy clothing merchandise to take to the Province. With FINCA, she received an orientation to discuss her business, past difficulties were a robber in her home, who took everything, even her work cart, but under all of this she continued moving forward because she has a dream that is to have a shop in her home, so she does’t go travelling and so her children can be better than she is.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and for her Salchi-Papas

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene 18 años, vive en casa de su tía María de 42 años, donde alquiló un cuarto, y con quien vive desde hace 6 meses. Ella es una alegra y entusiasta joven que se dedica a la venta de mermeladas desde hace 2 años de forma ambulatoria, a ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar y el comercio es una buena alternativa, ya que es un negocio tranquilo y donde tiene más libertad, aunque para Claudia la responsabilidad es lo primero, trabaja durante casi todo el día ofreciendo su producto. Lo bueno es que su esfuerzo está dando frutos, ya que las ganancias van en aumento y ya puede pensar en agrandarlo. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es el tener que caminar tanto de casa, de lugar en lugar para obtener mejores ventas, pero con paciencia, Claudia espera incrementar sus ingresos y tener un mejor porvenir. En la búsqueda de querer expandir su negocio, conoció de los créditos de Microfinanzas Prisma, y ahora ya tiene su primer préstamo. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar más cantidad de mermelada para vender en mayor cantidad y por ende aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Claudia is 18 years old and lives with her Aunt Maria who is 42 and from whom she has rented a room for the past 6 months. She is a happy and enthusiastic youth who has been traveling selling jam for the past 2 years. She has always liked to work and sales is a good alternative as it is a peaceful business where she has a lot of freedom. For Claudia it is her first responsibility and she works during the day offering her products. The good news is that her efforts are bearing fruit and since profits are on the rise she is thinking of expanding her business. The most difficult part of her job is that she has to walk to each house, from place to place in order to obtain better sales, but with patience Claudia hopes to increase her income and to have a better future. In her search to expand her business, she came to know about Microfinanzas Prisma and this is her first loan. With the money she wants to buy more jam to sell in larger quantities and thus increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera, vive en un cuarto que alquiló en el lugar donde trabaja. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de caretas para panes en la ciudad de Juliaca, además para aprovechar el tiempo, vende ropa los sábados y domingos, y así aprovecha las ferias de fin de semana, de esto ya 2 años, en los cuales ha puesto todo su empeño para salir adelante. Felizmente a Roxana le gusta su trabajo y así es que su negocio va creciendo poco a poco, siendo cada vez más rentable. Pero hay algunas ocasiones que el trabajo se le hace muy cansado, ya que trabaja durante toda la semana, pero ella sabe que si se esfuerza ahora que aun es joven cosechará los frutos en el futuro. Roxana se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitad comprará material para seguir realizando sus artesanías (caretas), y también más mercadería en ropa para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Roxana is 20 years old, single, and lives in a room she rents in the place where she works. She makes masks for bread in the city of Juliaca and to make the most of her time she has sold clothes on Saturdays and Sundays, taking advantage of the fair weekend these past 2 years, which has helped her succeed. Fortunately, Roxana likes her job and her business is slowly growing more profitable. There are some occasions when the work is very tiring since she works all week but she knows that if she stays strong now while she is young she will reap the benefits in the future. This is Roxana’s first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She will use the money to buy materials to make her crafts (masks) and also more clothes to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her crafts

loans.name: Magdaleno

texts.es:
El señor Magdaleno S. es dueño de unos locales comerciales, en este momento los tiene en renta, pero no cuentan con el piso de concreto en la parte exterior, la prioridad es tenerlos en magníficas condiciones y así sus arrendatarios no se preocupen por la mala apariencia del local. 
Don Magdaleno ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntualmente y desea su cooperación para este préstamo y así realizar la mejora lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Mr. Magdaleno S. owns several properties which he rents out to businesses. The properties, however, are in need of concrete floors to get them in better condition, so the tenants don't have to be concerned about the appearance of their stores. Magdaleno has already received two loans from FVP, both of which he has paid back on time. With your support, he will be able to use this loan to make his improvements as quickly as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lay concrete floors.

loans.name: Moisés

texts.es: Moisés es un joven soltero de 22 años, vive en una casa alquilada con su mamá y su primo, quienes son su principal apoyo en las decisiones que toma. Se dedica a la venta de casacas para ayudar con los gastos de la casa, ya que su mama no trabaja, siendo él y su primero los únicos que traen dinero a la casa, ellos son naturales de la ciudad de Arequipa y residen en Puno desde hace 3 años. Las ganas y el esfuerzo que le pone Moisés a su trabajo son el pilar fundamental para su progreso, se pueden notar los resultados que cada vez son más favorables para Moisés y su familia. Lo difícil es viajar a diferentes ciudades para traer la mercadería, pero la venta es buena y eso compensa todos los sacrificios que Moisés pasa. Él se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma por lo que promete ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado viajará para adquirir más casacas para aumentar sus ventas, y de ante mano está muy agradecido por la oportunidad de crédito que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Moisés is a young single man of 22. He lives in a rented house with his Mom and his cousin who are his main support for the decisions he makes. He sells jackets in order to contribute to the household expenses as his mother does not work: he and his cousin are the only income-earners in the home. They come from the city of Arequipa and have lived in Puno for three years. The desire and effort which Moisés puts into his work are the main reasons for his progress: the results are increasingly favourable to Moisés and his family. The most difficult part of his work is travelling to different cities with the goods, but sales are good and this makes up for all the sacrifices Moisés has made. He will use the loan to travel in order to buy more jackets to increase his sales and he thanks you in advance for the money you are lending him.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more jackets for resale

loans.name: Polina

texts.en:
Polina T. is 46 years old. She is married with ten children. At the moment, four of them are in senior and junior high school all together. She is a local manufacturer of palm oil. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil.  Palm oil produced is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale due to capital inadequacy to buy machines for the processing.

In addition to palm oil business, she also burns wood with the outcome being charcoal. Polina has a portion of land where she burns the wood to get the charcoal. And this is what she has being doing for the last three years. But her problem has been with funds to buy more gallons of fuel and wood to burn the charcoal and palm nuts fruits to produce oil.

 Polina again believes when you assist her she would be more resourced. And she can expand her business to raise more income to support her husband to provide food and finance her children’s education. Polina belongs to a village bank called Rejoice. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts fruits and fuel to burn charcoal.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana J. is 33 years old and a divorced woman with two children. Currently all her kids are in school. Juliana has sold frozen foods like chicken, pork, mutton, fish, meat, etc. in the local market of Abirem in the Eastern region for twelve years now. In addition to that she also sells yam and smoked fish just to help her make more income. Through hard work and self determination, Juliana is doing well in providing the basic needs for her kids, especially their education. Sometimes getting money to pay her kids' education fees becomes a big blow to her. As a single parent, she is doing her best to cater for her kids through the business that she runs.

Juliana does not have adequate funds to support her business. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices. With the loan, she wants to purchase more cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, pork and meat to enable her to raise enough income to expand her sales. It has been her desire to open another branch in the next three towns from where she is selling because customers from those communities come to her village to buy, which she thinks is quite a distance for them. She would be grateful for your support. Juliana belongs to a village bank called ‘Asetenapa’ which means 'good living'. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, yam and smoked fish, etc.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y su hija de 14 años. Hace 9 años empezó a vender comida de manera ambulante, animada por su hermana, quien la apoyó en mérito a la buena sazón que tiene, es así que ella continuó realizando este trabajo, al cual está dedicada diariamente. Vende su comida en las mañanas y en las tardes, ofreciendo los más variados platos de desayuno y de almuerzo en su establecimiento que se ubica en un mercado cercano a su casa. Sus comensales quedan muy satisfechos, de esta manera garantiza el retorno de sus clientes y por ende, que continúe su negocio, del cual depende económicamente su familia. Para Lidia es una gran satisfacción cocinar cada día y seguir adelante por el bienestar de su familia. Es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y todo este tiempo de trabajo ha demostrado ser una de las mejores socias de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita, con una parte, comprará abarrotes, tales como; sacos de arroz, de azúcar y demás productos de primera necesidad no perecibles; y con la otra parte comprará mesas y sillas nuevas para su restaurante.
texts.en:
Lidia is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 14-year-old daughter. Nine years ago she began selling food as a street vendor, encouraged by her sister who helped her. She continues working at this job daily. She sells food in the mornings and afternoons, offering a variety of breakfast and lunch dishes at her stall located in the market near her home. Her customers are always satisfied and this is how she guarantees return customers and in turn, the continuation of her business, which her family depends on. Lidia takes great satisfaction in cooking each day and working for the well-being of her family. This is her third loan with MFP and she has demonstrated that she is one of the best members of her community bank. With part of the loan money she will buy groceries such as: sacks of rice and sugar and other necessary products. With the other part of the loan she will buy new tables and chairs for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare her food

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah A. lives in her hometown with both extended and immediate family. Her village name is Abirem in the eastern region of Ghana. Abirem is a farming community. Her husband is a farmer and her other family members are also farmers. Hannah has prepared and sold food and drink in the community school for twelve years now. She sells cocoa drink with bread, which is enjoyed by the school kids, and she also sells sachet mineral water. Cocoa drink is nutritious and contains so many vitamins which are good for both the young and for adults.

Hannah is 43 years old and married with five kids. Currently two of them are in senior high school. She requests the loan to buy an ice chest to keep the cold drinks, cocoa powder, sugar, milk, etc. so that she can save the proceeds from the business to cater for her kids in school. Hannah belongs to a village bank called Rejoice. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: For the purchase of sachet mineral water, sugar, and cocoa powder, etc.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 23 años, vive en la casa de su madre con sus hermanos. Desde hace un año trabaja en su propia bodega, la cual él mismo atiende y administra todos los días durante casi todo el día, por la calidez de su atención ha logrado en corto tiempo tener la clientela necesaria para seguir adelante con su negocio. Él vende todo tipo de productos comestibles, lo necesario para cubrir las necesidades de su clientela, es por ello que logra implementar su sección de venta de carne, por lo que está muy animado en continuar con su negocio, para que de esa manera siga adelante con sus proyectos de mejorar y ampliar su tienda. Es la segunda vez que Roberto tiene un préstamo con MFP, y es uno de los socios de su banco comunal que ha demostrado ser eficaz para un trabajo en equipo y muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de sacos de arroz, de leche evaporada en lata y demás productos, que le servirán para impulsar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Roberto is 23 years old and lives with his mother and siblings. One year ago he began working in his own store, which his runs and manages every day. Because of his good customer service he has gained, in a short time, the necessary customer base to keep his business running. He sells all types of food products necessary to cover his customer’s basic needs and he was able to add a meat section to his store. He is excited to continue improving his business and has goals of making his store bigger and better. This is his second loan with MFP. In his community bank he has proven to be an efficient team player and is always on time with his payments. This loan is to purchase sacks of rice, canned evaporated milk and other products which will help propel his business capital.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his merchandise

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia Nyarkwaa is a 48-year-old trader. She is married and the mother of nine children. Currently, four attend school in the village. She trades in onions, tomatoes and peppers, etc. on a table-top in a village market at Nkawkaw where she lives. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods in bulk and retails them in the surrounding towns during their market days. She says that through this business she has endeavored to support two of her kids to finish junior high school. She requests the loan to enable her to buy an increased stock of tomatoes, onions, and peppers to grow her business to boost profit. She hopes to increase her savings to support the children's education, to give them future and hope.

Afia is convinced that with her 25 years trade experience, when the loan is given to her she will have more resources to expand her business growth. Afia belongs to a village bank called ‘Kristo nti’ which means 'Christ Sake'. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: For the purchase of increased stock of vegetables like onions, tomatoes, and peppers, etc.

loans.name: Aidé

texts.es: Aidé tiene 52 años, vive con su hija y su esposo en su propia casa. Ella tiene su propia librería desde hace 4 años, negocio que administra personalmente y también atiende con la calidez que la caracteriza. Aidé comenzó con poco capital, pero ha ido creciendo, la época en que tiene más ventas son los meses escolares, debido a que su librería está cerca de dos escuelas de educación primaria, por lo que tiene ventas seguras. Los meses de vacaciones, los actuales, bajan las ventas y es poca la mercadería que tiene, por lo cual sólo abre en las tardes y está aprovechando para vender café. Es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ha demostrado ser una buena socia en su banco comunal, y fue una de las que impulso el mantenimiento del mismo cuando tuvieron dificultades. Aidé se está preparando para el inicio del año escolar (marzo), para lo cual está solicitando este dinero, con el que comprará útiles de escritorio; como cuadernos en todos los tamaños, fólderes, lápices, colores, entre otros artículos indispensable para el uso de los escolares.
texts.en:
Aidé is 52 years old and lives with her daughter and husband in a home that they own. For the past 4 years she has worked in her bookstore, that she personally runs and manages with the high quality of service she is known for. Aidé started with very little capital, but it has slowly increased. She makes the most sales during the school year and since her bookstore is close to two elementary schools, she is guaranteed to sell her books. During the vacation months, her sales are lower and she has less merchandise to sell, so she only opens during the afternoons. She takes advantage of the extra time by selling coffee. This is her 4th loan with MFP. She has proven to be a good member of her community bank and she was one of the members that supported the bank when it was going through a difficult time. In preparation of the beginning of the school year (in March), Aidé will use this loan to buy school supplies such as: notebooks in different sizes, folders, pencils, crayons and other important items for the students.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo y prendas de vestir, hace 2 años comenzó apoyando en las ventas a sus sobrinos que se encargan de confeccionar ropa, y así empezó ofreciendo estas prendas, primero a sus amistades y también ahora ofrece a los padres de familia de la escuela donde estudia su hija, de esta manera tiene los ingresos necesarios para apoyar en la economía de su casa. Susana pasó un mal momento no llegaron a pagarle por sus productos y tuvo que enfrentar esta mala temporada, esto se convirtió en una lección que le ha enseñado a ser más precavida al momento de elegir a sus clientes. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y trabajando en su banco comunal tiene una actitud muy positiva frente al trabajo en equipo y a la garantía solidaria que se tiene, donde todos se apoyan y garantizan mutuamente. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita comprará polos al por mayor, cosméticos, y en especial joyas para tener en stock y ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Susana is 33 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in her parent’s home. She earns a living by selling cosmetics from a catalog and articles of clothing. Two years ago she began selling clothing that her cousins make. First she sold to her friends and now she also offers her goods to the parents of her daughter’s classmates. In this way she earns the necessary income to help support her family. Susana went through a bad time when her customers never came to pay the products she had sold them and she had to endure those hard times. This turned into a lesson for her to be more cautious when choosing her clients. This is her 2nd loan with MFP. She works with her community bank and always has a positive attitude regarding working as a team and the solidarity that they have to mutually help each other. With this loan she will buy polo shirts at wholesale prices, cosmetics and jewelry to have in stock and offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Saúl

texts.es: Saúl es casado, tiene 40  años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijas. DesD. su juventud se ha dedicado a L. venta D. tamales,  él ayudaba a su madre en L. preparación y en L. venta, ahora que es casado y tiene 3 hijas ha optado como L. mejor salida D. generarse ingresos económicos a L. venta D. este plato típico del país que es el tamal, que consiste en una masa D. maíz molido con relleno D. aceitunas y carne D. pollo, y con un aderezo muy agradable, ese punto exacto D. sabor que pone en cada tamal es L. mejor garantía D. L. creciente demanda que tiene Saúl. Él va caminando por toda L. ciudad ofreciendo su producto, en especial a lugares comerciales y a establecimientos  D. comida, llega a vender hasta 120 tamales al día. Generalmente sale a vender por las mañanas y por las tardes, en su casa, los prepara. Saúl tiene grandes deseos D. continuar con este negocio y hacerlo más formal ofreciendo sus tamales a empresas que cubran grandes banquetes institucionales. Este trabajo es realizado con el único fin D. ofrecer a sus 3 hijas lo necesario para su sustento y educación. Es L. segunda vez tiene un préstamo con MFP, además, es un socio activo D. su banco comunal, ya que forma parte D. L. junta directiva. Saúl solicita esta cantidad para L. compra D. una máquina D. molino para que pueda acelerar el proceso D. preparación D. sus tamales, L. cual está valorizado en 4000 soles, solicita solo una parte para completar lo que le falta, ya que lo que resta lo cubrirá con su propio capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Saúl is 40 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three daughters. Since he was young he has earned a living making and selling tamales. He helped his mother prepare and sell them and now that he is married with 3 daughters, the best way to generate income is to sell this typical dish of his country. The tamale consists of a ground cornmeal dough filled with olives and chicken with a delicious sauce. The precise amount of seasoning that he puts in each tamale is the best guarantee Saul has to increase the demand for his product. He walks through the city offering his food, especially near businesses and restaurants. He sells up to 120 tamales per day. He generally sells during the mornings and in the afternoons he makes them in his home. Saúl greatly wishes to continue this business and make it more formal by offering his tamales to companies that cater large banquets. He does this work with the objective of providing his daughters with the necessary means to support them and proviD. them with an education. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and he is also an active member of his community bank, where he is part of the organizing group. Saúl is requesting this loan to buy a mechanical grinder that will speed up the process of making tamales. This grinder costs 4000 soles and he is only asking for part of that, to add to what he has already saved.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a mechanical grinder

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is a 64-year-old trader. She is married and a mother with ten children, but three have passed away. Currently four attend senior high school in the next town. She trades in onions, tomatoes, and peppers, etc. on a table-top in a village market at Nkawkaw where she lives. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods in bulk and retails them in the surrounding towns during their market days. She says through this business, she has endeavored to support three of her kids to finish junior high school. She requests loan to enable her buy increased stock of tomatoes, onions, and peppers to grow her business to boost profit. She hopes to increase her savings to support the children's education, to give them a future and hope.

Afia is convinced that with her 8 years trade experience, when the loan is givien to her, she will have more resources to expand her business growth. Afia belongs to a village bank called ‘Kristo nti’ which means 'Christ Sake'. She hopes to receive GH¢600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: For the purchased of increased stock of vegetables like onions, tomatoes, and peppers, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 28  años, vive con su hijo de 9 años. Se dedica a trabajar cada día en su locutorio, el cual instaló en su casa hace 8 meses, negocio que surgió ante la necesidad de generarse recursos propios, aprovechando la facilidad que tiene de poseer el servicio de Internet, es así que ofrece diariamente este servicio de comunicación. Carmen ha visto la necesita de ampliar su negocio, y está planificando cómo lograrlo, y cuando se propone nuevas metas no las deja sin ejecutar. Por el momento desea mantenerse, ya que está buscando un mejor lugar para crecer. Su mayor motivación es su pequeño hijo de 9 años que vive con ella. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete nuevamente a trabajar por el desarrollo de su banco comunal. Carmen solicita este dinero para adquirir una cantidad considerable de tarjetas para celular prepago, de montos diversos, las cuales podrá ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen is 28 years old and lives with her nine-year-old son. Every day, she works in her call center, which has been located in her house for 8 months. This business, which she stared so that she could earn her own money, uses a facility where she can offer internet services. In this way, she offers communication services daily. Carmen knows that she needs to grow her business and is planning how to achieve this. When she makes new goals for herself, she doesn’t stop without reaching them. For the moment, she wants to maintain the business, since she is looking for a better location to grow. Her biggest motivation is her small, nine-year-old son, who lives with her. This is her second loan with MFP, and she commits herself again to work for the development of her community bank. Carmen requests this money so that she can acquire a large quantity of prepaid cellular cards, of different amounts, which she will offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy prepaid cellular cards

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is the mother of three kids. She is a 42-year-old businesswoman. She owns a boutique shop and sells ladies wear like jeans, trousers, blouses and skirts, women's slippers and dressing bags, etc. She has been in business for the past three years. She revealed that the sale of female goods moves faster for her than those of males because men hardly ever buy new clothes.

Comfort says she needs a loan to meet the demand for top quality clothes, bags and shoes by her customers. She believes that, with the loan, she will have more resources to purchase good quality stock to retail to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of ladies jeans, trousers, blazers, blouses and skirts, women's slippers and dressing bags. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of ladies jeans, trousers, blouses and skirts, women's slippers and dressing bags.

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 19 años, vive con sus padres y su hermana en una casa arrendada. Junto a su madre, desde hace más de 3 años, vienen dedicándose intensamente a la  venta de prendas que ellas mismas producen, tejen diversos artículos como chalecos, gorras, vestidos para niñas, chalinas, entre otros. Por las mañanas Ángela estudia y por las tardes teje, ella ofrece lo que produce a sus amistades más cercanas y sus tiempos libres ofrece de casa en casa sus tejidos. Con esta actividad ella y su madre generan más ingresos para su casa y ella tranquilamente puede solventar sus estudios. Ángela disfruta de realizar esta actividad, sobre todo por las utilidades que le genera y porque es una distracción. Su meta es producir mayor cantidades y tener una tienda donde pueda exponer y vender sus trabajos. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado, en el primer ciclo, una joven muy responsable y dinámica que alienta a los integrantes de su banco comunal a trabajar de esta misma forma, unidos. Ángela está solicitando esta cantidad para invertirla en la compra de lana al por mayor, de diversos colores,  así como también, para cubrir los gastos de transporte de sus prendas a los distintos lugares que los lleva a ofrecer.
texts.en:
Ángela is 19 years old and lives with her parents and sister in a rented house. She and her mother, for more than 3 years, have sold clothing that they produce. They weave diverse garments, such as vests, caps, dresses for girls, scarves, etc. In the mornings, Ángela studies, and in the afternoons, she weaves. She offers what she produces to her closest friends, and in her free-time, she offers her products door-to-door. With this activity, she and her mother make more money for their home, and she can finish her studies. Ángela enjoys pursuing this activity, above all for the profits that she makes and because it is a distraction. Her goal is to produce larger quantities and have a store where she can display and sell her products. This is her second loan with MFP, and she has demonstrated, in her first loan, that she is a responsible and dynamic young woman, which inspires the members of the community bank to work together in the same way. Ángela is requesting the loan so that she can buy wool of different colors at wholesale. In this way, she will also cover her transportation costs when she goes to different places to sell her clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of wool

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana M. V. es casada, su esposo se dedica a hacer trabajos de albañilería, ellos tienen dos hijos.
La señora Juana M. está solicitando un préstamo para comprar materiales con los cuales piensa remodelar los interiores de su casa, su esposo se encargará de la mano de obra debido a que él se desempeña en este tipo de trabajos. Esta remodelación ayudará a que ella y su familia vivan en un hogar mejor.
texts.en:
Juana Martinez Velazquez is married with two children; her husband is a construction worker. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to remodel the interior of her home. Her husband will take care of the labor since he has plenty of experience in this type of work. This remodeling will help her and her family to live in a better home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Interior remodeling

loans.name: Trojes Group

texts.es: El Grupo " Trojes" esta representado por el señor Víctor y conformada por gente trabajadora y responsable. En su mayoría se dedican al comercio de productos como el pan, comida, verduras, pastillas y a actividades como el transporte público y la artesanía. Dentro del mercado de productos siempre existe la competencia pero para lograr superarlo se necesita tener mayores productos a mas bajos precios por lo que se requiere de mayor capital es ahí donde intervienen la Fundación Agrocapital para ayudar con el financiamiento para la compra de materiales e insumos para la venta así como para el mejoramiento de las herramientas de trabajo para la realizar las labores diarias de este grupo. Entre los miembros del grupo existe gente con experiencia en grupos solidarios y otros que recién se encuentra aprendiendo pero en general se puede considerar a los miembros del grupo como personas con ganas de crecer y mejora su situación y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “Trojes” is represented by Mr. Victory and is made up of hard-working and responsible people. For the most part, they sell products like bread, food, vegetables, candies, and activities like public transport and handicrafts. There is always competition in the market, but in order to succeed in overcoming it, they need to sell more products at lower prices. As a result, they require more capital. This is where Fundación Agrocapital comes in to help with financing so that the borrowers can buy materials and supplies to sell and can improve the tools for their activities so that they can pursue their work. Among the members in this group, there are people who have experience in collectively responsible groups and others that just started to learn, but in general the group members are people with hopes of growing and improving their situation and that of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Transito Group

texts.es: El Grupo " Transito" están representados por el Señor Percy, es un grupo conformado por personas capaces y trabajadoras las cuales se dedican a actividades como la venta D. ropa, abarrotes y a actividades como la construcción, peluquería y a la elaboración D. pan y repostería en general. Los socios (as) saben que la competencia en el mercado comercial es difícil, pero no imposible, por eso ponen su máximo esfuerzo para superarse y mejorar sus productos para competir en el mercado D. la oferta y la demanda. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. materiales e insumos así como a la mejora D. sus herramientas D. trabajo para entregar un producto terminado D. mejor calidad. Dentro del grupo existen socios (as) que tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios y en el manejo D. los capitales otorgados y por lo demostrado en anteriores ciclos son gente responsable y cumplida.
texts.en:
The “Transito” group, represented by Mr. Percy, is a group comprised of capable and hardworking people who dedicate themselves to such tasks as the sale of clothing, groceries, construction, a hair salon, bread making, and baked goods in general. The group members are aware that competing in the commercial market is difficult, but not impossible, and because of that they put forth their maximum effort to better themselves and their products to compete in the supply and demand market. The loan will be used to purchase materials and supplies so that they are able to do such things as improve their work tools to supply a finished product of better quality. Within the group there are members that have experience in solidarity groups and who also have experience managing granted loans; as exemplified in previous cycles they are responsible people who fulfill their promises.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela tiene 45  años, vive en su propia casa con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Ella tiene un gran talento para elaborar lindas manualidades, las diseña y luego las elabora para venderlas por docenas o según le soliciten sus clientes, de esta manera  realiza estos trabajos. Estos manualidades son generalmente pequeños adornos, juguetes o objetos utilizados en las ambientaciones de las aulas en el colegio, y otros diversos, que su creatividad le permite, utiliza diferentes materiales; como lana, telas, cartón, entre otros. En un muestrario, que elaboró ella misma, ofrece sus manualidades, para la época navideña elaboró una serie de adornos acordes a la ocasión que fueron su mejor entrada económica en esta fecha, es por ello que  Graciela quiere tener un puesto de exposición, donde pueda dar a conocer con mayor  notoriedad sus trabajos y también ofrecer el servicio de enseñanza de confección de manualidades. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y sigue muy convencida de seguir el trabajo que realiza en su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado se invertirá, una parte, en la compra de adornos para vender, y la otra parte, la usará en adquirir telas, hilos y demás materiales necesarios para la elaboración de sus manualidades.
texts.en:
Graciela is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children. She is very talented at creating beautiful handicrafts: she designs them and later makes them to sell by the dozen or by special-order for her clients. These crafts are usually decorations, toys or articles used in the classroom or for any other use which she can dream up. She uses a variety of materials such as wool, fabric and cardboard among others. She created a sample showing her handicrafts with a Christmas theme, this series of decorations was her best-selling to date. Because of this, Graciela wants to have a place to showcase her crafts, so that her work can become better known and where she can offer lessons on creating such handicrafts. This is her second loan with MFP and she is committed to continued membership in the community bank. She will invest the loan monies in part to buy decorations for resale and in part to buy fabrics, yarn, and other materials she will need to create her handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make crafts and other decorations for resale.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad tiene 35 años, es casada, vive en una casa arrendada con su esposo y sus hijas. Vende cosméticos desde hace un año, incursionó en este negocio debido a la necesidad de generarse más ingresos económicos, empezó con poca mercadería, pero con el avance del tiempo pudo mejorar sus ingresos, ahora se está preparando para la próxima campaña de ventas, por lo que necesita abastecerse de cosméticos para empezar a buscar a sus amistades y personas cercanas a quienes pueda vender sus productos mostrando previamente sus catálogos, así como los muestrarios. Soledad se está preparando en reunir capital para invertirlo en otro negocio como la venta de ropa. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está satisfecha por la labor que realiza dentro de su banco comunal, además, es una de las integrantes que alienta a los demás a seguir trabajando juntos. Soledad está solicitando esta cantidad para usarla en su totalidad en la compra de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Soledad is 35 years old, married, and lives in a rented house with her husband and daughters. She has been selling cosmetics for a year. She started this business because she needed to make more money. Initially, she had only a little merchandise but with time she earned more and is now getting ready for the next sales campaign. She needs to start sourcing cosmetics and samples so that she can show her friends and people close to her to whom she may sell her products and to whom she has already shown her catalogues. Soledad is getting ready to raise funds to invest in another business, such as selling clothes. This is her second loan with MFP. She enjoys the ongoing work with her community bank, and is one of the members who encourages the other to continue working together. Soledad is asking for this loan to buy cosmetics exclusively.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 52  años, vive con su esposo y su último hijo. Desde su juventud se ha dedicado al negocio de la venta de alimentos según la temporada, actualmente, vende menestras, las cuales compra al por mayor y las ofrece a las distribuidoras de alimentos. Además de esto, también vende la fruta de la época, Mercedes siempre está pendiente de tener nuevos clientes para seguir repartiendo sus diversos productos, ahora por el alza de los precios está optando por mejorar sus ingresos, comprando más mercadería disponible para vender. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, es una nueva integrante de su banco comunal y tiene todos los deseos de ser una compañera y aportar significativamente al desarrollo de su banco comunal. La cantidad que solicita es para la compra de sacos de menestras tales como pallares, lentejas, frijoles, etc., y también adquirirá frutas de la selva para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 52 years old and lives with her husband and youngest child. She has been selling seasonal food since she was young. She is currently selling dried beans which she buys in bulk and sells to food distributors. In addition, she sells fruit in season. Mercedes is always looking for new customers to continue distributing her various products. She wants to take advantage of the current price increases, making more money by buying more available merchandise for resale. This is her first loan with MFP: she is a new member of her community bank and has every desire to become a partner and contribute significantly to the development of her community bank. She will buy bags of dried beans such as butter beans, lentils, beans, etc. as well as get fruit from the rainforest to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 54 años y vive con su único hijo. Se dedica a vender leche y queso desde hace 5 años, reparte todas las mañanas a sus vecinos, quienes son sus principales clientes, en promedio llega a vender hasta 15 litros diarios, algunos días supera  sus ventas, por lo que trabaja en función a los pedidos que hacen sus clientes. Vende de lunes a jueves y los días viernes va a unos pueblos de la zona rural de su ciudad para adquirir al por mayor la leche, en algunas ocasiones queso. Con esto se abastece para sus ventas de la semana, la única dificultad es el hecho de caminar con un balde pesado de leche, pero para lo cual,  Mercedes ya está acostumbrada a este trabajo. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, porque ha notado que es una de las mejores oportunidades de desarrollo económico, teniendo en cuenta el apoyo que recibe en su banco comunal. El dinero solicitando será usado en la compra leche y quesos, productos que debe rotar rápidamente, porque son perecibles.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 54 years old and lives with her only son. She has been selling milk and cheese for the past 5 years. She delivers every morning to her neighbors, who are her principal clients. On average she sells nearly 15 liters each day. Somedays she exceeds her normal sales since her work depends on the demands of her clients. She sells from Monday to Thursday and on Fridays she goes to some towns in a rural area of the city to get the milk and cheese. With this she has a supply for her weekly sales. The only difficulty is to walk with a heavy bucket of milk, but Mercedes is now accustomed to this work. This is the first time that she is taking a loan with MFP because she has noticed that having the support one receives from a communal bank is one of the best opportunities for economic development. The money she is asking for will be used to buy milk and cheese, products that need to be handed off quickly since they are perishable.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de su mercadería

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su propia casa. Desde su niñez aprendió el valor del trabajo, ya que siempre ayudó a sus padres, las habilidades que obtuvo le sirven hoy cuando vende sus productos del campo, es decir, su cosecha, la que vende en los mercados principales de su ciudad, también sabe cómo almacenar sus productos para momentos de escasez. El trabajo duro del campo que ella realiza es más duro en la época de siembra, ahora Zenaida tiene planes de dedicarse al transporte, ya que con largos años de trabajo esforzado, logró adquirir un minibús del que actualmente están pendientes sus tramites de autorización para circulación, con este vehículo podrá obtener ganancias adicionales en el transporte público de pasajeros, a las que tiene con la agricultura, ya que espera incrementar sus ingresos para la educación de sus hijos. Es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, como parte de su banco comunal ella siempre ha promovido la unidad para realizar juntos un trabajo armonioso. La cantidad solicitada será para la compra sacos que le se sirven para empaquetar sus productos cosechados, también costeará el tramite de su póliza de seguro de su movilidad, que en los próximos días estará en circulación, el precio aproximado de este trámite es de 65 soles por asiento, su movilidad tiene capacidad para 20 pasajeros.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 41 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in their own house. Since she was a little girl, she has learned the value of work, always helping her parents. This skill serves her well today when she sells her crop in the main markets of her city. She also knows how to store her products for times of shortage. She works hardest in the field during the time of planting. Now Zenaida plans to focus on the transport of her products. After long years of hard work, she has been able to buy a small bus, which has a pending application of authorization for circulation. With this vehicle she will be able to gain additional profit through the public transportation of passengers along with her crops. She hopes this will increase her income to afford her children's education. This is her fourth time taking a loan with MFP. As part of a communal bank, she has always promoted unity to be able to carry out together a harmonious job. The amount she is requesting will be used to buy sacks that will allow her to pack her harvested crops and to help pay for the application for her vehicle insurance policy, which will be ready in the next few days. The approximate price of this application is 65 soles per seat, and her vehicle has space for 20 passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks for packaging her products and vehicle insurance policy

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es: Mauricia tiene 52 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y con el menor D. sus hijos en su propia casa. Trabaja cada día en sus tierras D. cultivo, cortando el pasto para venderlo a sus vecinos que se dedican principalmente a la ganadería, venD. en grandes cantidades, lo que le permite tener ingresos diarios para su familia, es por ello que Mauricia sale temprano D. su casa a preparar todo para sus ventas, también por las mañanas se va a la plaza D. su localidad con todo lo que ha cortado, D. esa manera no solo son sus vecinos quienes le compran, sino también otras personas D. zonas más lejanas. La meta D. Mauricia es expandir su mercado, por ello, llevara sus pastos a la ciudad para venderlos en el mercado mayorista y D. esa manera convertirse en una gran comerciante D. pastos para animales. Adicionalmente, cría sus propios animales, además D. también dedicarse a la fabricación D. ladrillos en lo que apoya a su esposo durante algunas horas al día. Es la quinta vez que Mauricia tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta del servicio que recibe en cuanto a los préstamos, además D. haber aprendido el hábito del ahorro, por lo que recomienda a otras personas trabajar D. esta manera, con bancos comunales. La cantidad solicitada es para adquirir mejores herramientas D. cortado D. pasto, asimismo invertirá en el pago D. transporte que utilizará para trasladar sus paquetes D. pasto, también comprará una vaca lechera. Las herramientas están valorizadas en 50 soles, el pago D. transporte por toda una temporada será D. aproximadamente 300 y con el resto comprará una vaca D. raza.
texts.en:
Mauricia is 52 year old and lives with her husband and the youngest of her children in their own house. She works each day in their fields of crops, cutting the grass to sell to their neighbors who raise cattle. They sell great quantities which allow them to have daily income for the family. Because of this, Mauricia leaves her house early to prepare for her sales. Each morning she goes to the town plaza with all the grass she has cut. Therefore, it's not just her neighbors that buy from her, but also other people from areas farther away. Mauricia's goal is to expand her reach by taking her grass to the city to sell it in a bigger market, allowing her to become a bigger trader of grass for animals. Additionally, she would raise her own animals and spend more time helping her husband make bricks for a few hours each day. This is the fifth time that Mauricia has taken a loan with MFP and she is very content with the service she has received so far. Also, she has learned the habit of saving through the recommendation of other people that work like she does in a communal bank. The amount she is requesting will be used to buy better grass cutting tools, to invest more in the transportation fee that she pays to move her packets of grass and to buy a milking cow. The tools are valued at 50 soles, the transportation fee for one season will be approximately 300 soles and with the rest she will buy a cow.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow and better tools for cutting grass

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo tiene 31 años, no tiene esposa, vive con su hijo de 11 años y con su madre, en la casa de ella. Él trabaja en su propia procesadora de alimentos, específicamente de la alcachofa, que es un producto nativo de su zona, su trabajo consiste en adquirir, tanto de sus propias tierras de cultivo, como la compra de cosechas de otros campos, la alcachofa al por mayor, luego extrae la pulpa y la envasa en frascos herméticos. También compra truchas al por mayor de la piscigranja de un familiar, una vez que tiene su mercadería lista, viaja a la ciudad capital, Lima, para venderla en los principales mercados. En el tiempo de 5 meses que han transcurrido, ha visto que generarse ingresos de esta manera ha sido una gran idea, ya que Ricardo ha aumentado su clientela y su demanda, por lo que desea aumentar su producción, a la vez de mejorar aún más la calidad de sus productos. Su sueño es tener una empresa procesadora de alimentos y su propia granja de truchas para ser un gran abastecedor. Es la tercera vez que Ricardo tiene un préstamo con MFP, donde aprendió a trabajar en equipo y reforzó más su sentido de responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita es ara comprar los recipientes para almacenar sus alcachofas, de esta manera darle mejor presentación a sus productos, el precio de los paquetes de envases está valorizado en  45 soles cada  uno, piensa adquirir en esta ocasión, 50 paquetes, y con el monto que resta comprar más alcachofas y truchas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 31 and unmarried. He lives in his mother's house with his mother and his 11-year-old son. He works in his own food processing operation, processing primarily artichokes, which are native to his region. His job involves obtaining the artichokes, either by growing them himself or buying them wholesale from other farms, extracting the pulp, and packaging it into airtight jars. He also buys trout wholesale from a relative's fish farm. As soon as his merchandise is ready, he travels to the capital, Lima, to sell it in the main markets. Over the past 5 months, Ricardo has found this to be an excellent way to generate income. Both his clientele and the demand for his products have grown, so now he wants to increase production, and further improve the quality of his products. His dream is to have a food processing company and his own trout farm so he can become a major supplier. This will be Ricardo's third loan with MFP; he has learned a lot about teamwork, and his sense of responsibility has grown. He plans to use his loan to buy containers for his artichokes so he can make them look better. Each package of containers costs 45 soles, and he wants to buy 50 at this time. He'll use the rest of the money to buy more wholesale artichokes and trout.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jars, which he'll use to package his products.

loans.name: Mérida

texts.es: Mérida tiene 45 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y 4 D. sus 6 hijos en su propia casa. Ella es comerciante D. productos según la temporada, por ejemplo; si es navidad, venD. adornos para la ocasión, en este caso, que se aproxima la época escolar se abastece D. útiles escolares al por mayor y los venD. en las zonas rurales cercanas a su localidad, pero que geográficamente son D. difícil acceso, D. esa manera garantiza el ingreso familiar. Este trabajo lo realiza  junto a su esposo, los meses D. bajas ventas son cuando inicia el año, es decir D. enero y febrero, por lo cual Mérida aprovecha la ocasión para criar pollos y venderlos. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, es parte D. un banco comunal, donD. se compromete, nuevamente, a seguir trabajando con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero solicitado es para la compra D.  útiles  escolares al por mayor, invertirá 1800 soles, con el resto D. dinero implementará mejor su granja D. pollos.
texts.en:
Mérida is 45 years old, married and lives with her husband and four of her six children in her own home. She sells seasonal products; for example, at Christmastime she sells Christmas decorations. Now that the school year is approaching, she is stocking up on school supplies, selling them in the rural areas close to where she lives which are difficult to get to, thus ensuring the family income. She works together with her husband. When sales are slow at the beginning of the year, in January and February, Mérida takes advantage of the downtime to raise chickens and sell them. This is her second loan with MFP. She is part of a community bank where she has committed herself again to continue working with great responsibility. She will use the loan to buy s/1,800 Soles worth of school supplies in bulk and the remainder of the loan will be used for her chicken farm.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de  Chinandega el señor Luis Humberto J. se dedica a su actividad de agricultura y ganadería desde hace varios años. Es importante destacar que esta actividad ha sido el pilar por el cual ha apoyado a su familia llevando el sustento a su casa.


La razón por la cual hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de una yunta de bueyes para sacarle el máximo provecho y de esta manera continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar por medio del ganado que es su actividad económica.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, Luis Humberto J. has been farming and raising livestock for a number of years. Importantly, this activity has been the pillar that has supported his family. Now, he is asking Ceprodel for a loan in order to buy a pair of oxen to maximize his profits and continue to support his home by way of his livestock, which are the source of his income.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pair of oxen

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 28  años, vive con su esposo, su hijo de 7 años y su hermano menor en su propia casa. Ella vende todo tipo de artículos; de uso personal, para el hogar, de higiene, entre otros, desde hace 5 años, junto con su esposo, cada semana, se trasladan a la tierra natal de donde proviene María, que está a 5 horas de viaje, de esta manera abastece de lo necesario a sus paisanos. Su mejor venta, sin duda es en los días de ferias de su tierra, que son todos los jueves, por ello que los lunes y martes María y su esposo salen al centro de la ciudad para comprar al por mayor su mercadería y el miércoles se enrumban por las tardes a su pueblo para que tengan tiempo de instalar su puesto. María desea seguir adelante con este negocio porque es rentable, también quiere incursionar en la venta de artefactos como radios y televisores,  ya que sus paisanos le han solicitado que traiga ese tipo de mercadería. Con este negocio María y su esposo han logrado adquirir lo que necesitaban como una familia en formación, lograron comprar un terreno en la cual  están viviendo actualmente, supieron administrar adecuadamente sus ganancias. Es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, donde participa activamente en las reuniones de su banco comunal y aprendió el hábito del ahorro. La cantidad solicitada es para comprar más mercadería, artículos para el hogar por el valor de 1000 soles y con la otra mitad aprovechará para vender cerveza, ya que en su tierra natal estarán en festividades, para lo cual comprará aproximadamente 20 cajas de cerveza.
texts.en:
María is 28 and lives with her husband, her 7-year-old son and her younger brother in her own home. She has been selling all sorts of things, such as articles for personal use and for hygiene among others, for the past five years. She works together with her husband: every week they return to the area María is from, which is a five-hour trip, and in this way they cater to the needs of the villagers. Her best sales are without doubt on market day, which is Thursday. And so María and her husband travel to the city-centre to buy their merchandise in bulk on Mondays and Tuesdays and return to the village on Wednesday evening in order to set up their stall. María wants to continue with this business as it is profitable. She would also like to try selling items such as radios and televisions as the villagers are asking her to bring back these types of merchandise. Thanks to their business, María and her husband have managed to acquire what they need to start a family; they have managed to buy land where they are currently living and have the knowledge they need to manage their money well. This is her third loan with MFP and she participates actively in the meetings of her community bank and has learned the habit of saving money. She willuse the loan to buy more merchandise, items for the home in the amount of 1000 Soles and with the other half she will try selling beer, as there are upcoming festivities in her homeland for which she will buy roughly 20 cases of beer.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a las tareas agrícolas desde hace 5 años, cultiva principalmente papa y alfalfa, la cual sirve para alimentar a los animales de granja, después de 6 meses de espera, cosecha y lleva sus productos al mercado principal de su ciudad para venderlos. Continuar trabajando en esta actividad que le permite atender a sus pequeños hijos, además, considera que este trabajo le ha dado buenos frutos, los que ayudaron a la economía de su hogar, aunque muchas veces los factores climáticos son un riesgo para una buena cosecha, pero Gladys continua tomando como mayor alternativa el cultivo de alfalfa para las próximas siembras. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado puntualidad y mucha responsabilidad en los pagos y compromisos que requiere el trabajo en equipo de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de 5 sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra, valorizada la bolsa de 50 kilos en 200 soles.
texts.en:
Gladys is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own home. She has worked in agriculture for the past five years, primarily cultivating potatoes and alfalfa, which is used to feed farm animals. After a six-month wait, she brings in the harvest and takes her products to her town’s main market to sell. Continuing to work at this endeavor, which permits her to look after her two young children, Gladys also believes that this work has yielded good results for her, helping out with household expenses. However, many times the weather poses a risk to the harvest, so Gladys continues to plant alfalfa as a backup. This is her second loan with MFP, and she has been punctual and shown a lot of responsibility with regard to the payments and promises required when working as part of a bancomunal team. (A bancomunal or banco comunal is a business support group.) The money that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of five sacks of fertilizer for the next round of planting. Each 50-kilogram bag costs 200 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: Elba tiene 24 años, es soltera y vive con su madre y hermanos. Vende abarrotes desde hace 2 años, incursionó en el negocio ante la necesidad de generase sus propios ingresos, independizarse económicamente y solventar sus estudios superiores, es por ello que inició con unos ahorros que fueron su pequeño capital, pero luego empezó aumentar sus ganancias, ahora empieza a crecer poco a poco. Su trabajo consiste en vender lo que tiene de mercadería a sus vecinos aledaños en la quinta de inquilinos donde pudo arrendar un cuarto que le sirve de almacén para sus productos, ya que aún no tiene un local para su negocio, la meta provisional que tiene  Elba es tener una bodega bien surtida de productos comestibles. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ha sido admitida nuevamente en su banco comunal por demostrar ser solidaria con los demás integrantes de su grupo, además de que es muy responsable. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de mercadería, de esta manera aumentará su capital de trabajo y podrá obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Elba is 24 years old, unmarried and lives with her mother and brothers. She has sold groceries for the past two years, having ventured into this business out of the need to earn her own income to be financially independent and finance her higher education. For this reason, she used her savings as seed capital, but as her profits have increased, she has now begun to expand little by little. Her work consists of selling merchandise to her close neighbors in the apartment complex where she was able to lease a room that serves as a warehouse for her products. Elba still does not have a shop for her business, and her current goal is to have such ashop that is well-stocked with food products. This is the second time that she has taken out a loan with MFP, and she has again joined the banco comunal (a business support group) to show her solidarity with other members of the group. Additionally, she is very responsible. The money she is requesting is for the purchase of merchandise for the purpose of increasing her working capital and making more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es: Clementina tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos mayores en su propia casa. Tiene su propia tienda desD. hace 2 años, notó que era la mejor oportunidad D. generarse ingresos económicos y aunque son modestos está perseverante en este negocio, donD. atienD. todos los días y durante casi todo el día. Su mayor venta está en las gaseosas y cervezas que venD., Clementota está buscando en la actualidad aquellos productos D. mayor consumo y productos novedosos para seguir vendiendo. Es la primera vez que Clementina tiene un préstamo con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte D. su banco comunal porque conocen que es una persona responsable y cumplidora D. lo que promete. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más mercadería para su tienda, 200 soles será para la compra D. verduras y condimentos y lo que resta para la compra D. bebidas.
texts.en:
Clementina is 53 years old, and lives with her husband and three children in their own home. She has had a shop for the past two years, as it was the best way to generate income and although that income is modest she has continued with the business. Clementina works nearly all day long every day. Her best sellers are soft drinks and beer. Clementina is presently looking into products that would sell well and new products to market. This is the first time that Clementina has taken out a loan with MFP. She was invited to join the banco comunal, a business support group, because she is known to be a responsible person who finishes what she starts. With the money requested, Clementina will buy more merchandise for her store. 200 soles will go towards the purchase of vegetables and condiments, and the remainder for beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma es casada, vive en una casa arrendada con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Se dedica al tejido a mano de diferentes prendas de vestir, principalmente de chompas y tapetes para muebles, su sistema de trabajo consiste en tejer durante varias semanas todas las prendas, una vez listas las lleva a su tierra natal llamada Huari que está a 4 horas de viaje desde la ciudad donde actualmente ella radica. Allí hace un trueque de sus prendas con queso, el cual trae a la ciudad y lo vende en el mercado principal. De esta manera Vilma se abastece de los recursos económicos para aportar al sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar y no solamente sentarse a esperar que los ingresos vengan netamente de su esposo, por lo cual, ella se siente muy contenta por ser también la que sustenta su hogar. Esta es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, en todo este tiempo ha estado trabajando con mucho entusiasmo en su grupo solidario y aprendió el gran valor del ahorro, además es muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para comprar variedad de colores y de calidades de lana, ésta está valorizada en un promedio de 18 soles la bolsa de un kilo, Vilma comprara alrededor de 30 bolsas, que de acuerdo al color y calidad varían su precio.
texts.en:
Vilma is married, and lives in a rented house with her husband and their three children. She hand knits various items of clothing, mainly sweaters and tablecloths for furniture. She generally knits all the items over the course of several weeks, and once they are ready takes them to her home town Huari, which is a 4-hour trip from where she currently resides. There she trades her garments for cheese, which she takes to the city to sell in the main marketplace. In this way Vilma obtains the financial wherewithal to support her home monetarily and is not simply sitting and waiting for the money her husband brings home. She is happy that she is also able to contribute to supporting her household. This is the fifth loan Vilma has received from MFP. All this time she has worked enthusiastically with her solidarity group and has learned the value of saving. She is additionally very prompt in making her loan payments. The money that she has requested is for buying various colors and types of yarn, which on average sells for 18 Peruvian soles per 1-kilogram skein. Vilma will buy approximately 30 skeins, the price of which varies according to the color and quality.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yarn

loans.name: Meybol

texts.es: Meybol tiene 28 años, es casada hace 9 años, y es madre de dos hijos, vive en la casa de su suegra que le ha dado un cuarto independiente para que viva cómodamente y le ayuda en el negocio de su bodega. Antes de que naciera su segundo hijo trabajaba construyendo cajones para una vecina, mientras que su esposo trabaja en la chacra al cuidado de sus frutos, sus ahorros les permitieron adquirir un auto que ahora alquilan a su cuñado por la 25 soles diarios. Meybol ayuda en la bodega de su suegra en horas de la mañana, y por la tarde trabaja en la tienda de ropa de su hermana, desde las 3.00pm hasta 10.00pm y gana de acuerdo a lo que vende. En sus horas libres contabiliza las ganancias de su carro para de ese modo ir ahorrando con miras de construir su casa propia.
