Ella comenta que es de mucha responsabilidad administrar su carro, porque se tiene que estar pendiente del mantenimiento, el cambio de las llantas y demás accesorios. Su esposo está más interesado en empezar con el negocio de la compra y venta de frutas al por mayor, con la finalidad de comprar su terreno y construir su casa. Meybol al solicitar su primer préstamo con MFP tuvo la predisposición de pagar las cuotas fijadas con puntualidad, y así lo viene haciendo todo este tiempo, este ya es su 5to crédito. Con el dinero que solicita comprará llantas para su carro, para que siga trabajando y genere las ganancias necesarias.
texts.en:
Meybol is 28 years old and has been married for nine years. She is the mother of two children. She lives with her mother-in-law, who has given them their own room so that they might live comfortably, and she helps her mother-in-law with her store. Before her second child was born, she worked putting together boxes for a neighbor, while her husband worked on a farm growing fruit. Their savings permitted them to acquire a car that they now rent out to her brother-in-law for 20 Peruvian soles per day. Meybol helps in her mother-in-law’s store in the morning, and in the afternoon from 3 to 10 o’clock works on commission in her sister’s clothing store. In her free time she totals up the earnings from their car. They continue to save in hopes of building their own home. Meybol has commented that taking care of the car is a big responsibility, because there are always repairs waiting to be made, tires and other items to be changed. Her husband is very interested in going into the wholesale trade in fruit, with the goal of buying a plot of land and building a house. With her first loan from MFP, Meybol made her payments on time, and has continued to do so to the present. This will be her fifth loan. With the money she has requested, she will purchase tires for the car, so that it will continue running and will generate the needed income.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires for her car

loans.name: Alida

texts.es: Alida tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada hace 37 años, y madre D. 4 hijos, D. los cuales uno D. ellos falleció, actualmente vive en su casa propia; pero su negocio lo realiza en otro lugar, que también es propio. Hace 10 años atrás se dedicaba a la venta D. golosinas al por mayor, las que traía D. Lima y después las repartía en las bodegas D. su pueblo; esta actividad la realizaba cada 15 días y ahora la realiza con menor frecuencia porque está incursionando en el negocio D. la venta D. comida. Hace poco acaba D. adquirir un terreno en un lugar estratégico, que tiene zonas naturales muy bellas, y se está  acrecentando la concurrencia D. turistas, por ello, solo quiere vender platos típicos D. la región. Ahora, ella y otros comerciantes están viendo la manera D. construir locales D. madera muy atractivas, mientras eso, todos los fines D. semana prepara los diferentes platos y se traslada desD. su casa cargando varias cajas D. bebidas y sus ollas bien cubiertas con los papeles y plástico para que no se enfríen y se mantengan calientes. Alida ha estado preparando D. 15 a 20 platos, y por cada plato típico cobra 6 soles, aunque no gana mucho, pero este precio lo mantendrá mientras acreciente la concurrencia D. la gente y se conozca el lugar; y una vez que la zona se haga pública espera recuperar lo invertido. Alida es presidenta D. su banco comunal en MFP, y les inculca a todos los socios a que asistan y paguen en la fechas indicadas sus cuotas, para D. ese modo, al grupo se les siga facilitando los préstamos. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. cajas D. bebidas, y la otra parte es para que pueda construir su local D. madera donD. establecerá su negocio para no tener que cargar cada fin D. semana sus pesadas ollas y cajas.
texts.en:
Alida is 57 years old and has been married for 37 years. She is the mother of four children, one of whom passed away. At present she lives in her own home; however, her business is in another location, which she also owns. For the past ten years she has engaged in the wholesale candy traD.. She brings candy in from Lima and distributes it to stores in her town. She was making the trip every fifteen days, but now does so less frequently because she is branching out into the sale of food. Recently she was able to acquire a plot of land in a good location in very beautiful natural surroundings. The competition for tourists is increasing and she wants to sell traditional local meals. She and other businessmen are looking into building attractive shops out of wood, but in the meantime every weekend she prepares various dishes, and along with cases of drinks, transports them from her home in pots covered with paper and plastic so that they do not get cold, but stay hot. Alida has been preparing 15 to 20 meals, and for each traditional meal charges six Peruvian soles. Although she does not earn much, at this price she can be competitive and familiarize herself with the locale. Once the area opens to the public she hopes to recover her investment. Alida is the president of her MFP banco comunal, a business support group, and she instills in all the members the value of attending and making their loan payments on time. She continues to facilitate loans for the group in this fashion. The money that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of beverages by the case, and the rest will go towards building a shop out of wood where she can set up her business, and no longer have to carry heavy pots and boxes every week.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks by the case and construction of her shop

loans.name: Sibia

texts.es: Sibia cuenta con 28 años de edad, es madre soltera y adora a su niña de 4 añitos, por el momento está viviendo en la casa de sus padres, mientras pueda comprarse un terreno o una casa. Desde sus 17 años vendía productos de belleza a todas sus amistades, ella estudió secretariado ejecutivo en un instituto técnico, en este tiempo conoció a una proveedora de zapatos de la ciudad de Trujillo, famosa por la calidad y variedad de zapatos que fabrican, y muy ilusionada empezó con este negocio, al principio no tenia clientes, pero desde que empezó a trabajar en la municipalidad de su localidad, se han incrementado los pedidos de zapatos. En su centro de trabajo ofrece sus artículos, anotando los números y modelos que cada cliente requiere, y una vez que sale de su trabajo, en horas de la noche los reparte y atiende de 7 a 11pm a las personas que conocen de su negocio y la buscan. Nos comenta que hace poco trajo varias docenas de zapatos y los ha colocado al crédito, sus clientes le compraban con motivos de las diversas fiestas de promoción escolar y para navidad, en esa época, su negocio ha sido muy rentable, ya que por cada par dejado a pagaré puede ganar hasta el doble, por ello es que ahora se está dedicando a cobrar y de paso a hacer algunos pedidos, para realizar su próximo viaje. Cuando las reuniones de su banco comunal son los fines de semana ella participa en todas, pero cuando son días de laborales, envía un reemplazo, quien lleva los pagos de sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para pagar los zapatos que compró al crédito, de los cuales, aún le falta realizar las cobranzas, y cuando tenga la cantidad necesaria, volverá a traer más mercadería de la ciudad de Trujillo.
texts.en:
Sibia is 28 years old and a single mother who adores her 4-year old daughter. Currently, she is living in her parents’ house, until she can buy herself a plot of land or a house. Since she was 17 years old, she sold beauty products to her friends. She studied to be an executive secretary at a technical institute and, during this time, she met a shoe supplier in Trujillo famous for the quality and variety of shoewear they make. With a great deal of hope, she started in this business but at first did not have customers. Since she started working at her local municipality, her shoe orders have increased. She offers her products, noting the style number and size that the customer requires, and at night after work she delivers her orders taking care of customers who know her and seek her out from 7 pm to 11 pm. She tells us that not long ago she brought several dozen shoes that she placed on credit, and her customers were buying them for various occasions such as school functions and for the holidays. During this season, her business has been very profitable given that she can double her investment on each pair of shoes. For this reason, she is now collecting for the shoes she has delivered as well as taking new orders so she can make her next trip. When the meetings of her cooperative bank take place on weekends, she likes to attend every one. When they are on workdays, however, she sends a replacement who delivers her loan installment payments. The funds she is requesting are to pay for a shoe order that she placed on credit, and from which she has yet to make any earnings. When she has the necessary amount, she will return for more merchandise from the city of Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her latest shoe order.

loans.name: Jurivia Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora Juriva Esperanza S. O. tiene la edad de 26 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Jurivia tiene 2 hijos sus edades son de 5 años su hijo menor y cursa el 1 grado de primaria y su hijo mayor de 7 años que cursa el 6 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como maestro de obras, sus propósitos son de  invertir mas en su capital de trabajo para tener mas que ofertarle a los clientes y predominar en el mercado sus deseos son de aportar mas dinero para su casa para cubrir cada una de las necesidades que tienen sus hijos sus sueños son de proporcionarle a sus hijos una  excelente educación que para el día de mañana le será beneficioso también en sus sueños esta el obtener una vivienda propia para sus hijos y a su ves ellos puedan proporcionarle el mantenimiento necesario a su vivienda.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la de mercadería en general como: ropa, zapatos cosméticos y otras cosas, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 10 años, sus inicios en este negocio surgen por la necesidad de poseer otra fuente de ingresos por lo que el salario de su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir todas las necesidades de  la familia por lo que decide por cuenta propia comercializar estos productos e inicio con capital propio y con el paso del tiempo logro obtener demanda de parte de sus clientes y fue cuando decide trabajar en este tipo de oficio por lo que al principio no le costo mucho trabajo ya que tenia muchas amistades y decide visitarles para ofrecer estos productos y con el apoyo de su esposo quien se encargaba de trasladarla los fines de semana por lo que su esposo trabaja diario entonces, Doña Jurivia camina hasta la casa de sus cliente para ofrecer sus productos, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita abastecerse de mercadería ya que en estos días se acerca la entrada de los niños al colegio por lo que necesita comprar zapatos, mochilas, falda y pantalones de uniforme entre otras cosas también esta el comprar cosméticos por lo que tiene que ofrecer variedad de mercaderia.
texts.en:
Jurivia Esperanza S. O. is 26 years old and married. She has two children, one who is 5 years old and in first grade and a 7 year old who is in sixth grade. Her life partner works in construction. Her aim is to invest more into her working capital so she can have more to offer her customers and dominate in her market. Her wish is to earn more so she can provide for all the needs of her children, and she dreams of giving them an excellent education which will benefit them in the future. She also dreams of obtaining their own home for her children and, at the same time, to support the household. The acitivty that she undertakes is selling general merchandise such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other items. She sells door-to-door, and has had her business for ten years. Helping to augment the household’s income was the initial reason for her starting her enterprise, since her husband’s salary was not enough to cover the family’s expenses. For this reason, she decided to start selling her own products and began by using her own capital. Over time, her customer base grew and she set out to focus on the business since she already had many friends who she could sell to. With her husband’s support, and given that he works during the week, she goes out on the weekends and walks to her customers’ houses to offer her products. The loan request is for working capital because she needs to stock up on merchandise, particularly as the school year is ready to start and children need to buy shoes, backpacks, skirts and pants for their uniforms, among other items. She also needs to buy cosmetic products because she needs to be able to offer a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yelba Iliana

texts.es:
La Señora Yelba Iliana López B. tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Yelba tiene 2 hijos con las siguientes edades su hija mujer de 22 años cursa el 5 año de su carrera y su hijo menor de 14 años cursa el 4 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora de comerciante, el propósito de Doña Yelba es mantener su negocio ya que cada día los productos están en aumento y es mas difícil mantener este tipo de negocio que es el medio de sobre vivencia para su familia sus deseos son que la ayuda de los diferentes países siempre permanezca  ya que ellos son los que nos brindan la ayuda necesaria para salir adelante para llevar a cabo nuestros propósitos, sus sueños son que Dios le de mas fuerzas para salir adelante como lo ha hecho hasta los momentos ya que así podrá enseñarles a sus hijos a luchar por los propósitos que se presenten para su vida misma y también el darle mejoras a su negocio.

Su actividad económica es una pulpería y repostería en la que ofrece: dulces, refrescos, pan dulce, pan simple y jugos, la dirección de su negocio es  en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 10 años, Doña Yelba inicio este negocio por cuenta propia y  fue con pocos productos como: golosinas, detergente, jabón y gaseosas pero sus clientes necesitaban mas productos y es así que decide incrementar mas su pulpería y con este también decide implementar otro negocio como la repostería y es así como decide hacerse cargo de ambos negocios para suplir las necesidades de su familia su negocio de repostería surgió porque ella sabia elaborarlos y así decide implantar otro tipo de negocio en su pulpería es por eso que tiene la necesidad del financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de producto diario que ofrece a clientes del sector por otra parte quiere invertir en materia prima que son necesaria para la elaboración de repostería ya que tiene que comprar harina, huevo y mantequilla para que sus productos sean deliciosos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yelba Iliana López B. is 41-years old and married with 2 children. Her daughter is 22 and in her 5th year at college, and her son is 15-years old, in his 4th year of secondary school. Her partner works as a merchant. Yelba’s goal is to run her business well, as it is her family’s main source of income. She adds new products to her store everyday which makes it difficult to manage. The support Yelba receives from different countries has allowed her to keep working toward her goals and she hopes to keep receiving this help. Her dream is that God will give her the strength to keep working and improving her business, and to teach her children how to fight for their own goals. Yelba owns a local store and bakery, offering sweets, sodas, sweet bread, bread and juice. She has run her business from home for 10 years. Yelba began her business with only a few items like candy, detergent, soap and soda, but her customers needed more products so she increased her store’s inventory and also started the bakery, allowing her to use her baking skills to provide for her family’s needs. She now needs working capital to be used to stock her store with everyday items and to buy baking ingredients like flour, eggs, and butter for her delicious baked goods.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora Julia Mercedes A. S. tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Julia tiene 2 hijos con las siguientes edades su hija mayor de 30 años que trabaja por cuenta propia y su hijo de 22 años que cursa el 4 año de su carrera, su compañero de vida labora como contratista, sus propósitos son que incrementar las ventas por lo que necesita pagar las deudas contraídas con Fundación León 2000 para que ellos sigan ayudándole para su propósito sus deseos son tener su propia pulpería para  tener otra forma de ingresos para su familia además en sus deseos esta que sus hijos trabajen para que ellos puedan aportar dinero para la casa y sus sueños son de proporcionarle mejoras a su lugar de trabajo ya que cuando llueve tiene problemas para  elaborar las mismas.

La Señora Julia se dedica venta y elaboración de tortillas además posee una venta de granos básicos esta venta la realiza al contado o al crédito, la ubicación de su negocio es en reparto Roberto Palma de la bomba 1 cuadra al norte 200 varas al oeste, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 5 años, inicio su negocio con una pequeña  venta de tortillas por lo que necesitaba otro tipo de negocio para prevalecer y decide establecer un negocio de venta de comida, los trabajadores del Ingenio San Antonio empezaron a comprarle y fue entonces que Doña Julia empezó con venta al crédito ya que su esposo era y aun es el jefe de estos trabajadores y el mismo les descuenta de su salario la deudas que tenían con Doña Julia, las ventas son mas fuertes en tiempo de zafra ya que los trabajadores permanecen mas tiempo en la fabrica, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y poder aumentar la producción de sus tortillas y comidas, y seguir manteniendo la estabilidad de su hogar ya que es una de las cosas mas importantes para ella.
texts.en:
Julia Mercedes A. S. is 45-years old and married with 2 children. Her daughter is 30 and works for herself, her son is 22 and in his 4th year at college. Her partner works as a contractor. Julia’s goal is to increase her sales to pay back her loan with Fundación León 2000 so that they will continue to help her. Her personal goal is to have her own store, as a source of income for her family and so that her children can work and help support the family. She hopes to improve her work space, as she has problems working every time it rains. Julia makes and sells tortillas and also sells staple grains, accepting payment in cash or credit. Her business is located in the neighborhood Roberto Palma, 1 block north and 200m west of the fire station. The business is 5-years old; Julia started selling tortillas, later selling food as well to build her business. Workers from Ingenio San Antonio started buying from her so she offered payment on credit because the workers worked under her husband and she could settle their accounts directly from their wages. Julia’s highest sales are during zafra, sugarcane cutting season, when workers stay at the factory longer. This loan will allow Julia to increase production of tortillas and food, maintaining the stability of her home, which is very important to her.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Engels Daniel

texts.es:
El Joven Engels Daniel I. E. tiene la edad de 30 años, su estado civil es soltero por lo tanto no tiene hijos, Engels ha sido un joven emprendedor que ha podido sobrevivir a las difíciles situaciones que se le han presentado y ahora sus propósitos son contar con una fuente de ingresos con la que pueda sustentarse y ayudar en los gastos de su hogar sus deseos son remodelar su vivienda para tener mejores condiciones y un mejor nivel de vida y si algún día llega a formar un hogar pueda tener que ofrecer a su esposa e hijos sus sueños son dejar de trabajar de forma dependiente y dedicarse por completo al cuido de su propio negocio por lo que sus aspiraciones a cumplir son muchas pero sus propósitos  son su mayor prioridad a cumplir.

Su actividad económica es la de servicio de cyber, la ubicación de su negocio es frente a la Terminal de buses en León, el tiempo que tiene de conservar  su negocio es de 3 años, sus inicios se dan con la idea de contar con un negocio que ha tenido afluencia y solicito un cantidad de dinero para establecer este negocio y debido al buen servicio que ofrece en su negocio ha logrado obtener mas clientes por lo cual ha visto la necesidad de ampliar los servicios hoy en día ofrece recargas electrónicas movistar y claro llamadas telefónicas, servicio de Internet entre otras cosas, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para instalar cabinas telefónicas, compra de mas equipos y abastecerse en recargas de ambas compañías distribuidoras.
texts.en:
Engels Daniel I. E. is 30-years old, is single and has no children. Engels is a young entrepreneur who has been able to survive difficult times and now hopes to have a steady source of income to cover his household expenses. He wishes to remodel his house and improve his living conditions, so that if he one day has a family he can offer his wife and children a good home. He dreams of working for himself and having his own business. It will take a lot to accomplish his goals, but he is dedicated to accomplishing them. Engels has an internet services business located across from the bus terminal in León. He started his business 3 years ago when he was looking for work with a steady flow of customers. He obtained money to start his business and offered such good service that he had to expand his business to include telephone lines, Movistar cellular phone credit, and internet, among other things. This loan will be used to install telephone booths, purchase equipment, and stock phone credit from different cellular companies.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vorng

texts.en: Mr. Vorng T. was born in 1947 and his wife's name is Seak That, 56. They live together in Banteay Meanchey Province. They make a living by selling dried fish, which they purchase from fisherman and market sellers, slicing and drying them and sell their died fish to regular customers and villagers. They currently earn income of approximately $10 per day, and started the business in 2005. The couple has two children, both of whom are married and employed: the first child is working on the staff of a train station and the second child is a grocery seller. To grow the business and earn additional income, Vorng T. is applying for a loan to buy more fish to make dried fish and sell. T.'s wife is pictured, because he was not available.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert H. is just 23. He is married and has one child who is one month old. He could not express well, the feeling of how it is to be a father. He knows that he has to work hard for the future of his family. Her wife has been very supportive of him and he, the head of the family feels like he has a big responsibility to meet.

His raises pigs because he finds it a profitable business. The profits he gets from selling hogs is what he uses to feed his family. He believes that he has a big future in this kind of endeavor. Now, he is asking for a loan to help him sustain his business and purchase feed for his pigs.

He started his business with only 1 sow. He sells his pigs to many buyers in their hometown. He wants to expand his business and he could only do this with additional capital. He believes that by requesting a CEVI loan, he will be able to earn larger profits to save money for his child’s education.

CEVI helps Albert sustain his business. Because we wanted him to grow his business, he now enjoys available credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage services that we give to our clients.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Mrs. Navy Bun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people in Boeng Tras village, in Kampong Cham province, have formed a village bank loan group and Mrs. Navy B. is the village bank president. She owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup as a breakfast food to the villagers. Her husband, Mr. Kul Saroeun, is a fisherman wH. catches a small quantity of fish to support the family. In order to catch more fish, Mrs. Navy B. is requesting a loan to buy more fishnets for her husband. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 48 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are fishermen while the other is a grocer, wH. owns a small store. 

Four members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets for fishing.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang S. is 40 years old and a resident of Pursat Province, where she earns a living as a rice farmer. She also raises poultry, like chickens and ducks, for sale from her house. She is widowed and the mother of five children: two are married and live away from the family home, and three are single and attend school.

S. works hard at her business activities every day and never wastes time. To earn additional income, S. would like to ask for a loan to collect chickens from a villager and sell them and to use the remaining loan to buy chicks to raise.

loans.use: To buy chicks to raise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: P. paid off her loan ahead of schedule and applied for her next loan. Her business has gone well and she decided to take expand her pig-raising business. P. is 23 years old and married to Mr. Bunthe. They have two children, all of whom are small. In order to grow her business, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase more piglets to raise and use the remaining money to buy wood to keep for building her house in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise and to buy wood

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang Y. was born in 1979 and she now lives in Ta Sean village in Kampong Cham province. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fruits to re-sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Yorn Vanna, is a construction worker. Mrs. Neang Y. is 30 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to purchase more fruits to re-sell.

loans.name: Yam

texts.en: Mrs. Yam L. is a villager in Krodas Kor village, in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Khin Khuy, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On their land, they have an obstacle. Their field has infertile soil. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Yam L. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to strengthen the field and make the crop more productive. Yam is 63 years old and the mother two children who are palm juice collectors who gather juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field and make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Seh

texts.en: Mr. Seh S. was born in 1976 and now lives in Phdao Chu Kiet village, in Kampong Cham province. He is a security guard who earns a small salary to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Sao Sophal, is a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. Mr. Seh S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy 200 hundred ducks for his wife breeding business. He is 33 years old and the father of two children who are attending the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy 200 hundred ducks for his wife breeding business.

loans.name: They

texts.en: Mrs. They C. is a villager in Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham province. She is farmer who owns 2 hecaters to cultivate rice to earn her living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field has infertile soil which is a bad for her crop. To deal with this problem, Mrs. They C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. She is a 58-year-old widow with five children, two of whom are palm juice collectors who gather juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Two others are fishermen while the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Kek

texts.en: Kek K. lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia. He earns a living by providing building services as a construction worker, as well as catching fish by using nets and traps and selling them in the market. He has been running his businesses for a long time ago. He is married to Sar Sameth, who is a good mother of three children; all of them are single and attend school. She is a local cultivator, and she also is a housewife who cooks delicious meals for her family and is especially good at caring children. K. hopes to begin a new investment and to earn mor income. Thus he would like to request a loan to purchase a trailer-motorcycle (tuk tuk) to pick up passengers. (K.'s wife is pictured)

loans.use: To purchase a trailer- motorcycle

loans.name: Hean

texts.en: Mrs. Hean H. was born 1982 and she now lives in Phao Chu Kiet village, in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Chev Rumchan, is a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it. Mrs. Hean H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy 200 hundred ducks for her husband breeding farm. She is 27 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy 200 hundred ducks for her husband breeding farm.

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Mrs. Leap S. is a villager in Phao Chu Kiet village, in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Koem Kim, are farmers who cultivate both rice and vegetables. They are facing a problem where their field has infertile soil. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Leap S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, to strengthen the field to make their crops more productive. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fuel for a pump to water the field. 

Mrs. Leap S. is 45 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is also presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to strengthen their field to make their crops more productive and buy fuel for a water pump

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap U. was born in 1975 and she now lives in Tasen village, in Kampong Cham province. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Yun Run, is a bed maker. Since this business is going well, he wants to make a lot of beds to meet his customer's demand. Therefore, Mrs. Pheap U. decided to ask for a loan to buy more wood for her husband to make beds. She is 33 years old and the mother of a five children, one of whom helps with his father business while another one helps with her mother business. The remaining three are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more wood for her husband to make beds.

loans.name: Ay

texts.en:
Mrs. Ay P. is a villager in Phao Chu Kiet village, in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Reach Puk, are farmers who own three hectars and cultivate rice, to earn for living. 

They face a small problem on their farm. Their field has infertile soil, so Mrs. Ay P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to strengthen the field and make the crop more productive. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fuel for a pump to water the field. She is 58 years old and the mother of one child, who is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to strengthen the field to make the crops more productive.

loans.name: Changreth

texts.en: Mrs. Changreth T. is a farmer in Phao Chu Kiet village in Kampong Cham province. In her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Changreth T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field; she plans to use the rest of the loan to buy fuel for a pump to water the field. She is a 45-year-old widow with a child who is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fuel for a pump to water the field

loans.name: Kov

texts.en:
Kov N., 30, lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She earns a living by selling grocery inventory from her house, selling items such as cooked food, plastic goods, and sweets for kids. She has a long time's experience in this business. She normally earns around $6 a day from her investment.

N. is married and currently takes care of two children; both of them are single and also attend school. Her husband is a local painter. He has been running his business very well, so that a lot of people recognize his good service.

N. works hard everyday and is very responsible for her family. Recently, she sold all her groceries from her store. Because grocery selling is N.'s main source of income to support her family's living expenses, she would like to ask for a loan of $1100 to purchase a range of groceries for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a range of groceries for sale

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
Mr. Nak N. is a villager in Phao Chu Kiet village in Kampong Cham province. He is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Aside from this business, he is a pig breeder. Since the second business is going well, he wants to expand it so he decided to ask for a loan to buy six more piglets, and he will use the rest of the loan to buy pig feed to feed them.

His wife, Mrs. Chuon Vin, helps him with the business. Mr. Nak N. is 31 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study because that child is only eight months old. His wife and child are also with him in the picture.

loans.use: to buy six more piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Chamreun

texts.en:
Mr. Chamreun H. lives in Svay Pak village in Kampong Cham province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates both rice and vegetables. In these plantations, he faces a problem because he does not have much money to hire laborers to work on the field.

In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and he would use the rest of the loan to buy rice seeds to grow. His wife, Mrs. Keam Kort, is a pig breeder. Mr. Chamreun H. is 34 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to hire laborers and buy rice seeds

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Mr. Lorn O. is a villager in Chrork Rom Deng village in Kampong Cham province. He makes beds to sell. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it by purchasing lumber to make more beds to sell. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living condition with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Houn Phat Na, is a farmer. Mr. Lorn O. is a 57-year-old father of three children who are employed in a garment factory. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy lumber to make more beds to sell

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en: This group of borrowers consists of three people. Its leader, Mrs. Sem P., 50, makes a living selling fish in the local Takmao Market. She sells the  fish that her son catches in and around Tunle Sap Lake. She also purchase fish from local fisherman to sell. She currently earns an average of $4 a day. She is a widow and has seven children who are all single. Two of her sons are employed.  One son is a chef who caters wedding parties and another one is a fisherman. Because her business depends on her son fishing, she is requesting a loan to purchase more fishing equipment like nets and traps for her son to use for fishing. The other two borrowers include; Roeun N., 56, a Khmer cake seller and also needs a loan to build a bathroom, and Yem T., 48, who sells fish in the market and needs money to build a hedge around her house. The borrowers live in Deum Mean Commune, in Kandal Province.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing equipment

loans.name: Soin

texts.en:
Mr. Soin C. was born in 1962 and he now lives in Phum Thmey village in Kampong Cham province. He is employed in a cigarette company and he makes very little money to support the family. In his position, he needs his own motorbike to transport the cigarettes to re-sell but he does not have enough money to buy one. Thus, he decided to request a loan to buy a motorbike for his work.

His wife, Mrs. Morn Sareth, is a housewife. Mr. Soin C. is the father of five children, one of whom is employed in the cigarette company while another is working in a garment factory. Two others are enrolled in the local school and the remaining one is too young to work or study. His wife is with him in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his current work

loans.name: Rann

texts.en: Mrs. Rann K. is a 49-year-old widow and she now lives in Chrork Rom Deng village in Kampong Cham province. She sells beds in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Rann K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more wood to make more beds for her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: to buy more wood to make more beds for her business

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mr. Horn K. was born in 1962 and he now lives in Stoeng Hang village in Kampong Cham province. He is a laborer in the local village. His wife, Mrs. Yun Nhor, is a grocer who owns a small grocery store in the village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it.

In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Horn K. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more grocery goods for his wife's business. He is the father of two children, one of whom helps the mother in her business while the other is attending the local school. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods for his wife's business

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom S. is 29 years old and her husband's name is Khim Sokhon, aged 33. They currently live in Purst Province, Cambodia where they earn a living raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house, raising them for slaughter and also for offspring. Their other source of income is growing rice. Eighteen years ago, they started their businesses. They are currently earning approximately US$ 5 each day.

The couple now cares for one lovely child who is female and a minor. They always work hard and especially are very responsible for their child, including paying for food, clothing, and medical care. To expand the investment and earn extra income to buy more food for the family's needs, S. is applying for a loan to purchase 10 piglets to raise and a rice mill to use for hulling rice.

loans.use: to purchase 10 piglets to raise and a rice mill for hulling rice

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Mr. Chann S. lives in Chrork Rom Deng village in Kampong Cham province. He is a bed maker. Since this business is going well, he wants to make a lot of beds to reach his customers’ demand. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more lumber to make beds to sell.

His wife, Mrs. Chaem Roeun, is a housewife. Mr. Chann S. is 31 years old and the father of a child who is attending the local school. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more lumber to make beds to sell

loans.name: Nau

texts.en:
Mrs. Nau C. is a farmer in Boeng Vaeng village in Kampong Cham province. She owns a 3-hectare field where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces some problems because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on the crop. Additionally, her field has a lot of insects to damage her crop and her field is also far from the irrigation system.

In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Nau C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and fuel for a pump for her field. Her husband, Mr. Chhuok Chhin, is a driver who can make very little income to support the family. Mrs. Nau C. is 35 years old and the mother of a child who is just three months old. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticide, and fuel for a pump

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar Asghar Ali Group

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar baji is a 33-year-old married lady and resides in a city called Vehari, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 35 years. She completed her education up to 10th standard then she married a man whose name is A. A.. Basically he is a farmer and takes land on contract and grows various vegetables. When the vegetables are ripe, he harvests them and sells them at the market, earning income. Parveen baji has no children so she handles all the household work and helps her husband in growing the crops. She is applying for a loan to take land on contract to grow vegetables for sale.

Parveen Akhtar baji is the leader of her loan group. The other member, Shahnaz baji, wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To take land on contract to grow plants

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Mr. Yeng S. is a villager in Chrork Rom Deng village in Kampong Cham province. He is a bed maker. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, he is requesting a loan to buy more lumber to make more beds to sell. His wife, Mrs. Keo Sokha, is a bed seller, selling the beds that have been made by her husband. Mr. Yeng S. is 48 years old and the father of a child who helps him with the current business. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more lumber to make more beds to sell

loans.name: Uoch

texts.en: Mrs. R. is 43 years old and works growing rice as well as raising pigs for sale in Siem Reap Province. She is married to Mr. Ngan and they have three children, one of whom is married. Her husband is 45 years old and works growing green beans. R.'s business is going well, having been started in 2000 and earning around US$ 5 per day. She grows two rice crops a year in the rainy season and the dry season. And she raises pigs to sell for another source of income. To be able to raise moR. pigs and increase her income, R. would like to ask for a loan to purchase piglets and also insecticide for her husband's crop. She intends to repay it over 5 months.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and insecticide for her husband's crop

loans.name: Phall

texts.en:
Mr. Phall P. is a farmer in Trapaing Snau village in Kampong Cham province. He owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Ban Mach, is a recyclables collector who gathers or buys waste such as empty bottles, cans, plastics and so on. Since her business is going well, she wants to buy more waste to re-sell to the recycling factory.

Thus, Mr. Phall P. decided to request a loan for his wife's business. He is 31 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study because that child is just 3 years old. His wife is also in the picture.

loans.use: to buy empty bottles, cans, plastics, etc.

loans.name: Anwar M. Riaz Group

texts.en:
Anwar baji is a 53-year-old married lady and has resided in a city called Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. She is an uneducated lady, but she doesn’t hesitate to mention the reason: she belongs to a poor family and due to their having few financial resources, she couldn’t go to school. Her husband's name is M. R. and he is a vegetable seller. He sells vegetables out of a cart, going to different places and communities to sell them.

Anwar baji has an animal-selling business. She has been in this work for the past 10 years. She sells various animals (sheep and goats) but specifically she sells goats to butcher shops and in animal markets as well. She uses her income to grow her husband’s business. She is applying for a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

Anwar baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy tools for repairing vehicles for her workshop. Parveen Akhtar baji and Samina Tariq baji want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Shakooran baji wants a loan to buy mason's tools. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy goats for re-sale

loans.name: Sroeurn

texts.en:
Sroeurn N. is 28 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia where she earns a living as a tailor, providing her good service for neighbors, sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. From her business, she can earn an average of US$ 3 per day. She currently takes care of one child who is still young and lives in the family home.

Sroeurn N. is married to Veng Vuthy, 30, who is a blacksmith, and is currently earning approximately US$ 5 per day. N. and her family's living conditions are not so good and their house is small for them, because it is so old, hence N. would like to request a loan to purchase house materials to decorate and repair her old house.

loans.use: to purchase house materials to decorate and repair her old house

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong H. lives in Chey Reang village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to amend the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. But Boeun, is a laborer who gets hired by the villagers to plow their fields. Mrs. Hong H. is 42 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a pig breeder while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer  to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Shazia Ghulam Hussain Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is a 25-year-old married lady. She owns a two-room brick house in a city named Vehari and has lived with her family for the past 3 years. Her husband's name is G. H., who has a quilt selling business. Shazia baji makes quilts and her husband goes to market to sell them. They both have been working in this business for the past 20 years. She is applying for a loan to buy material (thread and cloth) to expand her quilt-making and selling business.

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Rukhsana baji, Naseem baji and Ayesha baji each want a loan to buy material (thread and cloth) for their quilt-making and selling businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for quilt making and selling

loans.name: Vin

texts.en:
Mrs. Vin L. lives in Pdau Chum Koeut village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Chuong Chab, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn a living. In this plantation, they face some problems because they do not have enough money to amend the field to make their crops more productive.

In order to deal with these problems, Mrs. Vin L. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, rice seeds, and hire laborers to work on the field. She is 44 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom helps her parents on the plantation while two others are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, rice seeds, and hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Anasa Group

texts.en:
Anasa is the group leader of the Anasa group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive a loan for his/her business.

Leda and Anasa want to take a loan for their business of tailoring. Zabayda wants to take a loan for a business of her husband’s. Mena wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. They all want to expand and progress their business.

They would like to thank all the lenders from around the world to Kiva and AFSG in Afghanistan for providing this process for loans to a poor country.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Ieng

texts.en:
K., 38 years old, is a vegetable seller from Siem Reap Province. She runs her business in the area of the Psatom Tmey Market and sells different kinds of vegetables like cabbages, potatoes, and morning glories. She currently earns an average of $5 a day and has been running the business for more than one year.

K. is married to Mr. Khout Sarthoun who is a motorcycle taxi driver and also works with her in selling vegetables. She now cares for three children, all of whom are single and attend school. K. hopes to enlarge her business; thus she is applying for this loan ($1,000) to purchase more vegetables for sell and to build a bathroom for family hygiene.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for sell and build a bathroom

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Mr. L., 29, raises pigs and chickens for sale in his village of Sanday in Siem Reap Province. He has been working with his wife since 2005 and earns around $2 per day. The young couple care for one child and work hard every day to generate as much revenue as possible to support the family's living and save money for their children to attend school in the future.

Mr. L. is a good communication person in his village, which has contributed to the success of his business. Because of growing his business, he needs to have a pig food making machine. Hence, he would like to request a loan to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To purchase pig food making machine

loans.name: Bashiran Ahmad Din Group

texts.en:
Bashiran Baji is a 40-year-old married lady and has resided in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan is famous for its shrines and people come to see them. She is an uneducated lady because her school was far away from the house and no one was available to take her to school, which is why she quit her studies. Her husband's name is A. D. and he runs a grocery shop in the community. People come to him to buy groceries for their houses. He has a good reputation among the people.

She is the mother of four kids: three sons and one daughter. Her elder son is involved in a fruit selling business. The next goes to school. Her other kids are free and don’t do anything. Bashiran Baji has a talent for sewing clothes. She polishes her quality and adopted this work as a profession. Now she sews clothes by taking orders from her neighbors and earns a profit. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her husband’s grocery shop.

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Momna Baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Waziran Baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Motian Baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit selling business. Zainab Baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to resell. Shazia Baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Khushall

texts.en:
Khushall K. is a young uneducated man but he has lots of experience in a retail shop that he has been involved in for more than 10 years in Jalalabad. Before this he worked in agriculture. Now he has the responsibility for his family and for the last 10 years he has tried to enlarge his shop but he could not. When he found AFSG in Kabul he was really very happy and decided to apply for a loan.

He has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghans for the term of 12 months to enlarge his shop and further his business and make a good monthly income for his family.

Khushall wants to thank lenders around the world and thank Kiva and AFSG for this fantastic loan process. He would like to say, "In my time I still couldn’t find such a good program in Afghanistan. People were faced with lots of difficulty. I would love to see more success in this program in the future."

loans.use: Buying foods and some necessary things for his shop

loans.name: Chham

texts.en: Mrs. L. is 33 years old and works growing rice in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She grows rice twice a year in both the rainy and dry seasons. Her husband, Mr. Tuy, 31, works growing green beans for sale. Their business is going well and they can earn around $10 per day. She has two children, both of whom are teenagers who can not generate any income. For growing her business, and to increase her productivity, L. would like to ask for a loan to purchase insecticide and gasoline to use for her business. She asks for repayment at the end of the loan term.

loans.use: To purchase insecticide and gasoline to use for her business

loans.name: Khursheedan M. Mushtaq Group

texts.en:
My name is Khursheedan and I’m 29. I have resided in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 10 years. I completed my education till 4th standard and couldn’t study further due to low financial resources. My husband's name is M. M. and he is a fruit seller by profession with 3 years of experience. I have four kids: two sons and two daughters. None of my kids is getting an education. We all know that inflation is increasing rapidly and it’s difficult for a single person to serve his family. So from an honest feeling I help my husband by making embroidered dresses. I completed a dress in 3 days and sell it in the cloth market and earn good income for it. I used my income to pay the expenses of my house and my husband pays the bills; e.g., electricity, water and gas. Our kids admire our struggle from the core of their hearts. I am applying for a loan to buy a donkey cart so that my husband can sell the fruit easily without any walking pain.' She is a group leader of some more woman of her locality. Khairan Baji want a loan to buy fertilizer to resell. Allah Muafi Baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Nazia Baji wants a loan to buy electric items such as televisions and fridges on installments to resell. Hamidan Baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for selling fruits

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim T. started her business a long time ago. She is a grocery seller, selling cooked ingredients out of her house. She is 54 years old and has three children, two of whom are married and are living in the family home, while another one is single. Her husband is Nhep Phat, who grows different kinds of vegetables like cabbages and morning glories, which he will sell to a market-seller in 3 months after he begins planting them.

Phat is facing difficulty with watering his vegetable crop, so he and his wife decided to ask for a loan to purchase a pump to pump water for their vegetable crop. The family lives in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to pump water for vegetable crop

loans.name: Sakina Ibrahim Group

texts.en:
Sakina Baji is a 53-year-old widow who has resided in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house in this city and has been living with her family for the past 20 years. She is an uneducated lady. The reason she gives is that in her time people gave importance to skills than to education. "My husband died at age 45 of a heart attack. But he gave to me a very precious gift, my son, which helped me to lead a normal life or I would have totally lost my senses. My son has a business which he has run since before his father’s death. I am applying for a loan to expand my son’s poultry business by buying more chicks." She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Sugran Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Khursheed Baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Allah Rakhi Baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Riaz Baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw. Parveen Baji and Sobia Baji both want loans to buy a donkey cart for loading.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Kuon

texts.en:
Mr. S. is 30 years old and his wife is also 30 years old. He has a rice mill that he uses to provide service, charging money or a share of the rice. And his wife raises pigs for sale as well as purchasing rice to stock and re-sell for profit.

S. and his wife have good relations with other people in the village and that makes their business go well. S. has four children, all of whom are in school. To increase their profit, S. needs a loan to purchase rice to stock and piglets to raise. He said the loan will improve his business and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice to stock and piglets to raise

loans.name: Sayed Abdullqudos

texts.en:
Sayed Abdullqodus is an old man with lots of experience, though he is uneducated. He works in agriculture and has been involved in this business for more than 8 years, working with his family during this time. He has some land, but he would love to have more. To buy more land, he needs extra money. Therefore, he requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani to buy new land and start growing crops on it.

He is a professional man and, from the moment when he started his business, he has always wanted to improve his business. In the town where he lives, when any of the agricultural men face any difficulties, they come and ask Sayed to help with their problems.

He is grateful for this loan process. He wants to say that it is his first loan and it is really great, especially for agricultural workers. He wants to continue his partnership and encourage other workers to use this loan service.

loans.use: Buying seeds and completing his stock

loans.name: Irshad M. Shaban Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji is a 40-year-old married lady and has resided in a city called Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 5 years. She is the mother of one daughter who is just 5 years old. Irshad baji is a very responsible and hard-working lady. Her husband's name is M. S. and he is a mason. Irshad baji helps him to meet the financial expenses with her skill at embroidery. She prepares embroidered dresses on orders which she gets from her neighbors and earns profit from them. She uses her income to pay the kitchen expenses. Her husband is proud of her lovely and kind attitude. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a donkey cart for her husband because he wants to start a transport business, because there’s little income in a mason's work.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Shamim baji and Kaniz Fatima baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk-selling business. Mussarat baji wants a loan to buy iron to re-sell. Elahi baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for her for transport business. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for transport

loans.name: Ni Luh Sarini

texts.id: Ni Luh Sarini merasa sangat lega sekali karena sudah bisa menyelesaikan pinjamannya yang pertama. Ni Luh Sarini bermagsud untuk melanjutkan pinjamnnya yang ke dua yang nantinya juga dipergunakan untuk menambah modal usahanya. Dari pinjaman yang pertama sangatlah nampak bahwa dengan tambahan pinjaman modal dia bisa meningkatkan keuntungan yang di perolehnya Sehingga dengan pengalaman ini Ni Luh sarini bermagsud untuk melanjutkan pinjaman periode ke dua dengan jangka waktu 12 bulan dengan pembayaran dilunasi pada akhir periode pinjaman. Dengan tambahan keuntungan yang diperoleh Ni luh sarini bisa menambah penghasilan keluarganya yang dipergunakan untuk pendidikan anak anak mereka.
texts.en:
Ni Luh Sarini is feeling very good because she has already repaid her first loan from Kiva/DINARI. She would now like to obtain a second loan to use in improving her business. From her first loan it is very apparent that she is fully capable of effectively using the funding to help her business. Because of her good experience, she would like to have a second loan for a period of 12 months, with a full repayment by the end of that time. With this increase in funding Ni Luh Sarini will be able to provide for her family and afford to pay for her children's education.

Translated from Indonesian by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase funding for her store

loans.name: Musalam

texts.ru:
Султонова Мусалам Худояровна 1959 года рождения, вдова, имеет 4 иждивенцев. После смерти мужа, чтобы прокормить семью она решила заняться предпринимательской деятельностью. Она занимается торговлей детскими и женскими одеждами. Ассортимент ее товаров  состоит  из женских юбок, брюк, футболок и платьев. Мусалам закупают товар на рынке «Корвон» у оптовиков. Занимается этой деятельностью на рынке "Шохмансур" города Душанбе.
Для  расширения ассортимента, покупка женских пуловер хочет получить займ в сумме 3500 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Musalam Khudoyarovna S. was born in 1959, she is a widow and has four dependents. After her husband's death she decided to start her own business to be able to feed the family. She sells children's and women's clothing. Her inventory consists of women's skirts, pants, t-shirts and dresses. Musalam buys her merchandise on the Korvon market from wholesalers. She has her vendor space on the Shokhmansur market in the city of Dushanbe. To increase her inventory assortment and to buy women's pullovers she decided to apply for a loan in the amount of 3500 somoni (USD$1,025) for a 6 months term.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's pullovers

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sariani

texts.id:
Periode ini Ni Wayan Sariani kembali melanjutkan pinjaman dari yayasan DINARI. Dana tersebut dipegunakan untuk menambah modal dalam berusaha sebagai Pembuat Sanggah ( Sarana persembahyangan Umat Hindu ). Pesanan Sanggah dalam setiap bulannya tidak pernah terhenti bahkan kadang sampai menolak pesanan karena bahan baku kayu jati sulit dicari. Untuk memenuhi persediaan maka jauh hari harus membeli kayu ke penjual kayu jati karena kayu jati adalah kayu yang paling baik untuk bahan bakunya. Proses pengerjaan Sangahnya dipercayakan pada suaminya,sedang pekerjaan yang ringan ringan dikerjakan oleh Ni Wayan Sariani.

Satu paket pesanan sanggah harga bervariasi sekitar Rp.2.000.000,- s/d Rp.3.000.000,- sesuai permintaan dan tingkat kesulitan membuat ukirannya.Dalam satu bulan Ni Wayan Sariani dan suaminya dapat menyelesaikan satu sampai dua pesanan sanggah. Apabila pesanan banyak biasanya Ni wayan Sariani mempekerjakan  orang lain yang sudah biasa membantunya. Dari usaha tukang inilah Ni Wayan Sariani dapat membantu suaminya dalam mencukupi keperluan keluarganya bersama seorang anaknya yang masih sekolah dasar.
texts.en:
Ni Wayan Sariani wants to participate in another loan program with DINARI foundation. This loan is to be used to add her working capital in her business as Sanggah maker. Sanggah is a traditional religious article in Balinese Hinduism faith.

Her business always receives flow of orders of Sanggah every month. In some occasions she even has to reject orders as she cannot secure enough material to make Sanggah. Ni Wayan Sariani is in this business together with her husband who does most of the Sanggah making works.

One Sanggah can be sold for IDR 2 million to IDR 3 million (around USD 190 - USD 285) depending on the complexity of the wood carving works. In one month Ni Wayan and her husband can make one to two Sanggah. If she has more orders then she hires extra helps. From this business Ni Wayan can help the family's economy and they are also able to send their children to school.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood as material

loans.name: Ni Ketut Kodi

texts.id:
Diusia yang sudah tidak muda lagi apalagi setelah suaminya meninggal dunia Ni Ketut Kodi harus berjuang sendirian untuk mencukupi keperluan keluarganya.Anak pertama sudah menikah saat ini tinggal di kota. Anak yang kedua sudah mulai bekerja dan anak yang terakhir masih sekolah tingkat pertama. Untuk mencukupi keperluan keluarganya Ni Ketut Kodi menjalankan usaha berjualan baju dan celana  bekas yang sudah ditekuni sejak lama.

Untuk pinjaman yang dua kalinya Dari Yayasan DINARI. dana dipergunakan untuk menambah modal untuk menjalankan usahanya. Barang – barang bekas impor ini di dapat dari pelanggannya di kota Negara. Harga satu karung sekarang mencapai Rp. 800.000,- s/d Rp.1.000.000,- di sesuaikan dengan  mutu dari barangnya. Sebagai kegiatan sehari harinya Ni ketut Kodi harus menjajakan barang dagangannya dan menjual secara eceran kepada pelanggan yang ada di desa-desa yang jauh dari pasar. Untuk menempuh jarak yang jauh, Ni Ketut Kodi menggunakan sepeda motor tuanya. Dari hasil penjualan setiap hari Ni Ketut Kodi  memperoleh penghasilan bersih antara Rp. 20.000 s/d Rp. 50.000.
Dari usaha inilah Ni Ketut Kodi dapat mencukupi keperluan keluarganya dan dapat membiayai anak terakhirnya yang masih sekolah.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Kodi is a widow with three children. Her first child is already married and lives in the city. Her second child is already having a regular job while her third child is still in Junior High school. To make a living she sells 2nd hand clothing.

Ni Ketut is planning to take another loan from DINARI foundation. The loan money is to be used to add working capital in purchasing ex - imported 2nd hand clothing stuffs. She gets these stuffs from her regular supplier in Negara city for IDR 800 thousand to IDR 1 million per box (around USD 75 - USD 95) depending on the condition and the quality of the 2nd hand clothing items

Everyday Ni Ketut Kodi rides her old motor cycle to sell her merchandise in the surrounding villages. In one day work she usually earns a net profit of IDR 20 to 50 thousand (around USD 2 to 5). With this she is able to make a living and support her third child.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add working capital

loans.name: Anak Agung Adnyani

texts.id:
Di periode kedua dari pinjaman Yayasan DINARI dipakai untuk menambah modal usaha warungnya.Untuk mencukupi keperluan hidupnya saat ini Anak Agung Adyani bersama keluarganya hanya mengandalkan usaha warungnya.Suaminya adalah seorang karyawan sebuah delaer sepeda motor.penghasilan tetap suami terkadang tidak mencukupi keperluan hidupnya. Baran-barang yang disediakan oleh Anak Agung Adyani seperti barang keperluan sehari-hari yang diperlukan oleh masyarakat sekitar seperti,makanan ringan, aneka macam ringan,rujak dan bakso. Dengan modal awal yang tidak terlalu banyak anak Agung Adyani tetap tekun dalam menjalankan usaha warungnya.

Dana yang didapatnya dipakai sepenuhnya untuk menambah dan melengkapi aneka macam barang dagannya.Dalam satu minggu Anak Agung berbelanja  dua sampai tiga kali melengkapi barang daganganya yang sudah berkurang.untuk berbelanja AnakAgung adnyani  pergi kepasar  Negara dengan sepeda motornya yang berjarak kurang lebih 5 km.Denagn keuntungan bersih sekitar Rp.20.000,- sampai rp. 50.000,- Anak Agung adnayani dapat menambah pendapatan dalam keluarganya bersama kedua putrinya yang masih kecil-kecil selain dari pendapatan suaminya .
texts.en:
Anak Agung Adyani is a housewife. Her husband is working in a local motorcycle dealership. To support the family's economy, she opens a small store selling a daily necessities such as snacks and traditional dishes. She is applying for a second term loan program with DINARI foundation.

She is planning to use the loan money to add the working capital so she can have more stuffs to sell in her store. She goes to market twice to three times a week to buy the merchandise. She rides her motor cycle to go to the Negara market located 5 KM from her house. She can earn a net profit of IDR 20 to 50 thousand per day (around USD 2 to 5). With this she can help make a living for their family and also their two daughters.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add working capital

loans.name: Munia Group

texts.en:
Munia baji is a 46-year-old widow and lives in a city called Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its holy shrines and she feels herself blissful to be a part of this city. She is an uneducated lady because in her time, people didn’t send their girls to school for education but educated them in the skills of cooking, knitting, and sewing to be able to survive in every circumstance.

Munia baji is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Her daughter stays at home and helps her in preparing embroidered clothes. Her son is a wall painter. He earns income when people call to him to paint their walls and houses. In the meantime, Munia baji bears the expenses with her embroidered clothes business. She is applying for a loan to buy paint brushes and other tools for her son’s business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Anwar baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for her food business. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy mason's tools. Ashran baji wants a loan to take land on contract to grow vegetables to sell. Zarina baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy paint brushes and tools

loans.name: Raheela Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Raheela baji is a 49-year-old married lady and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its holy shrines and she feels herself blissful to be a part of this city. Her husband's name is N. A. and he runs a grocery shop near the community. He has got a good reputation with people and people often come to him to buy groceries.

Raheela baji is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Her son runs a video game shop. Her daughter is in 5th standard. Raheela baji herself is involved in a clothes knitting business. She collects orders from her neighbors and prepares the knitted clothes and earns money. She uses her money to pay school fees for her daughter and bears her other expenses as well. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a store.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy jewelry, e.g., bangles, earrings, and necklaces for her jewelry store. Sadan baji wants a loan to buy mason's tools. Ghazala baji wants a loan to buy bangles for her bangle-selling business. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar Mumtaz Ali Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar baji is a 38 years old married woman. She owns a two room brick house in the city of Pakpattan and has been living in it for the past 16 years. Her husband's name is M. A. and, for the past 16 years, he has been in the business of selling cooking oil. Parveen akhtar baji is the mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. Her elder son is a driver and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The others are enrolled in a school and are receiving an education. Parveen baji helps her husband sell cooking oil. She sells in the community and her husband sells in the shops. She is applying for a loan to buy cooking oil to expand the business.

Parveen akhtar baji is a group leader of more women in her locality. Nazia baji is requesting a loan to buy books of different subjects (religious, Syllabus and fiction books) for her book stall. Riffat sultana baji is requesting a loan to buy wood for her furniture making and selling business. Haleema baji is requesting a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil and spices for her food business. Hamidan baji is requesting a loan to contract for land to grow seasonal vegetables to sell. Sharifan baji is requesting a loan to buy chick peas, flour, cooking oil and spices for her food selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim P., is the leader of the four-member group; all the borrowers live in Sro Ngeir Commune of Siem Reap Province. Sim P., 38 years old, is a vegetable seller in Kok Tlok Market. She runs a small store inside the market to sell different kinds of vegetables, selling cabbages, potatoes, and morning glories. She currently earns an average of $3 a day and has been running the business for more than three years. She is married to Mr. Roeun Saroeum, who is a motorcycle taxi driver and also helps her in transporting vegetables to market. She has five children: four are single and one is married and lives away from the family home. One of her singles sons is working as a construction worker. In order to make the business successful and generate a stable income for the family, Sim P. is applying for a loan to purchase more vegetables to sell.
The other three borrowers are:
Chhlang S., 29, who earns a living by renting rooms to tourists. She requests a loan to buy a trailer-motorcycle for her husband to pick up passengers.
Vong S., age 35, who is a tailor. She asks for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her family's transportation.
Lum T. is 40 years old, who has rooms for rent. She needs a loan to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Naziran Begum M.yaar Group

texts.en:
Naziran begum baji is 54 years old widow. Her husband died from a heart attack. For 50 years, she has been a citizen of a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. She is the mother of five kids: three sons and two daughters. Her oldest son has been selling bangles in a Pakpattan bazaar for the past 10 years. The other children are receiving an education from a school that is located near their house. Naziran baji is a very hardworking lady whom sews clothes and bears the education expenses of her children. Her children are very proud of her. This encouragement and affection gives her the strength to continue. She is applying for a loan to buy bangles and artificial jewelry sets to help grow her son’s business.

Naziran begumis is the group leader of some more women from her locality. Shamim baji, Parveen baji and Tahira kalsoom baji each are requesting a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Khursheed begum baji is requesting a loan to buy bleach and washing powder for her laundry business. Naseem akhtar baji is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil for resale.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bangles and jewelry sets to sell

loans.name: Mith

texts.en:
Mrs. Mith N., 49, is a farmer and lives in Taboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1980 and learned the farming skill from her parents. N. grows rice in two seasons- - dry season and rainy season. Each day, she can typically make about $5/day of income. Meanwhile, her husband works buying cattle and reselling them for a profit. He can typically make about $3.50 per day in revenue.
