Mrs. Mith N. has lately requested a loan from KIVA to purchase more cattle to expand her husband's business. The increased number of cattle will generate more profit for her household. ( Her husband is pictured)

loans.use: To buy more cattle to generate more profit.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Zavkiddin

texts.ru:
Исмоилов Завкиддин Тоджидинович родился в 1984 году.  Он женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Они живут в городе Душанбе, район Сино. У него высшее образование.  Завкиддин начал свою предпринимательскую деятельность 4 года назад с продажи мобильных телефонов.  Позже, набрав опыта и средств, арендовал Дилерский Центр по продаже телефонных карт. Свой товар - телефонные карты Завкиддин закупает от Сотовых компаний по договоренности. В данный момент у него все наименования карт таких сотовых компаний как «Indigo», «Biline», «Babilone», «MLT», «M-Teko», «TK-Mobile», и «Somoncom». Также он продает DVD-диски и симкарты – для мобильных телефонов. В дальнейшем хочет открыть еще один Дилерский центр. 
Хочет  с помощью займа в сумме 3000 сомони расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Zavkiddin Todjidinovich I. was born in 1984, he is married and has one child. His family lives in Dushanbe in the Sino region. He has high education. Zavkiddin began his business career four years ago by selling mobile phones. Later after acquiring some experience and capital he rented a dealer center to sell phone cards. Zavkiddin buys his merchandise - phone cards - from phone companies on agreement. At this time he has all the available cards from companies such as Indigo, Beeline, Babilone, MLT, M-Teko, TK-Mobile and Somoncom. He also sells DVD disks and SIM cards for mobile phones. In the future he wants to open another dealer center. Zavkiddin wants to use the loan in the amount of 3000 somoni (USD$875) to help him expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy accessories for mobile phones

loans.name: Naseem M. Jamil Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is a 32 year old married woman and has resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan. Multan is famous for its many shrines and handmade things and Naseem baji feels lucky to live in this city. Due to her family’s low financial resources, Naseem was not able to receive an education. Her husband's name is M. J. who makes and sells steel bangles for a living. He learned this art from his father who had 40 years of experience and has become an expert in this work. Naseem baji has five children: four daughters and one son. Their two oldest daughters learned the family trade and began making bangles for sale on their own. The other kids are enrolled in a school and are receiving an education. Naseem baji has successfully repaid her two prior loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy steel rods and tools to expand her family business.

Naseem baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Naseem baji is requesting a loan to buy scrap plastic bottles and waste papers for her scrap business. Nazia baji and Shabana baji each are requesting a loan to buy bangles for her bangle selling business. Kalsoom mai baji is requesting a loan to buy shoes for her shoe selling business. Kosar baji is requesting a loan to buy milk for her milk selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy steel rods and tools for making bangles

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшоду 24 года. Он холост и помогает своим родителям личным вкладом в семейно-бытовые расходы. У Дилшода есть магазин, к которому он проявляет много внимание.  Он начал свой малый бизнес 3 года назад, с финансовой поддержки от родителей. Ассортимент его товара состоит из  аксессуаров для разных моделей мобильных телефонов.  Чтобы расширить свой бизнес, он просит займ 2000 сомони сроком на  6 месяцев. Он благодарит заранее, кто решил поддержать его.
texts.en:
Dilshod is 24 years old. He is unmarried and is helping his parents by taking care of the family's every day expenses. Dilshod has his own store to which he devotes a lot of attention. He started his small business three years ago with the financial help of his parents. The assortment of his inventory consists of accessories and different varieties of mobile phones. To increase his business Dilshod is asking for a loan of 2000 somoni (USD$600) for a six months term. He is very thankful in advance to all those who wish to support him.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy accessories for mobile phones

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mrs. Ros S. E., 35, is a mother of two and started a business selling river clams at Soung market, Kampong Cham province in 1992. She can make on average $5.60/day of income. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver transporting customers to different locations in the town and generates around $2.50/day for his household.
The income she and her husband make will cover for food an amount of $80 per month, $5 on utility, $15 on her children tuition fee and $15 on their transportation. 
Ros S. E. and her husband would like to apply for a loan from KIVA to purchase rice from the growers and will then resell thE. for a profit when the price is going up.
This will enable thE. to generate additional profit and improve their living condition.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell for a profit.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Sron

texts.en: Mrs. C., 24, has a motorcycle washing service as well as a business selling groceries in her village of Korkthlok in Siem Reap Province. She has been running the business since 2007 and earns around KHR 5000 ($1.25) per day. Her husband is 27 years old and works repairing motorcycle at the same place. C. and her husband's business has gone well. She cares for two children, all of whom are small teenagers and in school. To increase their income, C. would like to ask for a loan for her husband's business to purchase more repair materials. She said the loan will help to increase her family's income.

loans.use: purchase more repair materials

loans.name: Azra M.nawaz Group

texts.en:
Azra baji is the wife of M. Nawaz and has resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 16 years. She is 53 years old and the mother of six kids: four sons and two daughters. Her oldest son works in a workshop. The others are receiving an education from a school which is located near the house. Azra baji’s husband sells gentleman's shoes from a cart. As everybody knows that winter season has started and he has already sold his warm shoes collection. Azra baji has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a new loan so that her husband can restock his shoe inventory.

Azra baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Sugran baji is requesting a loan to buy shoes for her shoe selling business. Bashiran baji is requesting a loan to buy decorative vases to sell. Shahida baji and Nasreen baji each are requesting a loan to buy bangles for their bangle selling businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Cheav

texts.en: Cheav T., 33, is married and lives with her husband in Bati district, Takeo province. She grows vegetables and weaves scarves to earn a living and is able to make $6 a day, while her husband, Heng Yut, is a construction worker building houses. On average, he makes $2 a day. This couple together has two children. Most of the people who live in Bati district usually grow crops and weave to raise their families. Mrs. Cheav T. is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit to purchase more silk to weave more scarves.

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Diyor

texts.ru:
Диёру 20 лет, он холост. Диёр трудолюбивый человек. Он арендует помещение, где занимается ремонтом мобильных телефонов. Также Диёр устанавливает программы, прошивает, заменяет панели мобильным телефоном. Его партнерам по этому делу является брат, который помогает ему и иногда заменяет его на месте деятельности. У него много клиентов.   Диёр занимается ремонтом мобильных телефонов 4 года.    
Для увеличения ассортимента и товарооборота, то есть закупа запчастей для мобильных телефонов хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони.
texts.en:
Diyor is 20 years old, unmarried. Diyor is very hardworking. He rents a space where he does mobile phone repairs. Diyor also installs programs, stitches and replaces panels on the mobile phones. His brother is a partner in this business who helps him and sometimes substitutes him. He has many clients. Diyor has been repairing mobile phones for four years. To increase the assortment and circulation to buy spare parts for phones he wants to take out a loan for 3000 somoni (USD$875).

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Did

texts.en: S., 41, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a staffer of Christian Center. She is married with three children; all of them are single. To help a little with her family's food needs, one of her sons is working as a local teacher, and currently earns a salary of $120 per month. Her husband Nouv Samith, 56 years old, is working as a security guard at the Orphanage. He currently earns a salary of $150 a month, and has been working since 2002. S. has applied for a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use for her son to ride to work and meet her family's needs. The loan will help her reduce the cost of transportation.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Teang

texts.en:
Mrs. Teang L., 47, is married with two children and works on her rice paddy growing rice and some other crops. She started her farming activity in 1980. With her daily business activity, she can earn around $6.50/day of income.
Her husband works as a broker buying cattle and reselling them for a profit, making around $2.50 each day of income. Teang L. and her husband would like to request a loan from KIVA to purchase more cattle to generate more profit to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to resell for more profit.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Vorn S., 43, pictured on the right hand side with her sister , is a widowed farmer and lives with her child and her sister in Bati district, Takeo province. She typically makes $1.50 a day by working as a farmer and making various kinds of baskets and is aided by her sister and her employed child. Her sister, Vorn Touch, 47, works making baskets, too. Mrs. Vorn S. is asking for a loan to purchase rice and take off the husk with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice for sale.

loans.name: Saleem M.ramzan Group

texts.en:
Saleem baji is a 53 year old widow and resides in a two room brick house with her four sons in a city Multan, Pakistan. Her husband died 5 years ago. Saleem baji and her husband were very close and when he past away she became very depressed. Her sons helped her through that very difficult time and she is very thankful. Her sons run a milk shop in the community. She has successfully repaid her past three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her sons’ milk selling business.

Saleem baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Nosheen baji is requesting a loan to buy bangles for her bangle selling business. Haseena baji is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Khatoon begum baji is requesting a loan to buy goats for her animal selling business. Shahnaz baji is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for a milk selling business

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Chhoeun T., 56, pictured with her husband and her children, is married and lives with her husband and four of her children in Bati district, Takeo province. She typically makes $2 a day by raising ducks and making baskets. Her husband, Meas Pich, 58, is a tractor driver and makes $5 a day. Two of their children are children and two others are employed as workers. 

Mrs. Chhoeun T. is asking for a loan of $1000 to make two investments. First, raise more ducks and second purchase bamboo to make baskets for sale.

loans.use: Raise ducks and purchase bamboo to make baskets.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang T., 29, pictured with her husband, is married and lives with her husband in the district of Bati, in the province of Takeo. She stays at home and weaves scarves to earn a living and is able to make $5 per day. Her husband, Phon Sopheap, 29, is a local teacher and make $5 per day as well. This couple together has three school-aged children. Mrs. Seang T. is asking for a loan to purchase more silk to weave more scarves in the future.

loans.use: To purchase silk.

loans.name: Kalsoom Mai Tariq Mahmood Baig Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom mai baji is the wife of T. M. B. and has resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 12 years. She is 38 years old and the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. Kalsoom mai baji completed her education until the 10th standard and then she got married to her husband who has a very kind nature. Kalsoom mai baji learned the skill of embroidery and now runs her own boutique in the community. Her husband is a driver by profession and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw.

Kalsoom mai baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Yasmeen baji is requesting a loan to buy material (beads, sketches and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Reema baji is requesting a loan to buy bangles for her bangle selling business. Abida baji is requesting a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Samina baji is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Hoan

texts.en:
Hoan S., 24 years old, lives with her family in the province of Siem Reap in Cambodia. Her husband is a vegetable grower and they do not have any children. For over a year, she has been working in the rice trade business: collecting rice from farmers and re-selling it to earn profit. She currently earns average of $10 per day. 

Hoan S. believes her investment is doing well because she is gaining more regular customers. This business is S.'s main source of stable income for the family. In order to continue improving the business, S. is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy additional rice to sell in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Phin S., 44, pictured with her husband, is married and lives with her husband in the district of Bati, in the province of Takeo. Since 1990, she has been making and selling baskets to earn a living, and is able to make $1 per day. Her husband, Pen Chan, 52, grows rice and makes $1.30 per day. This couple has one child who works as a driver.
 
Mrs. Phin S. would like to take out a loan to purchase bamboo to make baskets.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo to make baskets.

loans.name: Abdul Rasheed Group

texts.en:
Najma baji is a wife of A. R. and a citizen of a city named Multan, Paksitan for the past 8 years. Her husband is a driver that drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). She is the mother of four sons who are involved in a bangle making business. They are experts in making steel bangles and they have the ability to make different shapes including round and triangle. It is common for the ladies of Multan to wear colorful steel bangles. Najma baji helps her sons make bangles by coloring them. They all have 15 years of experience in this business. She is applying for a loan to buy steel and paint to expand their bangle business.

Najma bajiis is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Shumaila baji is requesting a loan to buy a cart to sell vegetables. Bilquis baji is requesting a loan to buy material (clothes, beads and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Mussarat baji is requesting a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Khursheed begum baji is requesting a loan to buy various woods for her furniture making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy steel and paint for making bangles

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S. E. is 24 years old and lives with her husband in the district of Bati, in the province of Takeo. Since 2002, she and her husband together have been weaving scarves to earn a living, and are able to make $3 a day. This couple still live with their parents and other sisters and brothers. Mrs. Chea S. E. is asking for a loan to purchase more silk to weave scarves.

loans.use: To purchase more silk to weave scarves.

loans.name: Chhut

texts.en: Mrs. L. is a 51 year old mother of five who lives in Orkrom Village in Siem Reap province. Two of her children are married and three remain single. Mrs. L. grows rice, while her husband catches fish for a living. He catches them in Tonle Sap Lake which contains the most fish in Cambodia. To sustain and improve her husband's fishing business, Mrs. L. needs a loan to purchase more fishing materials.

loans.use: To purchase fishing material

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Lach P., 55, is married and lives with her husband and her child in the province of Siem Reap. She and her husband together have a business of catching and then selling fish at the market to earn approximately US$7 in net income per day. Mrs. Lach P. is asking for a loan to purchase a wooden boat and fishing nets for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun R., 32, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She works in a grocery store, making around $3 a day, while her husband works as a rice grower. This year the weather conditions seem good to every farmer, so he hopes to get more output than last year. This couple together has two school-aged children.

Mrs. Sun R. would like to take out a loan to add to her grocery store's inventory to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To add to her grocery store's inventory.

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
Tausi Msuya is 28 years old and single. She has a salon business. She started her business in 2005 and works daily from 7am until 11pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $228.

This will be Tausi’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her 1st loan to buy a dryer and has paid the loan back successfully. She hopes for a new loan to buy a foot-cleaning machine.

Tausi will share this loan with subgroup D of the Muheza group. The subgroup has 6 members, who run salons, sell food, fish and shoes. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Tausi is 1st on the left, standing.

loans.use: A foot-cleaning machine

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run R. is 31 years old and lives with her husband in the Siem Reap province. She makes and sells cakes in local markets near her house. On average, she makes $5 a day and her husband sells fish and earns $7.50 a day. They have five children; two are students and three are too young for school.

Run R. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase pigs. She will raise pigs with the intention of selling piglets and earning a profit. She is confident this will be a good business venture and will increase her income and her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Raise pigs.

loans.name: Tann

texts.en:
Tann L. is 51 years old, married with 2 children and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers who typically make $2.50 a day. The weather conditions have been good this year and they hope to have great crops in the upcoming harvest season. The have two school-aged children.

Tann L. is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
49-year-old Thuy Y. lives in Siem Reap province with his wife, Tit Sokha who is 38 years old, and their child. He earns a living by collecting and re-selling used goods from villagers. His wife grows various kinds of vegetable, like cabbages and morning glories, and also sells fish in the market. She earns approximately $6 per day.

Thuy Y. hopes to reduce the cost of transportation, therefore, he is applying for a loan to buy a motorcycle. The motorcycle will allow him to transport his family, as well as used goods that he sells.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Morn T. is 39 years old, married and lives in the Siem Reap province with three children, all students. She works in a grocery store making around US $3.50 each day and her husband typically makes US$5 a day selling wood. Inflation has caused prices to soar in Cambodia with recent hikes in food and rice prices have caused economic hardships for many Cambodians. Looking for ways to increase her income and combat rising expense costs, Morn T. is requesting a loan of US $400 to add her grocery’s inventory. She considers this loan an opportunity to increase her income and to expand her business.

loans.use: To add her grocery’s inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Im Ry Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people who live in Preak Treing village in Kandal province formed the village bank. They will use the loan for a variety of purposes. Mrs. Im R. owns a small groceR. store in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for the loan to buy more groceR. products for her inventoR.. Her husband, Mr. Ruos Choeun, owns a rice mill that has been hired by a villager. Mrs. Im R. is 30-year-old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. 

Four members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for the loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun B. is 27 years old, married and lives with his wife in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He is a mechanic fixing radio's, TV's and tapes. On average, he makes $5 a day. His wife runs a coffee shop from home and is able to make $2.50 a day. They have two young children. Chhun B. is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase mechanic tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase mechanic tools

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
Lydia M., age 46, is married with four children; ages 25, 22, 20 and 18. She has a mama lishe (café) where she sells all types of foods and cold drinks. She has been in this business since 2003 and works daily from 6am until 10pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $152. 

This will be Lydia’s fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous four loans to increase her food stocks.  She has paid the loans back successfully. Lydia now hopes for a new loan to buy more stock of cold drinks. 

Lydia will share this loan with subgroup A of the Muheza group. The subgroup has 7 members, who run shops, sell clothes, cold drinks and own salons. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Lydia is 1st on the right, in a green dress.

loans.use: To increase stock of cold drinks.

loans.name: Niem

texts.en: Mrs. P., 27 years old, works in the fish business. She buys fish from the local fishermen and re-sells them for a profit. She delivers the fish to her customers' homes by bicycle. Her husband, Mr. Yoeurn is 28 years old and works as a rice farmer. P. grows rice with her husband during the rainy and dry season. To gain a higher rice yield, P. needs a loan to purchase fertilizer. With the remaining money, she will put towards rental fees for farmland plowing.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Snguon

texts.en: Snguon S., age 50, lives in Siem Reap Province. She takes care of her two children who both live at home. For many years, she has serviced her neighbors with her flouring machine. She earns a profit of approximately $4 per day. Her husband, Phout Choum, is 52 years old. Since 2007, he's been making a living by repairing motorcycles and bicycles from his home. He normally earns $6 per day. Mrs. S. has applied for a loan to help her husband buy more repair materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy repair materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To diversify her business by adding clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Poay

texts.en:
Poay T. is a rice farmer who makes very little money. She is 44 years old and lives with her four children, two children are currently employed. One works as a security guard at Angkor Temple and a daughter sells souvenirs. They work very hard to provide a good income for their family. 

Poay T. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work to reduce the cost  her children spend everyday on public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: El

texts.en: El C. is 43 years old, married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a cleaner at a hospital and gets paid $70 a month. Her husband (pictured) makes $7 a day as a sculptor. They have two children, one is a student and the other is married but still lives at home. The married child has a business washing motorbikes at the market. Mrs. El C. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more washing tools for her child's business.

loans.use: To purchase more washing tools.

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en: Mr. S., 37, teaches secondary school, as well as grows rice on a farm. He is married to Mrs. Sreykhim who grows and sells vegetables.  They have three teenaged children living with them at home. His wife is a strong communicator who is able to attract regular customers. He believes they have the potential to earn more money if she rents a farming machine to people in his area. Therefore, Mr. S. would like to ask for a loan to purchase a farming machine.

loans.use: To purchase a farming machine

loans.name: Mrs. Sinat Chou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of nine people, is located in Chumrov village in Takeo province and all the members will use their loans for different purposes.

Mrs. Sinat C. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a silk weaver. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to weave in order to reach her customers’ demand. Her husband, Mr. Khon Kheng, is a farmer who owns 0.4-hecater to cultivate rice to earn a living. Mrs. Sinat C. is 40 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is four years old.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more silk to weave in order to reach her customers’ demand.

loans.name: Kam

texts.en:
Kam L. is 37 years old, married with 3 children. She is a housewife taking care of her children and cooking for them. The family is totally dependent on her husband, Chhum Seak, 40 years old (He was pictures on the left hand side), who works as sculptor. He makes about $10 a day. There children are students and currently in business short term selling souvenirs in front of Angkor Temple to help alleviate the family’s cost. 

Kam L. is requesting a US $1000 loan to purchase crafts and sell as souvenirs to tourists at Angkor Temple to bring in other income for the family.

loans.use: Sell souvenirs.

loans.name: Mrs. Sovanna Nuon Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people who all live in the Chumrov Village in the Takeo Province comprise this village bank loan and Mrs. Sovanna N. is the village bank president. She is a fruit seller and silk weaver. Since these two businesses are going well, she wants to expand them; so she decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruits to resell and she would use the rest of the loan to buy silk to weave for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Soeng Vutha, is a security guard who makes an insufficient salary to support the family. Mrs. Sovanna N. is 53 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruits to resell and to buy silk to weave

loans.name: Amna M. Ashfaq Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Amna baji is a 45 year old married woman and that has resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 9 years. Her poor circumstances growing up did not allow her to receive an education. Her husband's name is M. A. A. who is a watchman for a school and receives a monthly wage. Amna baji is a mother of five kids: two sons and three daughters. Her oldest son runs a PCO, public calling office, where people come to make calls and pay fees by the minute. Her younger son runs a tea stall in the food market. Her daughters are receiving their education from a school located near the house. Amna baji runs a boutique where she displays her dress collection. She displays two kinds of dresses: one is a designed stitched dress and the second are embroidered dresses. She is applying for a loan to buy material (cloth, beads and sketches) to improve the income of her boutique.

Amna baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Kosar parveen baji is requesting a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Shamim baji is requesting a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sumera baji is requesting a loan to buy burgers, eggs, cooking oil and spices for her burger joint.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for a dress boutique

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Kem S. lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her child. She sells groceries to earn a living and is able to make $4 a day. She is helped by her child, who works as farmer growing rice and some vegetables. Her child grows rice two times a year during the dry and rainy season.

Kem S. would like a loan of $400 to purchase fertilizers and rice seed.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and rice seed.

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Hout K. is 41 years old and is a true entrepreneur. She has her own business catching and selling fish and making hammocks to sell in the market. She is able to make $2.50 a day while her husband Sa Lann, 45 years old, has a business catching fish. He makes about $3 a day. They have seven children, two are students and four are fisherman. 

Mrs. Hout K. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more fishing tools to catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tools.

loans.name: Saleem Javed Group

texts.en:
Saleem J. baji is a 43 years old married woman and resides in a city named Multan, Pakistan which is famous for its shrines. She was unable to receive an education due to her lack of financial resources. Her husband, J. S., is a government employee. Saleem J. baji is the mother of seven children: five sons and two daughters. Her oldest son works in a factory. Another works in a general store. Her other children are receiving an education from a school which is located near their house. Saleem baji sells children's clothing which helps her husband meet the financial expenses of the family. She feels fortunate to be living in Multan because people come to buy clothes from different cities. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

Saleem J. baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Rukhsana baji is requesting a loan to buy calling cards to resell. Abida parveen baji is requesting a loan to buy medicines for her medical store. Rasoolan baji is requesting a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Sardaran Ghulam Safdar Group

texts.en:
Sardaran baji is a 58 year old married woman that has resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is G. S. and he works in a factory for a monthly wage. Sardaran baji and her husband have no children. For the past 15 years, Sardaran baji has been helping her husband with his scrap business. She is applying for a loan to buy scrap (plastic bottles and waste papers) to expand her scrap business.

Sardaran baji is a group leader of some more women in her locality. Khursheed baji is requesting a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Rubina shaheen baji is requesting a loan to buy biscuits and chips at wholesale in order to sell to shops. Zubaida baji is requesting a loan to buy scissors and razors for her barbershop. Zareena baji is requesting a loan to buy milk for her milk selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap for a scrap business.

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: 36-year-old K. is a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province. She works as both a cultivator and a seamstress in her village. For eight years, she has been sewing clothes, a skill she learned from her grandmother. Her husband, Mr. Dong Seum, 43, works at the CMAC Organization earning $180 a month to support his family. K. is asking for a loan of $1000 to build a well at her home. She hopes this will help her expand her business, as well as improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To build a well

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru:
Женщина с большим опытом предпринимательской деятельности Зухра  родилась 1957 года. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Зухра 10 лет занимается продажей женскими различными платками и  шарфами. А также в ее ассортименте большой выбор банных и кухонных полотенец, разновидность постельного белья и подушек. Местом ее деятельности является оптовый рынок "Корвон". Закупает она товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон» 
Зухра хочет получить займ 3000 сомони на 9 месяцев, чтоб закупить сезонный товар.
texts.en:
Zuhra is a woman with an extensive experience in entrepreneurship. She was born in 1957, she is married and has four children. Zuhra has been selling different kinds of women's shawls and scarves for ten years. Also, in her inventory there are bathroom and kitchen towels as well as a variety of bed linens and pillows. Her place of business is on the wholesale market Korvon. She buys the merchandise on the same wholesale market Korvon. Zuhra wants to get a loan for 3000 somoni (USD$875) for a 9 months term to buy seasonal merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy towels and bed linens

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace V. lives in Barangay Yeban Sur in Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is already a widow and was left with three children: Mark Anthony– 15 years old, third year in high school; Mark Kevin– 13 years old, first year in high school; and Mary Ann– six years old, an elementary student.  

She solely took all the responsibilities in making a living for her family. Grace is just thankful that she had already established her sari-sari store (community based store) before her husband died. Through her business, she was able to send her children to school and provide for the immediate needs of her family.

Grace hopes for progress with her small business so that she can support the needs of her family. At present, she is asking for financial assistance from the lenders amounting to PHP 12,000 to purchase more stock for her store. She also intends to use some of the loan for their farming needs.  

According to Grace, committing everything to the Lord is not enough; it should be accompanied with good works, patience, perseverance, and faith to become successful. Grace is praying that her children will someday finish their studies and have a decent jobs in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: Sugran Basharat Ali Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is the wife of B. A. and has been a citizen of Multan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband is a shopkeeper and, for the past 5 years, has been running a grocery store in the community. She is the mother of two sons. Her oldest son is involved in a fruit selling business. Her youngest son is 10 years old. Sugran baji is involved in a clothing selling business. She buys clothes from the famous market of Multan and sells them in her local community. Sugran baji is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her clothing selling business.

Sugran baji is a group leader of some more women in her locality. Khadija baji is requesting a loan to buy clothes for her clothing selling business. Hamidan baji is requesting a loan to buy materials like cloth, sketches and colored thread for her decorative embroidery business. Sobia baji is requesting a loan to buy meat for her meat selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Nouriatou

texts.fr: Née en 1970 à Badou et mère de quatre (04) enfants, Mme Nouriatou O. est une femme très dévouée et dynamique qui fait le commerce de légumineuses et ingrédients de cuisine (piments secs et verts, oignons, cubes…) et plusieurs autres articles de ménages. Très appréciée dans le marché de la place où elle exerce, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner régulièrement en grande quantité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et s’occuper d’avantage de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Badou and mother of four children, Mrs. Nouriatou O. is a very dedicated and dynamic woman who runs a business selling edible plants and cooking ingredients (e.g., dried peppers and green chilis, onions, seasoning cubes) and various other household items. Highly thought of in the marketplace where she sells her goods, Mrs. O. is requesting a loan in order to be able to stock up with large quantities of goods on a regular basis. This will allow her to better meet the needs of her customers and take better care of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cooking ingredients

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas L. is a store owner in the village of Yeban Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela. Their place was formerly a hacienda which is prone to flooding. Felicitas is already 58 years old and married to Elpidio, a farmer. Their marriage is blessed with three children, all male and they are: Elmer– 36 years old, Elizaldy– 32 years old, and Eddie– 26 years old. All of their children have only completed their studies at the elementary level.  

Felicitas has been managing the business for almost ten years and was somehow able to develop her store. Aside from selling basic commodities like soap, snack foods, and soft drinks, she is now selling vegetables that are displayed in front of her store. Felicitas wanted her business to expand, so she is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 that she will use as additional capital for her store. Through the program, she has been encouraged to work hard and be patient in paying her loans for the sake of her business' progress and her family's living.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: Humilité Group

texts.en: Mbenza sells fresh fish, manioc and corn flour. He has been in business since 1977. He started selling spare car parts in Matadi in Lower Congo which is about 350 km from Kinshasa. His first business was prosperous, but collapsed due to the currency devaluation that took place in 1981. He lost about $200 of his running capital. He then went to work for a company until 2005. He stopped working and relunched his own business. His business makes about $120 per week. Mbenza planned with the first loan from Hope to diversify his business by buying palm oil. He has two points of sale within his community in order to make more income.  His dream is to open a large general boutique. Mbenza is 55 years old, married and a father of four children between the ages of 3 and 34.  Of his children, one is already married, one is at secondary school, and two at primary school. Through his business, Mbenza has been able to support his family. He also likes it because it gives him the opportunity to make contacts with many different people, and once they become permanent clients he is able to offer them quality products at a better price. His plan is to open a storage depot.

loans.use: To purchase two containers of palm oil

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Aajer Safy Group

texts.en:
Hajera is the group leader of Hajera Safy group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive a loan for his/her own business.

Malally and Hajera want to take out a loan for their business of beading, and Howsey wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. Galally wants to take out a loan for her husband’s business. They all want to buy necessary materials for their businesses.

They want to say that this loan is very useful because it can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses and become stronger in their business and life. This group wants to thank all the lenders for this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials for their individual businesses

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen T. is 45 years old, married with three children living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She makes and sells Khmer food in the local market to earn a living and is able to make $2.50 a day. Her husband Hung Yoeun, 49, makes about $2.50 a day as a farmer growing rice. Two of their children are farmers and one is a student. 

Mrs. Pen T. is requesting a loan from Kiva via CREDIT to purchase a motorbike for her son to operate a taxi.

loans.use: To operate a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Moul

texts.en: Moul N., age 36, raises pigs in a stall next to her home in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia.  She also grows vegetables (e.g., cabbage, morning glory, and cucumbers) and sells them to a market vendor three months after they mature. She is married to Khy Savuth who is 46 years old. He grows vegetables with Mrs. N., as well as drives a taxi motorcycle to earn a daily income. The couple are responsible for four children who are all currently attending school. Mrs. N. recently sold all her pigs, and now she hopes to acquire more pigs to raise. She would like to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Mr Mawulom Kokou N. est né en 1954 à Kovié où il pratique la culture de mais et de manioc. Marié avec quatre (04) enfants à charge, il demande un financement pour agrandir sa surface cultivable, acheter intrants et fertilisants pour avoir un rendement meilleur. Les revenus tirés lui permettront de mieux scolariser ses enfants et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Mawulom Kokou N. was born in 1954 in Kovié where he grows corn and manioc. Married, with four children to take care of, he is asking for a loan to increase the area he cultivates, and buy seeds, plant food and fertilizers for a better crop yield. The income generated will allow him pay his children’s school fees and improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the area he culivates and buy seeds, plant food and fertilizers

loans.name: Sadjida

texts.ru:
Салихова Саджида предприниматель с 10–и летним стажем. Ей 52 года, у нее 4 детей. Она занимается торговлей женской и мужской одежды на оптовом рынке «Корвон».  С связи с тяжелым финансовым положением она при помощи знакомых решила начать свой бизнес. На свои сбережения она арендовала маленькое место на базаре и стала заниматься продажей детской одежды. Получаемый доход стал основным источником в ее семейном бюджете. Закупает Саджида товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон» и с поставщиков с Китая. Ассортимент товара составляет брюки, юбки, пуловер, вязаные платья и сорочки. 
Саджида хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони  сроком на 9 месяцев, чтобы пополнить ассортимент товара.
texts.en:
Sadjida S. is a businesswoman with a 10 year experience. She is 52 years old and has four children. She sells women's and men's clothing on the wholesale market Korvon. Due to her difficult financial situation she decided to start her own business with the help of her friends. She used her savings to rent a small space on the market and started selling children's clothes. The profits from this business became the main income source in her family's budget. Sadjida buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Korvon from suppliers from China. Her inventory includes pants, skirts, pullovers, knitted dresses and blouses. Sadjida wants to get a loan for 3000 somoni (USD$875) for a 9 months term to fulfill the assortment of her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy men's pants

loans.name: Hobly N’Dokpo

texts.fr: Agé de 57 ans, Mr Hobly N’Dokpo A. est marié et père de huit (08) enfants. Couturier de formation, il est très dynamique au travail. Afin de s’acheter de nouvelles machines à coudre et mieux équiper son atelier, il sollicite un financement. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr Hobly N’Dokpo A. is 57 years old, married and father of eight children. Trained as a tailor, he is very dynamic in his work. He is requesting a loan in order to buy new sewing machines and better equip his workshop. This will allow Mr. A. to increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and work equipment

loans.name: Rukhsana M.yousaf Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji is a 33 years old married woman that has resided in Multan, Pakistan for the past 30 years. Her husband's name is M. who works as a delivery man delivering different items (construction supplies, furniture) from one place to another on a donkey cart. She is the mother of four kids: one son and three daughters. None of her children attend school. Rukhsana baji is involved in a decorative embroidery business. She makes made-to-order embroidered dresses and charges $3 per dress. She is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart for her husband because the old cart is in very poor condition.

Rukhsana baji is a group leader of some more women in her locality. Najma baji is requesting a loan to buy clothes for her clothing selling business. Nargis mai baji and Yasmeen baji each are requesting a loan to buy burgers, eggs, cooking oil and spices for their burger joints. Iram baji is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for delivering.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru:
Сайфуллоева Парвина одна из молодых предпринимателей в городе Душанбе. Ей 21 год, не замужем. С самого детства Парвина любила шить. После средней школы, решила развивать свои способности в этом направлении. Как она говорит – «Женщина должна уметь шить». Так и начала свой бизнес с шитья национальной одежды. Сейчас она шьет платья со штанами, детские одежды, а также делает реставрации. У нее своя швейная машинка. Парвина имеет много постоянных клиентов.
Хочет получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони для закупа сырья: нить, основной и прокладочный материал  и другие принадлежности.
texts.en:
Parvina S. is one of the young entrepreneurs of the city of Dushanbe. She is 21 years old, not married. Parvina loves to sew since she was a child. After graduating from school she decided to develop her skills in this direction. As she says - "A woman must know how to sew." She started her business by sewing national Tajik clothing. Right now she makes dresses with pants, children's clothes and also restores old ones. She has her own sewing machine. Parvina has many regular clients.

She wants to get a loan for 4000 somoni (USD$1050) to buy raw materials: threads, fabrics and lining materials and other supplies.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials: threads, fabric and supplies

loans.name: Philippe

texts.fr: Né en 1973 à Lomé, Mr Philippe T. est marié et père de six (06) enfants avec quatre (04) autres personnes à charge. Eleveur très réputé de pondeuses et poulets de chair dans son milieu, il toujours travailler en collaboration avec des vétérinaires qualifiés et des agents techniques d’élevage et d’agriculture. Afin de renouveler son stock de pondeuses et acheter les provendes et médicaments, il sollicite un financement. Ce financement va lui permettre d’augmenter ses ventes quotidiennes d’œufs et augmenter ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Philippe T. was born in Lomé in 1973. He's married and the father of six children, and he has four additional persons to support. A well-known poultry and laying hens breeder in his community, he always work in connection with qualified veterinarians and technical breeder and agriculture agents. In order to renew his flock of laying hens, and to buy feed and medications, he's seeking a loan. This loan will enable him to increase his daily eggs sales, and its profit.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy laying hens, medications, and feed

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
At the age of 45, Mrs. N. is widowed and working as a rice farmer in Saphjea Village in Siem Reap Province. She has five children, one of whom is married and lives away from the family home. To help support the family, three of her children (two daughters and one son) are employed as construction workers earning $150 per month. These days, Mrs. N.'s family faces difficulty because her house is old with maN. things needing repair. She is asking for a loan to purchase wood for reparations in order to improve her family's living conditions. 

Her daughter is shown in the photo because she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase wood for housing repairs

loans.name: Rukshana Ghulam Sarwar Group

texts.en:
Rukshana baji is a 44 year old married woman that has resided in Multan, Pakistan for the past 13 years. Her husband's name is G. S. and he works in a factory for a monthly wage. She is the mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters. Her oldest daughter helps Rukshana baji make embroidered clothes. The remaining children are enrolled in a local school located near their house. Rukhsana baji makes embroidered dresses to help her husband meet the financial expenses. She is applying for a loan to buy material such as colored thread and cloth for her embroidery business.

Rukshana baji is a group leader of some more women in her locality. Parveen begum baji is requesting a loan to buy clothes for her clothing selling business. Shamim baji is requesting a loan to buy rice to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Blandine Afi

texts.fr: Marié et mère de quatre (04) enfants Mme Blandine Afi A. est une jeune femme très courageuse dont l’activité principale est le stockage et la vente de mais et de haricots. Afin de stocker en grande quantité ces céréales pendant la période d’abondance et les revendre en période de pénurie, elle demande un crédit à cette fin. Les revenus tirés de ce commerce lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux charges du ménage.
texts.en:
A married mother of four, Mrs. Blandine Afi Amecor is a very courageous young woman whose main business is the storing and selling of corn and beans. In order to store these crops in large quantities during periods of abundance and sell them in periods of shortage, she is seeking this loan. The profits made from this business will allow her to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Storing and selling grains

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites L., 32 years old, is married and blessed with four children, and they are: John Paul– ten years old, a graduating elementary student; JR– eight years old, in the third grade; Jayvee– four years old; and Princess– two years old. Her husband, Wilbert works as a security guard. The couple is striving to work for the future of their children and to provide them with proper education. Her family lives in Barangay Yeban Sur of Benito Soliven, a muddy place during the rainy season and one with poor road conditions, but a peaceful place nonetheless. 

Marites is engaged in tobacco planting and vending. Out of their income, the couple was able to meet the daily needs of their family. However, Marites was not satisfied with it. She wants to have a better way of living. For this, Marites wants to avail a loan of PHP 4,000 to support her tobacco products. Hard work, patience, and faith to God are some of the keys that she believes will lead her to the success of her business and the achievement of her goals in life.

loans.use: Capital to support a tobacco growing and vending business

loans.name: Abdulaha Group

texts.en:
There are five members in this group called Abdulaha Panjshiry. All of them would like to receive money for his or her business to purchase more materials for their businesses in order to provide a good income for their families in the future. 

Arozo and Mayda Bibi want to buy one or two new sewing machines for their tailoring businesses. Shakarya and Saltana want to buy more stock for her husband’s general store business. Nazefa wants to take out a loan for her tailoring business. They all want to see their businesses expand so that they can earn more money to support their families.

With this loan they will be able to develop their businesses and support their families, to provide them with a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Leum

texts.en:
Leum R. is a rice dealer and makes $6 a day while her husband is a village chief and earns less than $1 per day. She is 34 years old, married with two school aged children and lives in Siem Reap Province with her family.

Mrs. Leum R. is asking a loan of $1000 to expand her rice stock to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice for sale.

loans.name: Edilyn

texts.en:
Edilyn G. operates a community store that offers basic commodities. Aside from that, she also sells vegetables, fish, and pork meat. Her husband, Dominador supports her in the business through his income from working as a driver. Together they work hand in hand to support the future education of their two children: Ed Dominic– seven years old, in the first grade, and Shandy Nicole– two years old.  

Edilyn hopes to purchase more stock for her store and vegetables for her vending business. With this plan, she wants to avail a loan of PHP 5,000 to increase her capital as she is striving hard for the development of her business and for her family to build their own house. Edilyn said that she must start to save money for their future plans and needs to be patient. Her dreams motivate her to think positively in order to achieve them.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store and vegetable vending

loans.name: Kowuvi

texts.fr: Mr Kowuvi T. est né en 1983 à Tsévié. N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller loin dans ses études, il est vite entré dans une société de vente et de réparation d’appareil électroniques et de réfrigérateurs usagers. Après la fin de son apprentissage, il ouvrit son propre atelier de réparation et de vente de réfrigérateur. Grâce à son savoir faire, il a gagné la confiance de sa clientèle. Il sollicite un financement pour acheter un stock important de réfrigérateurs et de congélateurs usagers au port de Lomé et les revendre. Cela contribuera énormément à accroître son chiffre d’affaires et ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr Kowuvi T. was born in Tsévié. Not having had the chance to pursue his studies much, he got hired early on by a company selling and repairing electronic appliances and used refrigerators. After finishing his training, he opened his own workshop to sell and repair refrigerators. Thanks to his know-how, he won the trust of his clientele. He's seeking a loan to buy a large stock of used refrigerators and freezers in the port of Lomé, in order to resell them. This will help him greatly increase his revenue and his profit.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat et vente de réfrigérateur usagers

loans.name: Avegael

texts.en:
Avegael N. is a vegetable vendor in the village of Yeban Sur. She was married to Frederick when she was 18 years old. Their son, Alvin Jay is now six years old and already in elementary school. They are living in an agricultural area where the majority of the residents are farmers and corn is the main crop.  

Avegael chooses to engage in the vegetable vending business to help her husband earn a living with the hopes of uplifting their poor living conditions.  

To further improve her vending business, she wants to ask for a loan of PHP 4,000 which she will utilize to buy different vegetables that she will sell in their neighborhood. Avegael and her husband are also planting vegetable seeds in their backyard so that they do not have to depend too much on their capital. In this way, they can also increase their income. She and her husband will work hard to maintain their livelihood for their family to have a better way of living and for their son to continue his education.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat P. was born in 1975. She is married with four children, all of whom are still single and living in the family home.  For over three years, Mrs. P. has worked in her own grocery business. She works hard everyday so her business is thriving. Her husband, Choeun Chat, age 34, lives in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. He is a farmer who grows different kinds of plants to sell. He currently earns an income of $2 per day to manage his family's food expenses. 

Recently, Mrs. P. sold all her grocery up until there was very little stock left. Mrs. P. is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase more valuable stock to store and sell.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory

loans.name: Muy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chreb is a 34-year-old rice farmer who lives in Khlakhmom Village in Siem Reap Province. She is married to Mr. Han and they have four children, all of whom are young and currently in school. Her husband makes wooden bed frames for a living. His business is going well because he makes good quality and attractive bed frames. He earns approximately $2 per day for his work. His business is the main source of income for the family. Due to higher demand, Mrs. Chreb is asking for a loan to purchase wood stocks to make more bed frames. 

Mr. Han is shown in the photo because Mrs. Chreb was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase wood stocks to make bed frames

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita D. is 50 years old and married to Leorifo, a farmer in their village. They have two children: Leonita, 32 years old, a college graduate working as a teacher, and Leorifo Jr., 30 years old, an agriculture graduate involved in the farming business like his father. Their family lives in the rural area of Yeban Sur in Benito Soliven, Isabela. 

Anita is glad that she was able to achieve one of her ambitions, providing her children with their education. Now, she is focusing on her sari-sari store business (a community based store) which became her partner in supporting the immediate needs of their family, emergency needs, and farming activities. Thus, she doesn’t want to lose the business that gave them their livelihood. Anita wants to maintain her store, so she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 so she can purchase additional merchandise. 

Although she is getting older, Anita needs to work hard to achieve her dream of becoming a successful entrepreneur. Her strength comes from the support of her husband, children, and grandchildren.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Mme Pauline E. est née en 1957 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, elle a su vite se prendre en charge en créant sa propre boutique de vente en gros et en détail de riz, de sucre et d’œufs. Aujourd’hui sa clientèle devient de plus en plus importante, ce qui l’oblige à s’approvisionner fréquemment pour faire face à leur demande. Pour y faire face, elle sollicite un financement pour ravitailler en stock important de marchandises. Ainsi elle pourra accroître considérablement ses chiffres d’affaires et ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. Pauline E. was born in 1957 in Tsévié. Married and the mother of five, she quickly discovered how to make it on her own by creating her own shop selling rice, sugar, and eggs at the retail and wholesale levels. Today, her customers are more and more numerous, and this forces her to get supplies frequently to cope with the demand. To address the situation, she is requesting financing to replenish her stock signifcantly. She will then be able to grow her sales figures and profits considerably.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retaile and wholesale commerce in rice, sugar, and eggs

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel operates a small store while her husband works in a bakeshop in their village. They live in a flooded and rugged place. However, the couple is blessed with two healthy children: Nhimfa Mae– five years old, a preschool student, and Mery Hasley– three years old. 

Maricel wishes to help her husband in providing for the growing needs of their family. So, she established a small store in their village for them to have an alternative source of income. Due to the prevailing increase of merchandise, Maricel would like to borrow a loan of PHP 5,000 that she will use to buy additional commodities for her store.  

She needs to work hard for her to have a progressive life for the sake of her family. Maricel believes that God is always there for them to direct and guide them.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Perlina

texts.en:
Perlina is looking forward to the success of her business selling onions in their village. They live in a rural area where farming is the main source of living and crops are their main products.  

Her husband works as a farmer and a heavy equipment operator. They are blessed with four children; three of them did not finish high school while the youngest is still studying and already a second year high school student.  

Perlina is requesting a loan amount of PHP 5,000 that she wants to use as additional capital for her onion retailing business. She has been in the business for seven years and she would like it to become stable so she can continue to support the education of her youngest child. Perlina even works double time to overcome life difficulties. She also needs to be patient in order to become successful.

loans.use: To purchase more onions to resell

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Né le 26 Septembre 1974 à Dapaong, Mr Kossi D. est père d’un enfant. Menuisier de formation, il associé à son métier la vente de planches et de chevrons. Les commandes se font à l’intérieur du pays dans les dans les grandes exploitations de bois où le bois coûte moins cher et les revend aux entreprises et ateliers de menuiserie. Afin de se ravitailler régulièrement et assurer une fourniture constante à sa clientèle, il sollicite un financement. Il pourra accroître ses bénéfices et faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on September 26, 1974 in Dapaong, Mr. Kossi D. is the father with one child. A furniture maker by training, he is adding to his trade the sale of planks and rafters. Special orders are made up-state in plantations, where wood costs less and is sold to enterprises and carpentry shops. To resupply himself regularly and to ensure a constant supply to his customers, he is requesting financing. He will be able to increase his profits and address the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell planks and rafters

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome M. is 53 years old and a mother of five. She had five male children: Benedict– 36 years old, a high school graduate; Bernardo– 34 years old, a high school undergraduate; Jil– 32 years old, also a high school graduate; Mamerto– 30 years old, a college graduate in agribusiness; and the youngest, Sabelo– 29 years old, a college undergraduate. They live in a flooded area in Yeban Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela.  

Salome is engaged in selling secondhand RTW’s (ready to wear clothes) in their village. She started in this kind of business when her children stopped their studies. She plans to buy more secondhand clothes from abroad to sell in their village. For this, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 4,000 that will greatly support her business financially.  Salome prays that her loan will be granted and for her business to grow so she can have her own stall in the public market of Benito Soliven. For her, diligence and perseverance are the keys to success. She would always like to be strong in order to overcome the challenges in life.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell and to enlarge her business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia L. is 45 years old and a village store owner in Yeban Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela. They live in a flood prone area in a former private hacienda. She is married to Mauricio and has four children: Virgilio– 23 years old, an elementary graduate; Belinda– 20 years old, a high school graduate; Estelita– 19 years old, also a high school graduate and working as a domestic helper; and Marvin– 15 years old, a high school undergraduate. Due to the lack of financial resources, they were not able to provide their children with higher levels of education and because some of her children lack the interest to study. 

For 15 years, Leticia was able to maintain her village store through the help of her husband and the financial support of a microfinance institution. She hopes to engage in another type of business in the future and to be able to support her husband in his farming needs since they no longer have children to send to school. She knows that she must work hard in order to achieve her business plan someday and to avoid asking for credit from traders that offer large interests. With this, Leticia would like to borrow a loan of PHP 7,000 that she will invest for her store and farming needs.

loans.use: To maintain and further develop her store

loans.name: Azia

texts.fr: Mme Azia S. est née en 1980 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Elle est une femme très dévouée qui exerce comme activité la vente des ustensiles et objets en plastique dans le marché de sa localité. Elle a réussit à conquérir la confiance de ses clients. Afin d’élargir son élargir son étalage et constituer un grand stock de marchandises, elle sollicite un financement. Des revenus tirés à travers son commerce, elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Azia S. was born in Lomé in 1980. She's married and the mother of four children. She's a very devoted woman, who runs a business selling plastic kitchen utensils in the village market. She managed to gain the trust of her clientele. To expand her stand and to build a large stock of goods, she's seeking a loan. Thanks to the income generated by her business, she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell plastic kitchen utensils

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita T. is already 52 years old. She is married to Alfredo, a farmer and they have six children; most of them are high school graduates and some are college undergraduates. Their youngest is still studying and already a college student.   

Despite their life struggle from poverty, Teresita has managed to maintain her sari-sari store (community based store) business for more than two years. According to her, she was able to make it because of her love for her family and with their help. She hopes to develop her business for them to have a better way of living.  

Teresita wants to borrow a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock for the maintenance of her store. She said that they must continue to work hard to attain her goals in the business and to help her husband at the same time.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: 7-Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Loan Group 7 consists of seven poor women, all of whom live in Dong Hai commune, Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.

Mrs. Bui Thi Quynh Huong is the lead borrower of the group. She is 27 years old, married, and has a one year old daughter. This is Mrs. Huong's fourth loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women ("FPW") and she is borrowing 1,963,500 Vietnamese Dong ("VND") (~US$113). All of her previous loans have been repaid on time and in full. Mrs. Huong will use the proceeds from this loan to buy women's clothes in the Vuon Hoa market, which she will then resell from her stall in the Quang Hung market. Mrs. Huong will reinvest the profits from this loan in her business.

Mrs. Lê Thị Thảo is borrowing 1,963,500 VND to buy sugar, salt, towels, candy, biscuits and bread for resale.  This is her fourth loan; her previous three loans have been repaid on time and in full.

Mrs. N. Thị Hồng is borrowing 1,626,900 VND (~ US$94) to buy chicken and ducks that she will raise and then resell.  She will also buy fruit which she will then resell in her village.  This is Mrs. Hồng's first loan from the Fund for Poor Women. 

Mrs. Lê Thị Huệ is borrowing 1,626,900 VND (her first loan) to buy fruit such as apples, oranges and bananas for resale in her village.

Both Mrs. Lê Thị Ngọc and Mrs. Lê Thị Tươi are borrowing 1,963,500 VND to buy and raise chickens and pigs for eventual resale in the Đông Hải market.  Mrs Lê Thị Ngọc will also purchase fish to resell in the market.  For both borrowers, this is their fourth loan from the Fund for Poor Women; all previous loans have been repaid on time and in full.

Mrs. N. Thị Huyền is borrowing 1,626,900 VND to invest in her Cháo Lươn store, from which she sells swamp-eel, rice, onions and water.

loans.use: To buy sugar, oranges, bananas, fish, salt, and onions.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer A., 32 years old, is married and has three children: Kenneth James– already 11 years old, an elementary student; Kathlene Joy– nine years old, also an elementary student; and Kris John– two years old. His wife, Vivian takes care of their children and gives him moral support with the business. They live in a peaceful environment in Barangay San Manuel, Naguillan, Isabela. 

Jenifer is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 that will support him financially in his special chicharon (a crispy snack made from carabao skin) making and vending business. He was able to register his business with the Department of Trade and Industry (DTI) with the name 3KJ Special Chicharon. He intends to use the loan to purchase cans of cooking oil, which is a main ingredient in his manufacturing business, carabao skin, and bundles of plastic for packaging the products. 

He strongly believes that his success lies beyond sacrifice and perseverance. These were the words he always put to mind as he strived to achieve his dream of improving his business in order to provide all the needs of the family and to send all his children to school. Jenifer is also hoping to attend some business development trainings such as labeling and marketing for the promotion of his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients to produce and sell his products

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Agée de 26 ans, Mme Eya A. est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Ayant depuis son enfance une passion pour le commerce des chaussures, elle n’a pas hésité à se lancer dans cette activité dès que l’occasion s’est offerte à elle. Pour assurer un service constant et stable à sa clientèle, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner régulièrement en marchandises. Cela va donner un coup de pousse à son commerce qu’elle aime tant et accroître ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eya A., age 26, is married and the mother of two children. Being, since her childhood, passionate about the shoe selling business, she didn't hesitate to start her own when the chance arose. To ensure a constant and stable service to her clientele, she's seeking a loan to get supplies on a regular basis. This will bolster the business she loves so much, and increase her income.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell shoes

loans.name: Aziza Group

texts.en:
There are four members in the Aziza group, and they would like to receive a loan for their businesses. Nafesa and Aziza R., the group's leader, want to take out a loan to buy more materials for her husband's business of carpet weaving. Marjan wants to take out a loan for her brother's business of selling car parts, so that he can increase his stock. Leada wants to take out a loan to expand her beadwork business.

They all want to increase the businesses with the loans. They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan. They want to thank AFSG and Kiva lenders from around the world.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Moung's Group

texts.en: Mrs. C., age 53, is the selected leader of a small group loan with four members. Mrs. C. runs a business renting bass speakers to villagers for different occasions, including wedding parties and ceremonies. Her strong communication skills have helped her business grow successfully. She earns approximately $1.5 per day. Her husband is a civil servant in the Education Ministry. They has eight children. Two are married while another two are single and employed as staff at a hotel. Mrs. C. is requesting a loan to purchase more bass speakers so that she can meet the growing demands from customers.

loans.use: To purchase more bass speakers

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 44 year old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, a southern suburb of Lebanon. Amal has been selling household tools for a year. In her shop, she sells home supplies, children's gifts and accessories. Amal is special in her work because she knows a lot of people in her area. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the start-up capital. She decided on doing her business because she wanted to work and have independent work. In the future, she plans on expanding her business and improving her income. 

Amal has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase household tools like dishes, glasses, cutlery, accessories and other things. This is the first time that Amal has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase household tools.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 23 year old engaged woman living in Bourj el Barajneh, a southern suburb of Lebanon. Rima has been working as a home hairdresser for a year. She has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new hairdressing tools and purchase her wedding dress. Rima has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time.
The loan has greatly helped Rima and her family financially. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She decided on doing this business because she had the experience as well as training. In the future, she plans on opening a salon.

loans.use: To purchase new hairdressing tools and to purchase her wedding dress.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 36 year old woman living in Bourj el Barajneh, a southern suburb of Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Nidal has been working as a home hairdresser for eleven years. Nidal decided on opening her ownbusiness because she likes her work. Nidal's clients are her friends and neighbors. To make more money, she plans on opening a salon. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for her business and to open a salon. This is the first time that Nidal has requested a loan.
