loans.use: To purchase hairdressing tools and to open a salon.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana I. is 45 years old and she is married with 4 children. Christiana lives in Benin City, Edo state. She sells yams and garri. She has lots of customers and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs Kiva loan assistance to expand her business. She needs a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and garri to sell

loans.name: Daed

texts.en:
Daed is a 52 year old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, a southern suburb of Lebanon with her husband. Daed has been working as a home product salesperson for three years. She sells medicine, cosmetics and cleaning products. Daed does well because she is motivated and wants to open a clothing shop. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others.  When she first started her business, she had difficulties getting clients but she has no problems now. Daed decided on opening her own business because she has always liked working. In the future, she plans on expanding her business and opening a clothing shop
. 
Daed has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for her work. This is the first time that Daed has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Nou's Group

texts.en:
Nou T., a 56 year old widow is the leader of a small five member group loan. Since 1998, she has been selling Khmer cakes at the Phsa Kraom Market. The cake is made by boiling flour and banana. Ms. T. is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make more cakes. She has five children of whom three are single and two are married.  Three of her children are working as waiters in a restaurant and earn $260 per month. 

All the borrowers live in Sala Komreuk Commune, Siem Reap Province. Seng T., age 47, is requesting a loan to purchase more coconut oil to sell. Pov C., age 32, is requesting a loan to buy ingredient to make more cakes. Sem S., 54 years old, is asking for a loan to expand her wine distilling business. Suo V. needs a loan to begin a new investment as a grocery seller.

loans.use: To buy more cake ingredients

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 44 year old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh with her husband and their three children. She has been working in handicrafts for ten years. She sews wedding dresses and bridA. parties’ dresses. Hiyam does very good work and has good relationships with her clients. Hiyam decided on doing her business to improve her family financiA. situation. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.
Hiyam has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua to purchase more merchandise for her work and to register her car. This is the first time that Hiyam has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and to register her car.

loans.name: Deyana Group

texts.en:
Deyana is the leader of the Deyana loan group. There are three members in this group. Each of them would like to receive a part of the loan for expand their business. 

Najeya and Deyana want to use the loan for their carpet weaving business to buy a new machine, and Faryda wants to use the loan to open a shop for her beading business. They also want to stock necessary materials for their businesses. 

That want  to say that they appreciate these new loans that help strengthen their businesses and to thank Kiva for its support of small business in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials to operate and expand their businesses.

loans.name: Imade

texts.en:
Imade I. is 45 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Imade sells drinks and provisions such as loaves of bread, tinned tomatoes, noodles, etc. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

Imade's husband is a welder, and they both make sure their children are in private school despite the cost, as public schools often go on strikes. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks, & foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Iyekeorentin

texts.en: Iyekeorentin O. is 38 years old and she is married with 4 children. Iyekeorentin lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells notebooks and kitchen utensils. She has lots of customers and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs Kiva loan assistance to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more notebooks and kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more notebooks and household products to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. sells beef. She is 40 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more beef to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul O. is 58 years old and married with 5 children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Paul sells building materials such as nails, paint brushes, etc. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius O. is 45 years old and married with 6 children. He is a LAPO client and he lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He needs the loan amount of N170,000 to purchase more animal feed, raw materials and medicines to sell. He says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more animal feed, raw materials, & medicines to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Pensando En El Futuro Group

texts.en:
Ana R. R. is a coordinator for the group Mujeres Pensando en el Futuro (Women Thinking of the Future).  Her group has five members.  Ana is 58 years old, and her husband is 56 years old.  They do not have any children together, but she is the mother of two, and he is a father of three.  All of the children are adults.

Ana has a small cafeteria.  In the cafeteria, it is possibly to buy coffee and drinks, such as orange juice and soft drinks.  She also sells snacks.  Ana is about to receive her second loan.

The first loan made it possibly for her to expand her business.  With her new loan, she hopes and believes she can increase her business even more.  She has two dreams.  The first dream is that she one day will be able to buy a nice house.  The second dream is to travel as a tourist to the USA and Mexico.

loans.use: Increase product availability in business

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget E. is 40 years old and married with six children.  She lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria.  She has a poultry business where she raises birds and sells both birds and eggs.  She is requesting a loan for N170000 to purchase more birds to sell.  She says thank you to all that make this loan possible!

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience A. is a single parent and has two children.  Patience received schooling through junior high school.  For the past three years, Patience has sold groceries like biscuits, canned products, etceteras at Roman Assinadze in Cape Coast.  Patience uses her income to pay for rent, utilities and other financial expenses.  Patience will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet customer demand.  With the additional profits from her expanded business, Patience plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: Patience will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet customer demand

loans.name: Mujeres Capacitadas Group

texts.en:
This group, Mujeres Capacitadas, has four subgroups, four group coordinators and 20 members.  Anania H. is one of the coordinators.  Her group has five members.  She is 20 years old and single, and she does not have any children.  Anania sells clothes and shoes in her neighborhood in Imbert.  She buys her merchandise in Santiago, the next largest city in the country.  

Anania has received one loan from Esperanza and is about to receive a second loan.  With her first loan, she was able to buy more clothes to sell.  Her monthly sales increased after receiving the first loan.  She believes that with her second loan she can increase business even more.  Anania is fond of her church.  She hopes that she will be able to study tourism at the local university and find a job within the tourism industry later in life.  She also hopes that one day she can start a family and have children of her own.

loans.use: Buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en: David A. is 50 years old and married with 10 children.  David is a hard working man, and he lives in Uromi, Edo state, Nigeria.  He needs a loan for N140000 to purchase more palm kernels that he can crack and sell.  He hopes to see his 10 children through school.  He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernels

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. sells groceries and firewood (a source of fuel) to the majority of fishmongers at Kawano paado in Cape Coast. She has been selling groceries and firewood for the past four years. Efua has received a primary level of education. She is a single parent with four dependents. She is responsible for paying her family's rent, utility bills and other expenses.

Efua will use this loan to buy more firewood to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi B. sells groceries like biscuits and canned products at London Bridge in Cape Coast. Esi has received a junior high education. She is a single parent with one child.

Esi has been selling groceries for the past 10 years. She is responsible for paying her rent, utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house she wants to put up for the children.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer T. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through senior high. Since 2002, Jenifer has been selling fridges, television sets and other home appliances at Ayiko-Ayikoo. Her husband is a mechanic.

Jenifer uses her income to support her husband in paying the rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Jenifer will use this loan to buy more home appliances to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Jenifer plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more home appliances to sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 52 year old woman who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. Fatima has been working as a sewer since 1988. Fatima is good at sewing and her clients are her friends and neighbors. In the future, she plans to increase her business.  She has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua purchase thread and repair her car.  This is the first time that Fatima has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase thread and repair her car.

loans.name: Divine Elévation Group

texts.en:
Théophile started his business in 1998. With just $150 in starting capital, he began selling sacks of manioc, which he purchased in Lower Congo. Over the years, he decided to diversify his business by adding beverages to meet the high demand of the clients in his area.

With hard work and good management, Théophile’s business has prospered. He makes a profit of about $30 per day. Théophile is well known in his area as a good business man because of his organization and his ability to attract customers. His goal is to be a beverage provider in his community.

Théophile has been a member of his community bank since last November. He is 43 years old, married, and has two children. He also takes care of two other children.

loans.use: To purchase three crates of soft drinks

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fadlallah

texts.en:
Fadlallah is a 52 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Fadlallah has been working as a sewer for twenty five years. Fadlallah is special in his work because he is good and has a lot of experience. His clients are friends, neighbors, schools and stores. When he first started his business he had difficulty building a network but no longer. In the future, he plans to purchase a new sewing machine.
 
He has requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business. Fadlallah has been a microcredit client for six years now and has always paid on time.  His previous loans have helped him improve his standard of living and he wants to do more.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 31 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ahmad has been working as a carpenter for sixteen years. Ahmad has a lot of experience and is very good. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital but now he plans to expand his business. 

He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase a new machine for his business. This is his second cycle and he paid the first on time.  His previous loan helped him expand his business and he would like to continue doing so.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine for his business.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 23 year old engaged man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Samer has been repairing cars for five years. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Samer first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his garage and he didn’t have the startup capital, but now he plans to improve and expand his business. 
He has requested a loan of 900 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his garage and to pay his wedding expenses. This is his second cycle and he has paid the first on time.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his garage and to pay his wedding expanses.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 23 year old woman who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Fatima has been working as a photographer in a studio for a year. Fatima is very good at photography and knows how to take nice pictures. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had difficulty finding the proper place for her studio and she didn’t have the startup capital but now that is no longer a problem.

She has requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase a new camera for her business. This is the first time that Fatima has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase a new camera for her business.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 51-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Jamal has been working in construction for ten years. He is a tiler. Jamal requests a loan of $900 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase materials for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time.
Jamal's previous loan has influenced him in a good way. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he worked on small projects because he didn’t have a lot of experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business by taking on more and bigger projects.

loans.use: Jamal will use the loan to purchase materials for his work.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret I. sells clothes and foodstuffs. She is also a tailor who makes lovely clothes for her customers. She is very hardworking.

Margaret is requesting a loan of 140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is married with children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 44-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Mahmoud has owned a chicken restaurant for five years. He requests a loan of $500 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase supplies for his restaurant. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan.
Mahmoud’s clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have start-up capital. Mahmoud decided to start his business because he always wanted to open a restaurant. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Mahmoud will use the loan to purchase supplies for his restaurant.

loans.name: Abed Al Latif

texts.en:
Abed A. Latif is a 66-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Abed A. Latif has owned a grocery shop since 2000. He requests a loan of $900 USD from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time.
Abed A. Latif's previous loans have influenced his life in a good way. He is speciA. in his work because he opens early in the morning and closes late in the evening and he also has a good relationship with his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Abed A. Latif decided to start his business because he has knowledge of pricing and trading. In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: Abed Al Latif will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ali has been working in agriculture for seven years. He sells flowers and flower jars. Ali requests a loan of $1200 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase materials for agriculture and jars. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.
Ali is special in his work because he has different types of flowers, has good prices and has a good relationship with his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started he had the land to start his business, but he didn’t have a lot of knowledge of pricing and trading. Ali decided to work in this business because it has been a family business and he has always liked the good smell of flowers. In the future, he plans to attract more clients and expand his business.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to purchase materials for agriculture and jars.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 31-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Khodor has owned a coffee shop for four years. He serves coffee, sweets and tea. Khodor requests a loan of $1000 USD from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop like coffee, sugar and accessories. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time.
Khodor’s previous loans helped him improve his business and his financiA. situation. He is speciA. in his work because he opens late in the evening, has a good reputation and knows how to talk to his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business he had some difficulties opening his shop. Khodor decided to open his coffee shop because he always wanted a shop and he also wanted to improve his financiA. situation. In the future, he plans to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: Khodor will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 52-year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their five children. Hala has been working as a hairdresser since 2004. She also does makeup. Hala requests a loan of $1000 USD from A. Majmoua in order to purchase supplies for her work. This is the first time that Hala has requested a loan.
Hala is speciA. in her work because she does it well and she is fast. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. Hala decided to start her business because she always wanted to be a hairdresser and because she is a motivated person, especially when it comes to her work. In the future, she plans to open a salon.

loans.use: Hala will use the loan to purchase supplies for her work.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Ahmad has been working as a car mechanic for a year. He takes care of electrical systems and car batteries. Ahmad requests a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.
His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. Ahmad’s garage is well positioned.  He decided to start his business because he has experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business and improve his working tools.

loans.use: Ahmad will use the loan to purchase tools for his garage.

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en:
Nasser is a 48-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Nasser has been working in construction for 25 years. Nasser requests a loan of $1000 USD from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Nasser has requested a loan.
Nasser is speciA. in his work because of his punctuality; he also has good relationships with his clients. He decided to work in construction because it has been a family business and he has experience in it. In the future, he plans to expand his business by taking on more projects.

loans.use: Nasser will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 35-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Jihad has been selling vegetables and fruit for 14 years. He also works as a schoolbus driver. Jihad requests a loan of $1200 USD from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business and do some maintenance work on his bus. This is the first time that Jihad has requested a loan.
Jihad is speciA. in his work because he sells good vegetables and fruit. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Jihad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his business and to do some maintenance work on his bus.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 41-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their seven children. Abbas works as a house painter. He requests a loan of $1000 USD from A. Majmoua in order to purchase new painting tools and a car that will facilitate his work. This is the first time that Abbas has requested a loan.
Abbas is speciA. in his work because he has experience and he does good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network. He decided to start his business because he wanted to be independent in his work and also improve his family's situation. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Abbas will use the loan to purchase new painting tools and a car for his work.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 24-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Imad has been working as a car mechanic for a year. He does mechanical work and he also repairs diesel cars. Imad requests a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase spare parts for cars. This is the first time that Imad has requested a loan.
Imad is special in his work because he is fast and he does good work. His clients are his friends and others. He decided to start his business because he knew he could make it and he had the experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Imad will use the loan to purchase spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine E. sells beef. She has been in this business for a long time. She is married with three children.

Josephine is requesting a loan of 120,000 to purchase more beef to sell. By expanding her business, she hopes to increase her profit margin. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Nogiomwan

texts.en:
Nogiomwan I. is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She has been in the business of selling clothes, bags and shoes for a long time.

She is requesting a loan of N120,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell so she can expand her business. She says thanks to everyone who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Z. Marguerite a 55 ans et elle vend sa nourriture depuis 40 ans. Elle n’est pas scolarisée, mais, elle a 6 enfants, tous scolarisés, un seul enfant reste encore à sa charge. Elle s’est mariée avec SONOU Eloi. Marguerite vend le riz, le poisson, la sauce, la pâte, le maïs, le riz, l’huile d’arachide, les tomates, le piment, et les oignons qu’elle vend au bord de la voie. Elle prépare également le gari, la farine de manioc qui vient du Nigeria. Son commerce a évolué – avant elle achetait le pain, et actuellement elle fabrique le pain elle-même. Elle est obligée de préparer chaque jour les mets qu’elle vend; et à la fin de la journée, si elle n’arrive pas à tout vendre,  elle jette la nourriture qui reste parce qu’elle ne peut pas conserver ça. Pourtant, elle a vu une amélioration stricte dans son commerce. Elle voudrait changer de lieu dans le futur, ou construire un restaurant pour mieux attirer les gens.
texts.en:
Z. Marguerite is 55 years old and has been selling food for 40 years. She was not provided with an education, but she has six children to look after. All are in school, and one still remains in her care. She is married to Eloi SONOU. Along the side of the road, Marguerite sells rice, fish, sauce, and “pâte” (corn mash), corn, peanut oil, tomatoes, chili peppers, and onions. She also cooks “gari” (cassava flour) that comes from Nigeria. Her commerce has developed – in the past, she used to sell bread, and currently she makes the bread herself. She has to make meals to sell each day; and at the end of the day, if she doesn’t manage to sell it all, she throws the leftover food away because she cannot preserve it. Yet she has seen a hard-and-fast improvement in her commerce. She would like to change locations in the future or to build a restaurant to draw in people better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: S. Emilienne est une timide, contente femme de 32 ans. Elle s’est mariée avec HOUSSOU-MIMI Dominique, et ils ont trois enfants ensemble, tous scolarisés. Mme S. a fini le lycée. Elle est informaticienne de formation et en 2004 elle a ouvert sa propre boutique pour vendre les ordinateurs et tous les objets du bureau ; elle faire aussi les photocopies. Elle s’approvisionne au Négoce Afrique. Actuellement, elle est enceinte, et pour cette raison elle va utiliser ce prêt pour vendre les cartes de recharge qui sont plus facile de vendre que les objets du bureau. Apres l’accouchement de son bébé, elle va reprendre la vente des ordinateurs.
texts.en:
Emilienne S. is a shy, happy 32-year-old woman. She is married to Dominique Houssou-Mimi, and they have three children together, all of whom go to school. Mrs. S. completed high school. She is a trained computer specialist, and in 2004, she opened her own shop to sell computers and everything office-related, including photocopies. She stocks up at Négoce Afrique. She is currently pregnant, and for this reason, she is going to use this loan to sell phone cards, which are easier to sell than office supplies. After the birth of her baby, she will return to selling computers.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy phone cards

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 40 años, convive desde los 20 años con el padre de sus 3 hijos y su nieta, durante todo este tiempo ellos han ido construyendo su casa a base de madera. Cuando empezó a vivir con su esposo trabajaba sembrando frutos cítricos, y otras veces trabajaba en otras chacras preparando las cargas, fue entonces donde hizo mucha amistad con los compradores quienes la alentaron para que prepare su propia carga. Entonces cuando llegó la época de cosecha de sus productos fue el momento oportuno para empezar en este negocio, desde esa época, hace como cuatro años, se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas; y en todo este tiempo ha ganado clientes a quienes envía su carga de 80 javas (12 kg) de plátanos y otro tanto de cítricos. Por cada carga gana líquido la suma de 500 soles, cantidad que está ahorrando con la finalidad de hacer un negocio grande; o de lo contrario un abrir un restaurante porque dice que en estos últimos tiempos la agricultura tiene mayores riesgos y prefiere establecerse en una actividad más estable. Rosa se da tiempo para todo, en su grupo participa de forma muy dinámica, y no tiene dificultades en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita lo va a utilizar en la compra de cajones para las frutas, y con el resto comprará plátanos y frutos cítricos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old and has been living for 20 years with the father of their three sons and a granddaughter, during which time they have been building a house from wood. When she began living with her husband, she was planting citrus fruits and other times she was was working on other farms readying the cargo. Then she made friendships with shoppers who encouraged her to do her own shipments of cargo. So then when the harvest season arrived, it was the oportune moment to start her own business. Since then, four years ago, she has dedicated herself to buying and reselling fruit; and all of this time she has been gaining customers to whom she sends shipments of 80 javas (12 kg) of plaintains and other amounts of fruits. With each shipment, she earns a cash sum of 500 soles, an amount that is being saved with the hopes of making a big transaction, or for possibly opening a restaurant. This is because in these times, agriculture has large risks and she would prefer to establish herself in something more stable. Rosa gives time to all, participating in the lending group in a dynamic way, and she does not have any difficulty making payments. The money that she request will be used to buy boxes for fruit, and the rest will be used to purchase plantainsand citrus fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying boxes of fruit to resell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 6 años en su propia casa. Desde hace un año se dedica a vender cigarros, distribuye al por mayor, viaja a las ciudades aledañas a su localidad como Huancavelica, Pampas o otras en la zona de selva, con su vital herramienta de trabajo que es su pequeña combi (como se la ve en la foto). Este negocio le es rentable, lo que la motiva a seguir dedicándose a ello, los días viernes se abastece de mercadería y los demás días hace sus repartos. Su meta es tener varios negocios, uno de ellos, era lo anteriormente hacía, que era vender prendas tejidas. Es la quinta vez que Leticia tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella ha aprendido durante este tiempo el trabajo en equipo dentro de su banco comunal y a pesar de que su primer grupo se disolvió, ella y otros socios decidieron formar otro banquito. Con el dinero solicitado va a comprar una caja de cigarros valorizada en 1200 soles, que será suficiente para abastecerse de mercadería y el resto del dinero será un capital para imprevistos.
texts.en:
Leticia is 31 years old, lives with her husband and 6 year old son in their own home. She has been selling cigarettes for a year. She is a wholesale distributor, traveling to neighboring cities such as Huancavelica, Pampa or other areas of the jungle, with her most important tool of her work which is her small van (which is seen in the photograph). This business is profitable, and that motivates her to continue working. On Fridays she stocks us with merchandise and on the other days she makes her deliveries. Her goal is to have various businesses, one of them is something she previously did, which was selling various sewn articles of clothing. This is the 5th time Leticia is receiving a loan from MFP, she has learned during this time to work with others from within her communal bank and in spite of the fact that her first group dissolved, she and other members decided to form another communal bank. With the loan money she is going to buy a case of cigarettes valued at 1200 soles, which will be sufficient to stock her supply and the rest of the money will be used for unforeseen expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo tiene 41 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Él trabaja en las labores agrícolas desde hace muchos años, lo que le ha permitido seguir adelante durante todos estos años, pues no solo se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sino también a la crianza de animales; como vacas, toros y ovejas y en menor proporción, cuyes. Lo que produce en sus tierras de cultivo, una parta la vende y la otra la guarda en su almacén para su consumo propio para los momentos de necesidad.  El amor por su familia es lo que lo motiva a esforzarse ante el calor o frío intenso del campo cuando prepara la tierra para la siembra o cuando se prepara para la cosecha. Es la segunda vez que Bernardo tiene un crédito con  MFP, como integrante de su banco comunal está  satisfecho por el que cada día aprenden, además de ser un espacio interesante de socialización y apoyo mutuo. La cantidad que solicita es para la compra de bolsas de abono, cada una cuesta 200 soles, en promedio le servirá para la campaña de siembra que se aproxima.
texts.en:
Bernardo is 41 years old and lives with his wife and children. He has worked in agriculture for many years, which has allowed him to make progress during these years. In addition to working in agriculture he has also worked raising animals, including cows, bulls, sheep, and to a lesser extent guinea pigs. Of what he grows in his fields he sells one part, and saves the other part in his storeroom for personal consumption during moments of need. His love for his family is what motivates him to endure the extreme heat or cold of the countryside when he is preparing his land for sowing seeds, or when he is preparing for the harvest. This is the second time that Bernardo has sought a loan with MFP. He is pleased to be a member of his local community bank because everyday the members are learning, and it also provides an interesting space for socialising and mutual support. The loan is to buy bags of fertilizer, costing 200 soles each, which will serve him well during the sowing season now approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Anifatou

texts.fr: Dame A. Anifatou est née le 24 janvier 1975, mariée à ASSANI Soumaila, elle est mère de deux enfants Akim agée de 10 ans en classe de CM1 et de rachidatou agée de 06 ans en classe de CP. Elle a une petite boutique  de vente de poissons, elle s'approvisionne à CAJAF COMON et les revend aux bonnes dames. A coté de sa boutique de vente de poissons elle vend aussi des cassettes CD, pour aider son mari  a supporté les charges familiales qui lui incombent. Pour rendre plus connu son activité , elle a sollicité ce pret pour renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Anifatou A. was born on January 24th, 1975. She is married to Soumaila Assani and is the mother of two childen. Akim, age 10 is in elementry school and Rachidatou, age 6, is in primary school. Anifatou operates a small shop selling fish. She buys her stock in Cadaf Comon and resells them locally, to women. At one side of her fish shop, she also sells cassettes and CDs. These activities support her family living expenses. To make her business activities more widely known, she is requesting this loan to strengthen her business.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 cases of soft drinks, 10 cartons of canned drinks, audio CD's and video DVD's for resale

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es: Liduvina tiene 54 años, vive con sus dos hijas en su propia casa. Hace 5 años abrió en su misma casa una librería, donde vende junto con sus hijas útiles escolares por lo que cada una ha organizado sus turnos de atención de acuerdo a sus actividades. Esta librería le permite a Liduvina tener un ingreso más que complementa con el sueldo que percibe al ser trabajadora dependiente de un establecimiento de salud por lo que seguirá invirtiendo en su negocio para su crecimiento. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está convencida que es positivo trabajar en un banco comunal porque aprenden sobre el ahorro y manejo de su negocio. Liduvina solicita esta cantidad para abastecerse de mercadería para su librería.
texts.en:
Liduvina is 54 years old and lives with her two daughters in her own home. She opened a bookstore 5 years ago in her house, where she sells school supplies. Her daughters work in the store with her, and each has organized their shifts around their activities. This bookstore provides Liduvina with an additional income stream which complements the salary she earns working in a health facility. For this reason she will continue investing in the business so it can grow. This is the second time that she has sought a loan from MFP, and she is convinced that it is a positive thing to work with a community bank because the members learn about saving money and managing their businesses. Liduvina will use this loan to stock up on merchandise for her bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her merchandise

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.es: Perfecta tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijas. Desde hace más de 2 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, ofrece de casa en casa de sus amistades y vecinos, una vez que les entrega el producto, generalmente al crédito, regresa para realizar las cobranzas. La ventaja es que ella ofrece sus productos con descuentos especiales y siempre tiene un incentivo para sus mejores clientes, que es una buena estrategia que la mantiene en su record de ventas. Esta actividad es una gran satisfacción para Perfecta porque la empresa de cosméticos, le da obsequios que utiliza para mejorar su casa, como artefactos y utensilios de cocina. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las mejores integrantes de su grupo solidario que apuesta y promueve la unidad. Perfecta usará 1000 soles para abastecerse de más productos de belleza, y con el resto del dinero, va ha habilitar el auto que posee para que pueda ponerlo a trabajar en transporte público.
texts.en:
Perfecta is 42 years old, she lives with her husband and her 2 daughters. For the past 2 years she has been selling cosmetics from catalogue, from house to house of her friends and neighbors. Once the product has been delivered, generally on credit, she returns for the payments. The advantage is that she offers special discounts on her products and she always has an incentive for her best clients which is a good strategy to keep sales high. This activity is very satisfying for Perfecta as the cosmetics enterprise gives her gifts to improve her home such as devices and kitchen appliancies. It is her second loan with MFP, she is one of the best partners of her solidarity group and supports and promotes the unity. Perfecta will spend 1000 soles to buy cosmetics and with the rest of the money she will fix a car she owns so it can be used for public transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen tiene 36 años, vive con sus  hijos en su propio departamento. Desde hace más de 5 años vende productos de belleza, Karen es una persona muy ordenada y bien organizada, tiene una detallada lista con todos los datos de sus clientes, para poder ofrecerles sus productos y atenderles con mayor calidad. Ella disfruta de realizar esta actividad, porque le permite tener tiempo disponible para atender a sus 3 hijos que están en edad escolar, a su vez, ha aprendido a afrontar los riesgos de su negocio, tales como dar crédito y que sus clientes no le paguen a tiempo, a la que Karen se provee de diversos mecanismos de cobranza. En el futuro le gustaría tener un stand comercial, donde pueda exponer sus productos. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a trabajar con mucho compromiso y ganas de emprender un trabajo coordinado con las integrantes de su grupo solidario. La cantidad que está solicitando, en su totalidad, será usada para la compra de más cosméticos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Karen is 36 years old and lives with her children in her own apartment. For more than 5 years she has been selling cosmetics. Karen is a very orderly and well organized person, she keeps a detailed record with all the data of her clients to be able to offer them her products and attend to them properly. She enjoys this activity because she has time to be with her 3 school-aged children, and she has also learned to face the risks of her business, such as giving credit and that her clients do not pay punctually and she knows several mecanisms for debt collection. In the future she would like to have a commercial stand where she can exhibit her products. This is her first loan with MFP and she feels obliged to work with commitment and wholeheartedly with the members of her solidarity group. The total amount requested with be spent on buying cosmetics in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Née en 1972, dame A. Josephine s'est mariée à monsieur Antoine HOUNSAMONNOU et de cette union est issue  04 enfants dont  03 sont scolarisés. Elle a une boutique de vente de divers devant son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, elle vend de l'akassa et des poissons frits aux ouvriers et aux passants. La qualité de sa nourriture a faire accoitre sa clientèle et pour ce faire elle a sollicité un  pret aupres de notre institution.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josephine A. was born in 1972 and is married to Mr. Antoine HOUNSAMONNOU. They have four children, out of which three attend school. She runs a shop selling various items in front of her house. In parallel, she sells "akassa" (a traditional beninese food, made out of corn flour) and fried fish to workers and passersby. The quality of her food caused her clientele to increase, and to meet customer demand, she's seeking this loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of corn, 3 baskets of fish, and other items.

loans.name: León

texts.es: León tiene 62 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 últimos hijos en su propia casa. Casi toda su vida la ha dedicado a cultivar la tierra, la que le ha dado durante más de 30 años,  el sostenimiento de su familia, los productos principales de sus tierras son la papa y el maíz, cuya cosecha vende en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Pero en los últimos años, debido al factor climático, las llamadas heladas, han matado sus plantaciones, por lo que ha optado por cultivar en mayor cantidad, la alfalfa, que sirve como alimento para el ganado, el cual vende y con el que también espera alimentar a los animales que quiere comprar a futuro. Además de esto, trabaja como vigilante en la municipalidad de su localidad para obtener ingresos extras. León es uno de los socios que tiene más tiempo trabajando en su banco comunal, este es su préstamo número 16 con MFP, es un participe integrante de su grupo, ya que es el presidente de la junta, quien organiza y vela por el  bienestar de su grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un terreno de cultivo para incrementar su producción de alfalfa.
texts.en:
León is 62 years old and lives with his wife and their 2 youngest children in his own house. Almost all his life he has been a farmer and this activity has been the support for his family for more than 30 years. His main crops are potato and corn which he sells at the wholesale market of his town. But for the past years, due to climatic factors, frost has killed his plants and therefore he decided to grow more alfalfa which is used to feed cattle. He sells the alfalfa and he also hopes to feed the animals he wants to buy in the future. He also works as a watchman at the municipality of his community to obtain extra income. Leon is one of the partners who has worked for the longest period of time with his community bank, this is his 16th loan with MFP, he is an active partner of his group as he is the president of the board who organizes and looks out for the well-being of his group. With the money requested he will buy land to increase the production of alfalfa

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of farm land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Ghetivu

texts.en:
Mr. C. is a veterinary doctor. He has also been raising pigs for more than 15 years. Currently he has 20 pigs. In the near future he will increase this number to at least 50. His business is located in the village of Vadul-lui-Isac in the Cahul district, and his markets are Cahul and Vulcanesti. The price of meat in this region is quite high, so the profitability of the business is around 60%.

This loan is Mr. C.'s first with Microinvest. The purpose of the loan is to purchase fodder for the pigs. His main objective is to grow his production of meat.

loans.use: To purchase fodder

loans.name: Kolika

texts.fr: Kolika L. est un mécanicien auto à Kpalimé, une ville situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agé de 45 ans, il est marié et père de 4 enfants. Il espère avec ce crédit donner plus de force à son activité en achetant des outils de travail lui permettant de mieux exécuter son activité. Par ricochet, il gagnera plus la confiance de sa clientèle ce qui lui permettra de tirer plus de profits pour la meilleure survie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kolika L. is an automechanic in Kpalimé, a town located north-west of Lomé, the capital of Togo. At age 45, he is married and the father of 4 children. He hopes, with this loan to strengthen his business, buying work tools which will enable him to be more effective at his work. This will also build confidence with his customers and allow him to earn greater profits, to better provide for his family.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools

loans.name: Balongi Group

texts.en:
Thérèse is 30 years old and single. She lost her mother in 1991 and her father in 1997. After her parents passed away, no one could help her come out of the horrible economic situation she was experiencing without her family. Thérèse had to quit her studies and start a business. With just $100 in starting capital, she began selling canned goods, such as canned tomatoes, margarine, corned beef, milk, and sardines in 2004. With hard work and good management, she succeeded in stabilizing her business.

In November 2006, Thérèse heard an announcement at her church about Hope’s microfinance program, and she decided to join the community bank, Balongi. She has been a faithful client of Hope, receiving six loans that she regularly and completely paid back. Thérèse is now happy because she has taken control of her financial life.

loans.use: To diversify her business by adding clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Atsoupé

texts.fr: Mme Atsoupé G. est née en 1976 à Kladjémé dans la préfecture de Zio au Sud du Togo. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle est une grande commerçante de produits de beauté et de bijoux (perles, boucles d’oreilles, bagues). Elle a toujours attiré l’attention particulière de sa clientèle par la gamme variée de ses marchandises qui sont de très bonne qualité. Aujourd’hui elle sollicite un financement pour élargir son étalage et passer d’autres commandes de marchandises. Elle espère tirer d’important bénéfices afin d’améliorer les conditions socio-économiques de son ménage.
texts.en:
Mme Atsoupé G. was born in 1976 in the Zio Prefecture, in Southern Togo. Married and the mother of four children, she's a great reseller of cosmetics and jewelry (pearls, earrings, rings). She has always drawn customer attention thanks to the variety and the very high quality of her products. She's now seeking a loan to extend her stall and order other items. She hopes to turn substantial profits, to improve the living conditions of her household.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her cosmetics and jewelry business

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Célibataire avec trois (03) personnes à charge, Mme Abra T. est née en 1981 à Tsévié où elle vend actuellement des boissons glacées (cannettes, jus d’orange, jus de citron et autres…). Exerçant son activité dans de très bonnes conditions d’hygiène, elle a totalement monopolisé la clientèle de son milieu qui apprécie très bien ses services. Actuellement la demande dépasse l’offre. Pour cela, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter un nouveau réfrigérateur, des glacières et aménager son cadre de travail. Le profit tiré de cette activité servira à s’investir dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus et prendre en charge convenablement les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Unmarried and having three people to support, Ms. Abra T. was born in 1981 in Tsévié, where she currently sells cold beverages (canned drinks, orange juice, lemon juice, and more…). She works under very hygienic conditions, and she has a total monopoly over the customers in her location; they highly value her service. Right now, the demand exceeds what she offers. And so, she is requesting financing to buy a new refrigerator and some ice chests and to fix up her workplace. The profit derived from her business will be for investing in other income-generating work and to be appropriately responsive to her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell iced beverages and fruit juices

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr: Né en 1970 à Dassou Kondji dans la préfecture des Lacs, Mr Komlavi H. est menuisier de formation, activité exerce régulièrement et qui lui réussit très bien très bien. Compte tenu des demandes pressantes de ses clients pour la fabrication des meubles, il sollicite un financement pour acheter des planches en grande quantité afin de disposer d’un stock permanent. Cela lui permettra de répondre aux commandes des clients, d’augmenter ses bénéfices et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Dassou Kondji, in Lacs prefecture, Mr. Komlavi H. is a cabinet-maker by training. It is steady work that is succeeding very well for him. Given the pressing demand of his customers for making furniture, he is requesting financing to buy lumber in large quantities in order to have a constant stock. This will enable him to meet the demands of his customers, to increase his profits, and to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell furniture

loans.name: Abraham Mawufemo Kodjo

texts.fr: Mr Abraham Mawufemo Kodjo K., né en 1958 à Mission Tové est marié et père de huit (08) enfants avec deux (02) autres personnes à charge. Il a pour activité la chaudronnerie, activité qu’il exerce depuis plus de trente (30) ans. L’ayant hérité de ses parents, ce métier consiste à récupérer des ustensiles en aluminium, de les faire fondre pour fabriquer des casseroles et des marmites neuves et très résistantes. C’est un travail très difficile mais qui génère beaucoup de revenus. Actuellement, il a reçu beaucoup de commande qu’il n’arrive pas à honorer. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un crédit pour acheter les matériels nécessaires au travail. Les bénéfices tirés de son travail serviront à améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Abraham Mawufemo Kodjo K., born in 1958 in Mission Tové, is married and the father of eight plus to others to support. For over thirty years, he has been a boiler-maker, which is a trade passed down from his parents. It involves acquiring aluminum utensils and melting them in order to make new, long-lasting pots and pans. It’s very difficult work, though it generates a lot of income. Currently, he has many orders, which he has not been able to honor. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy the necessary equipment and supplies. The profits derived from his work will be used to improve living conditions for him and his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell aluminum pots and pans

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora Naki  is a mother of three children. She is fifty years old and has lost her husband some years ago.  Dora lives with her children in Koforidua, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Koforidua is the capital of the region. It is a busy town, full of business activities. Dora says she has been the sole provider of all the family’s needs. All her three children are out of school and are working. Some are professional teachers. 

Dora trades in textiles materials. She buys tie & dye textiles from the producers in Accra and treks to other towns to sell her products. Tie & dye is a local textile that is produced by tying either the white or colored mercerized cotton with raffia and then dying by immersion or sprinkling. The raffia prevents the dye from penetrating into the areas that have been tied. Dora has been in business for eight years. She wants a loan so that she can buy textiles on a larger scale and be able to trek to many places to sell.

loans.use: To buy tie & dye textiles in bulk

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is forty years old and lives with her family in Agogo. She is married and the mother with four children. Currently, three are in school, and the first born, is working with a construction firm. She has been a food vendor for ten years in the Agogo community school. She sells ‘ampesi’ and rice with stew. This food is purchased mostly by the school children during their break time. Ampesi is cooked and enjoyed with any kind of stew. In addition to this, she also prepares pastries and supplies them to the shops at the community market. 

Ama wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, meat, charcoal, flour, margarine and others supplies. She is convinced that there will be a price hike and would like this loan to help her increase her stock. She would then have sufficient supplies to prepare food for her customers. This would enable her to save more towards her childrens education. Ama says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like yam, plantain, bags of rice, meat, fish, spices, charcoal, flour, margarine etc.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Mr Abra B. est né en 1967 à Afagnan. Elle est mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants. Issue d’une famille de commerçantes, elle s’est vite lancée la préparation et la vente de l’huile de palme. Avec son courage et son dynamisme et surtout la qualité de son huile, elle a réussi à s’imposer dans son milieu drainant derrière elle une importante clientèle. En vue de lui permettre de constituer un stock important de matières premières entrant dans la préparation de l’huile (noix de palme), elle sollicite un financement. Cela lui permettra de vendre les stocks en période de pénurie pour dégager de bons bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abra B. was born in 1967 in Afagnan. She is a married mother of seven. Having come from a family of traders, she quickly took to preparing and selling palm oil. With her courage, energy, and especially the quality of her oil, she has succeeded in establishing herself in her environment with a large following clientele. In order to allow her to build up a sizable stock of necessary materials for making the oil (palm nuts), she is seeking a loan. This will allow her to sell the stock in times of shortage to earn some nice profits.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare and sell palm oil

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica Mamle T. is thirty five years old. She is married and a mother of three children; one boy and two girls. Two of her children have completed senior high school. The last born is currently in primary school. Vero lives with her family in Somanya, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Somanya is a busy commercial town. Most of its inhabitants are engaged in one business activity or another. Her husband is a commercial driver. She also works, earning some income to support her husband. 

Vero sells footwear of all kinds for both males and females (thus unisex). Most of her customers are workers and students. She buys her goods in the city of Accra and then treks to markets in other towns to sell. She has been in business for seven years. She wants to increase her profit margin by buying goods in bulk, then she can trek to many markets to do more business. It is Vero’s dream to help sponsor all their children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy footwear for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy generic pharmceutical products for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Married with five children, Rose B. is a fifty four year old trader. She trades in cereals, like maize, and also operates a grocery shop at Agogo, a community where the major occupation is farming. She has been trading for the past year, a business she started with a small amount of money. Since then she has been able to support her family. 

Rose wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize and grocery items like biscuits, sugar, milk etc to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. The demand for the maize is high, as many of the second cycle schools have resumed and she has to prepare food for the boarding students. Sometimes students would arrive in large school busses and purchased large quantity of maize. Rose says your assistance would be of much help to her.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of maize to restock her grocery shop.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia T. is forty-three years old. She is a married woman and the mother of four daughters. She says one of her daughters is already working; one has just completed senior high school and is waiting for her results. The rest are in senior and junior high schools. 

Cecilia and her family live in Somanya in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Somanya is a native town of a tribe in Ghana called the ‘Krobos’. Though people of other tribes have migrated there as a result of their occupations, the Krobos dominate the land. 

Cecilia sells "gari" in nearby markets. "Gari" is a local delicacy produced from cassava. The peeled cassava is milled, squeezed of the water content and fried in a hot metal pan over a hot fire. Cecilia does not produce the "gari" herself, but procures from wholesalers in big markets. She desires to buy "gari" in bags and trek to other markets to distribute it.

loans.use: To procure ‘gari’ in bulk for distribution

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana T. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has no children yet. Juliana and her husband live in Somanya, a business town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver. She is an entrepreneur. She has been selling mainly plantains and porridge on the streets in the mornings. She buys her ingredients (the plantains) from the farmers in her community and the surrounding villages.

Juliana treks to Accra and other towns to sell to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators. Juliana has been in business for four years. She says when plantains become scarce, she resorts to other foodstuffs such as cocoyams, yams, etc., to remain in business. Juliana wants to buy plantains on large scale so that she can supply a number of customers and increase her profit margin. She says she wants to put away a lot of savings before she begins to have children.

loans.use: To procure plantains for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a hairdryer and hair extensions for resale

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce S. is 40 years old. She is a divorced woman with four kids. Her first-born has completed senior high school and she is hoping to enter nursing school. Joyce lives with her family at Agogo, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. For the past seven years, all that Joyce has been doing to support her household is baking bread. She says that though it was difficult in the beginning, now she sees changes in her business growth.

Joyce bakes bread and retails it. She says, she gives best value for money by making sure that her food quality meets her customers' expectations. Her customers book their orders in advance and before they come it is ready. She also retails to individuals for their morning breakfast. She says the price of commodities is increasing which is making it difficult for her to buy more raw materials from the market. And the daily demand for bread is high. She says she bakes at most 800 loaves of bread in a day.

Joyce needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk, and firewood, etc. She said your assistance would be most welcome.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia G. is twenty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, a boy and two girls. She says all of her children are in school. She and her family live in Somanya in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Lydia’s husband works with ATL (Akosombo Textiles Limited), one of the textiles factories in the country.

Lydia is an entrepreneur. She sells plantains. She buys her plantains from farmers in her community and nearby villages. At times Lydia travels all the way to the Western Region where plantains are cultivated on a large scale to procure her goods. She says she treks to Accra to sell to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators. She has been in business for over eight years. Lydia says she started this business with her mother while she was still in school. Lydia wants to buy plantains on large scale so that she can supply them to a number of customers. She desires to help her husband see their children through higher education.

loans.use: To buy plantains in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Eunice Z. is a single mother of three children, ages 22, 13, and 10. She is the group coordinator for Group Five of the Ebenezer Bank of Hope in Hato Mayor, Dominican Republic. This is the first loan that this group of five will receive, and they expect to make their businesses grow thanks to it.

Eunice´s business is a beauty salon. She will use her loan to purchase new products to do her everyday work. Her hopes are that this first loan will help her achieve her dreams of owning a bigger salon and a house of her own. From the profits she obtains, thanks to the improvements she makes in her business with this loan, she expects to help pay for her children´s school and college tuition.

Thank you for supporting this group. Let´s help build the dreams of these brave women!

loans.use: purchase new products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Mamle

texts.en:
Mamle C. is forty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to five children – one girl and four boys. She says one of her sons has completed the university. Others are in the polytechnic and senior high school. She lives with her family in Somanya in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Though her husband works to provide for the family, Mamle also works hard to help him. She is an entrepreneur. She sells mainly maize. She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says city dwellers come to buy maize with big cargo trucks and then go to retail it to food vendors in particular.

Mamle has been in business for over twenty-four years and is full of rich experiences. She wants to buy maize on a large scale so that she can supply her increasing numbers of customers and increase her profit margin. She yearns to help her children climb the academic ladder to greater heights.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize for re-sale

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana N. is 42 years old. She is a married woman with three children. Her first-born has completed senior high school and the rest are still schooling. She lives with her family at Agogo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. For the past seven years all that Christiana has been doing in taking care of her household is baking bread and the sale of grocery items like milk, rice, biscuits, etc. She bakes bread and supplies it to the villages around her and also sells some to individuals.

Demand for her bread has increased as a result of constant supply and just-in-time delivery. Her customers book their order in advance and before they come it is ready. She says the price of commodities is increasing which is making it difficult for her to buy more raw materials from the market. And the daily demand for bread is high. She says she bakes at most 600 loaves of bread in a day.

Christiana needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk, and firewood, etc., and also milk, rice, biscuits, etc. to restock her inventory. She said your assistance would be most welcome and helpful to her.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grain for resale

loans.name: Juan Martin

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Juan Martín Pavón tiene un problema que con las lluvias su techo se está deteriorando y hay mucha humedad en su casa, la preocupación de él y su esposa la señora Eva Griselda, es más fácil que los niños se puedan enfermar.
El señor Juan Martín ya ha sido acreditado de FVP lo cual pago puntual mente. Ahora esta solicitando su cooperación para este nuevo crédito y así realizar su mejora lo mas pronto posible.
Don Juan Martín y su esposa se dedican a la venta de ropa usada en diferentes partes de la ciudad estés el ingreso familiar y con el cual planean pagar este préstamo.
texts.en:
Juan Martín Pavón's house has a problem: the rains are causing the roof to deteriorate and there is a lot of dampness in the house. Juan and his wife Eva Griselda are concerned that this makes it easier for their children to fall ill. Juan has already received a loan from FVP, and is punctual with his repayments. He is now seeking a new loan in order to make repairs to his home as soon as possible. Juan and his wife work selling second-hand clothes in different parts of the city. They will use this family income to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make roof repairs

loans.name: Kujoji

texts.en:
Kujoji T. is sixty-five years old. He is married and has four children. One if his children is a male and the rest are all females. He lives with his family in a town called Somanya in the Eastern Region of Ghana. According to him, all of his children dropped out of school for no apparent reason, despite the fact that he was ready to sponsor them to the ultimate.

Kujoji owns a corn mill for commercial purposes in his community. Since he has a monopoly, all the people in his town come to him for such services. He mills corn for food vendors and all. Kujoji has been in business for over ten years. He has hired people who work for him. He says his son also works with him. He wants a loan so he can acquire more mills for other purpose such as for milling vegetables and other foodstuffs. It is his dream to expand his business by opening branches in neighboring communities.

loans.use: To buy more milling machines

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther F. is 32 years old and a married woman with three children. Currently all her kids are in school. Esther has been selling frozen foods like chicken, pork, mutton, fish, sausages, etc., in the local market of Agogo for four years now. She does not have adequate funds to support her business. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more cartons of frozen foods such as fish, chicken, and pork to enable her to raise enough income to expand her sales. It has been her desire to open another branch in the next three towns from where she is selling presently, because customers from those communities come to her to buy meat, which she thinks is quite a distance. She would also be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is a 39 year old trader. She is married with six children,  She trades in corn dough at the community market in Agogo, where she lives. She has being selling corn dough for the past seventeen years and through this business she has supported one child through senior high school. She also assists her husband with supporting the family. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of corn dough to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increased prices, due to the current food crisis in the country. To get the corn dough, you first soak the maize in water for about a week and then it is sieved for milling. This is used to prepare a food called ‘Banku’ a local porridge. She wants the loan to buy a larger inventory of maize to reduce her frequent traveling to villages in search of supplies. Rose wants to save more  for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of maize to prepare corn dough.

loans.name: Nzambe Malamu Group

texts.en: Bana M. runs a stand with a variety of goods such as soaps, canned tomatoes, sugar, salt, sardines, corned beef, milk, tea, matches, etc. Bana started his business in 1995 with a capital of $4, buying peanuts and reselling them from house to house. With hard work, determination and good management, Bana has succeeded in growing his business. When he heard about Hope in April 2008, he decided to join one of the Hope’s groups. He has received three loans that he has successfully and completely paid back. Bana makes about $60 per week. He plans, with future loans, to purchase a corn mill. Bana sells in the central area of Kinshasa. He is 52 years old and single.

loans.use: To strengthen business operating capital

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: La señora Juana Antonia S. R. es casada y trabaja como empleada domestica, su esposo trabaja como chofer de camiones, por el momento ellos no tienen hijos, motivo por el cual la señora Juana Antonia S. está solicitando un préstamo para terminar la construcción de su casa para que en el momento en que ellos decidan tener hijos su hogar este en buenas condiciones para mantenerlos adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Juana Antonia S. R. is married and works as a maid, while her husband works as a truck driver. They do not have children yet, however Juana's motive in seeking this loan is to complete the construction of their house so that when they decide to have children their home is in good condition to raise them.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete construction of her home

loans.name: Puits De Jacob Group

texts.en: Gabi provides fresh fish to women to sell at different markets in Kinshasa. He likes this business because it gives him opportunities to know many different women. Gabi started the business in 2005 with a capital of $100. He has worked very hard to increase his profit. His business makes 80% of profit for each sale. He purchases his fish at Kalemie at Tanganyika Lake in Eastern Congo and ships them to his customers in Kinshasa. Gabi would like a loan to buy more fish. He has been Hope’s faithful client since April 2008. Gabi is 28 years old and single. His dream is to make more business travels throughout the world.

loans.use: To purchase more fish in order to generate more profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sang De L'agneau Group

texts.en: Marie M. has diversified her business by adding an embroidery machine and a freezer in order to sell cool soft drinks.  Marie’s Faith has grown from her Business. She has experienced God’s Love and presence through her business. Maria's future ambition is to open a big and well equipped sewing workshop in order to make and provide companies and local shops with uniforms and Congolese made clothing.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and resell spare parts

loans.name: Yesenia Guadalupe

texts.es:
L. señorita Yesenia tiene un negocio propio que viene D. tradición en tradición no solamente en su familia sino en L. D. todos los mexicanos. Ellos L. han ido conservando ya que su negocio “Piñatas S.” tiene 15 años exportando piñatas a  Estados Unidos.
ElL. solicitando este crédito para invertir en material para L. elaboración D. más piñatas  asi  su negocio seguirá creciendo y será más productivo.
texts.en:
Yesenia owns her own business based on a tradition that doesn't belong just to her family, but a tradition that belongs to all Mexicans. She is helping conserve this tradition through her business 'Piñatas S.', which has exported piñatas to the United States for 15 years. She is seeking a loan to buy materials to make more piñatas, so that her business can continue to grow and become more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the manufacture of piñatas

loans.name: Presentacion Raul

texts.es: Don Presentación  tiene 59 años de edad, reside en Villa Reconciliación en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa le tiene cuatro hijos, que están independientes, ella se desempeña como modista, hace costura y vende ropa. Su negocio es la siembra y venta de frijoles, y en tiempos libres también es chofer de tractor para madera en rosita al norte del país, un trabajo cansado ya que la ruta es a muchos kilómetro de la capital, pero le pagan bien el viaje, tiene veintidós años en cultivar frijoles y seis años de conductor, inicio con dinero prestado y unos ahorros que tenia, sus planes son construir cuartos para alquiler, para mejorar sus ingresos, sus objetivos es aumentar mas el cultivo que le generen mas ventas. A futuro es hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Presentación is a 59-year-old man who lives in Villa Reconciliación in the city of Managua. He and his wife have four grown-up children. His wife works as a seamstress who makes clothing and sells it. He grows and sells beans for a living. In his free time, he also works driving a timber tractor in Rosita, located in the northern part of the country. This is a very exhausting job because his route is many kilometers away from the capital. However, he is paid well for each trip. He has been growing beans for twenty-two years and driving the tractor for six. He started his business with his savings and with borrowed money. He plans on building rooms to rent out. In order to boost his earnings, his goal is to increase his crops so that he can generate more sales. In the future, he would like to do some home improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build two rooms to rent

loans.name: Gualas

texts.es:
El señor Gualas C. L. es soltero, el trabaja como operario de producción y tiene ya trabajando 5 años en esa empresa. 
El señor Gualas C. esta solicitando un préstamo para hacer una construcción de un cuarto en la planta baja de su casa, el cual le servirá en un futuro si decide formar una familia, para que de esa manera les pueda ofrecer un hogar optimo para vivir en buenas condiciones y mantenerlos adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Gualas C. L. is single and has worked as a production operator with the same company for 5 years. He is seeking a loan to build a room on the ground floor of his house. This will serve him in the future if he decides to form a family, as he will be able to offer an optimum home with good living conditions to support them well.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room on the ground floor of his house

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es: Doña Sandra es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de joyas de oro y plata, comenzó a vender hace veintidós años lo cual inicio con dinero que su esposo le daba, procreo cuatro hijos tres están independientes y uno estudia la carrera de derecho, su esposo se desempeña como químico, estos préstamo que hace en afodenic han sido de gran beneficios ya que han aumentado su inventario de prendas y podido captar clientes con la variedad de sus productos nuevos, esta es su sexta solicitud y va invertir en infraestructura en la construcción de compra de materiales como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro , zinc, perlines y otros materiales para hacer un porche en su casa y estar mas cómoda con su familia, sus objetivos es aumentar su inventario en las ventas y apoyar a su hija en los estudios.
texts.en:
Sandra is a hardworking woman who dedicates herself to selling gold and silver jewellery. She started to sell twenty two years ago with some money that her husband gave her. She had four kids, three of them currently live independently of her and one is studying law at college; her husband is a chemist. The loans Afodenic have given her have been very beneficial as they have increased her range products and she has been able to win more clients due to her variety of new products. This is her sixth request and she will invest it in infrastructure in buying materials like stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc and other materials to build a porch for her house so her family will be more comfortable. Her objectives are to increase the inventory of her sales and to support her daughter in her studies.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a porch/Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer un porche

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: El señor Aurelio D. L. C. H. ya tiene 7 años trabajando como jefe D. área, es casado, tiene un hijo, su esposa padece D. una enfermedad D. cataratas en los ojos que le impiD. ver bien, motivo por el cual el señor Aurelio está solicitando un préstamo para mandar hacerle una cirugía a su esposa para que pueda ver mejor y para que ellos puedan vivir sin preocupaciones por L. enfermedad que padece L. esposa D. el señor Aurelio.
texts.en:
Aurelio D. L. C. H. has worked for the past 7 years as an area manager. He is married and has one son. His wife suffers from cataracts in her eyes, which impair her vision. Aurelio is seeking a loan so his wife can have surgery in order to see better. Aurelio's family will then be able to live without the worries caused by this illness.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for his wife's surgery

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
