Julio, who lives with his eight children in Ahuachapan, El Salvador has worked as a wood cutter for over 20 years. In his words, Julio works hard to "move the family forward"--hard work which includes not only his day job as a cutter, but also the cultivation of beans and corn.

With this home improvement loan, Julio is hoping to improve the quality of the walls in the room where his four youngest school-aged children sleep. Currently the walls are made from wooden slats and Julio would like to better insulate the room. Though this home improvement is necessary for the health of the family and in his opinion should come first, Julio hopes to apply for further loans in the future that would allow him to buy a chain saw for his wood-cutting work.

loans.use: insulating the walls of children's room

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Sandra del Carmen Ríos Hernández tiene la edad de 48 años, su estado civil es acompañada Doña Sandra tiene 3 hijos sus edades son las siguientes un varón de  22 años de edad y trabaja por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 17 año de edad trabaja por cuenta propia y su hijo menor de 14 años que trabaja por cuenta propia, su compañero de vida labora como comerciante, sus propósitos son incrementar en su negocio para expandirlo mas en su casa de habitación y obtener mas ingresos para su familia sus deseos son conseguir mas clientes para su negocio para que este incremente por la demanda de sus productos que sean necesaR. para uso diario sus sueños son que sus hijos estudien una carrera profesional ya que desde muy pequeños han tenido que trabajar para salir adelante y es por eso que ellos no han recibido estudio y en sus sueños le gustaría que sus hijos fueran unos profesionales pero debido a la situación se vieron obligados a trabajar para aportar dinero para su Mama y salir adelante.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es venta en general en la que ofrece: ropa calzado, perfumes y además de este negocio tiene una pulpería en la que ofrece golosinas, sopas y granos básicos, la ubicación de su negocio es  en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 12 años, Doña Sandra dio inicio a esta humilde actividad con el apoyo de sus hijos y su esposo y decide establecer en su casa de habitación con pocos productos por lo que sus clientes empezaron a recurrir a su pulpería y mas tarde decide establecer otro negocio como lo fue la mercadería en general en la que inicio ofreciendo ropa y cosméticos por lo que su negocio consiguió mas afluencia de clientes con esta nueva idea y fue así como obtuvo ambos negocios ya que establecerlos le ha costado mucho esfuerzo por lo que necesita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar la compra de cosméticos, ropa y productos escolares ya que se acerca la entrada de clases y así ofrecerá a sus clientes una variedad en productos escolares por lo que agradece a Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones que se preocupan por las necesidades del negocio de cada uno de los clientes.
texts.en:
Sandra del Carmen Ríos Hernández is 48 years old and married. Sandra has 3 sons, a 22 year old , a 17 year old, and a 14 year old, all of whom work on their own. Her husband works as a merchant. Her goal is to increase his business, which is located in his house, so that she can expand it and thus earn more money for the family. Her desire is to obtain more clients for her business so that it grows due to demand for her products that are staple items. Her dream is that her children are able to study to become professionals, since they have had to work from since they were very little to get ahead and contribute money for the household expenses and thus haven't been able to study. She works in sales generally, offering clothing, shoes, perfumes. In addition to this business, she has a small grocery store in which she sells sweets, soup, and basic grains. The location of the business is her house and has had it for 12 years. Sandra started this modest business, with the support of her children and husband, in her house with few products. She later started the other business with more merchandise, through which obtained more clients, and thus came to have the two businesses. They have cost her a lot of money which is why she needs the loan, to be used as work capital to purchase cosmetics, clothing and school products since the beginning of school year is approaching. She will thus be able to offer her clients a variety of school products, for which is grateful to Fundación León 2000 and the organizations that concern themselves with the necessities of each client's business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La Señora María Magdalena Santamaría Ríos tiene la edad de 39 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña María tiene 2 hijos de las siguientes edades su hijo mayor de 14 años cursa el 2 año de secundaria y su hijo de 5 años cursa el 3 nivel de preescolar, su compañero de vida labora por cuenta propia, sus propósitos son seguir manteniendo la atención de sus clientes y así mismo el nivel de calidad del pan que ella elabora ya que tiene que ofrecer a sus clientes lo mejor los sueños de Doña María como el de toda madre es dar lo mejor de ella para sus hijos, apoyándoles y brindándoles su ayuda en cualquier circunstancias para que puedan llegar a ser profesionales de éxito servidores de la sociedad, del país y de su propio hogar, el deseo de Doña María Magdalena  es que Dios le siga concediendo las fuerzas y la salud para seguir trabajando duro y ver algún día pero no muy lejano, su negocio mas surtido para poder mejorar su vivienda y disfrutar de mejores condiciones junto a su familia.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica la Señora María Magdalena es la elaboración de pan, ella ofrece variedades como pan dulce, pan simple, cachos, picos, bonetes, pudín, entre otros, el negocio esta ubicado del Colegio José de la Cruz Mena ½ cuadra al oeste, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio son 5 años, Doña María empieza su negocio como un proyecto, ya que para el año 2001 quedo desempleada dado a un recorte de personal en la empresa que ella trabajaba y solamente su marido quedo trabajando, por lo que ella necesitaba proporcionar ingresos  a su familia , es entonces que decide establecer una panadería en su casa de habitación aunque al principio no fue fácil realizar este tipo de trabajo, sin embargo Doña María aprovecho la oportunidad ya que esa seria la única panadería ubicada en ese sector y fue así como surge su nuevo negocio por lo que necesita este financiamiento para la compra de mas materia prima y así suplir las demandas de sus clientes como lo es harina, huevo, mantequilla y sartenes de moldes y agradece a Fundación León 2000 y organizaciones amigas que contribuyen a esta causa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Magdalena S. R. is 39 years old, she is married and has two children. Her oldest son is 14 years old and is in his sophomore year, and her 5 year old son is in kindergarten. Her husband works by himself, and her objective is to keep the quality of the bread that she makes, and to maintain her customer's satisfaction. Maria wants to provide the best for her children so that they can become professionals and give back to society. Maria wishes that God gives her strength and health in order to continue her hard work and be able to improve her home and living conditions and enjoy them with her family. Maria has a breadmaking business. She makes different types of bread such as sweet bread, simple bread, and pudding (among others). She has had her business for the past 5 years. Maria started her business after she was laid off from the company where she worked in 2001, and since her husband was the only one working she needed to start working in order to help support her family. At that moment she decided to open a bakery in her home. Although at the beginning it was not easy, Maria has used the opportunity that her bakery is the only one in the neighborhood. Maria needs financing in order to buy raw materials such as flour, butter, eggs, and baking pans. She is grateful to the Leon 2000 Foundation and all other foundations that have helped her.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca F. es madre de familia tiene 2 hijos de edad escolar pera los cual desea lo mejor.
 A su vivienda le está haciendo falta la terminación de la barda y el piso de concreto, desea realizar la mejor lo mas pronto posible ya que ella tiene que trabajar casi todo el día y su esposo está trabajando en la construcción en la ciudad de  Los Cabos Baja California México, es por eso que quiere la seguridad de ella y sus niños.
texts.en:
Francisca is a mother of two children who attend school. She wants only the best for them. She needs to make repairs to the walls and concrete floor of her home as soon as possible to help keep her children safe. She needs to work almost the entire day, and her husband is also away doing construction work in the city of Los Cabos in Mexico.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make important repairs to her home and ensure the security of her family

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Chhoeun C., 55, works as a housewife and lives in Siem Reap province. Her husband, Chhen Sothy, pictured here, is the head of the family and works very hard to earn an income. He is a security guard at Angkor Temple and he can make US$ 60 a month. Of course, this couple also gets support from two of their four children who are employed as security guards at Angkor Temple just like their father. The other two are students.

Mrs. Chhoeun C. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to make a new investment. She will purchase souvenir goods for her school-aged children to operate a business whenever they are free from school.

loans.use: To sell souvenirs

loans.name: Hoeung

texts.en: Hoeung H., 51, sells groceries to support her family. She lives with her husband and one of her daughters in Siem Reap province. She typically makes about US$ 5 each day and her husband, Chan Yen, makes about US$ 1 each day as a farmer. Hoeung H. would like a loan of US$ 300 to add grocery inventory to meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: To add grocery inventory for her shop

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chorn S., 28, pictured with her husband and her son, is the mother of two young children and lives in Siem Reap with her husband. Since 2000, she has been selling souvenirs in front of Angkor Temple to earn a living and is able to make US$ 10 in revenue a day, while her husband works as a police official and makes US$ 30 a month.

Mrs. Chorn S. is asking for a loan of US$ 600 to add to her inventory of souvenirs.

loans.use: To add to her inventory of souvenirs

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy C., 32, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She works in a grocery store and typically makes US$ 5 a day, while her husband, Chhive Mab, is a true entrepreneur, selling pork in a busy market. On average, he makes US$ 20 in revenue a day. This couple has three school-aged children. Mrs. Soy C. is asking a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase pigs to expand the butcher shop.

loans.use: To expand butcher shop

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Lun M., 39, lives in Siem Reap and works as a chef and raises pigs. She typically makes US$ 1.50 a day. Her husband is a construction worker, building houses. On average, he makes US$ 2.50 a day. This couple has three school-aged children. Mrs. Lun M. is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to renovate her leaking roof.

loans.use: To fix her house

loans.name: Pai

texts.en: Pai R. is one of the vegetables vendors in a busy market in Siem Reap province and earns US$ 4 to $5 in profit a day. Her husband and her mother both are living with her. Her husband is self-employed as a moto-taxi driver. On average, he makes US$ 15 in revenue a day. Pai R. is asking for a loan of US$ 700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to operate a taxi.

loans.use: To operate a moto-taxi

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen K. is 55 years old and has a business selling bananas in a busy market in Siem Reap province. She makes US$ 10 a day and her husband, Kim Hout, 54, makes US$ 6 a day arranging wedding ceremonies, renting out chairs and tables. She will use this loan to purchase bananas from individual growers for re-sale to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: To purchase bananas from individual growers

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: Seak N., 31, is married and lives in Siem Reap with her husband. Since 1992, she has been selling groceries to earn a living and is able to make US$ 7 a day, while her husband makes $1.70 a day working as a police official. This couple has three children, two of whom are students while one is too young to attend school. Seak N. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to add to her grocery inventory.

loans.use: To add to her grocery inventory.

loans.name: Pras

texts.en: Pras S. is a 27-year-old grocery vendor in Siem Reap province. She earns US$ 4/day selling various kinds items and lives with her 30-year-old husband and their 2 children. Two of her children are too young to be students. Pras S. will use this loan to help buy farmland to grow rice. In the future, she'd like to see her children graduate from university.

loans.use: To purchase farmland

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Min K. is 28 years old and lives in Siem Reap province with her husband and her child. She is a housewife, cooking food for the family members. Her husband operates a power-washing service from home, making around US$ 5 a day. Mrs. Min K. wants to earn more income. She aims to improve their standard of living, so she is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit to breed pigs. She believes that this activity will provide her family more to live on.

loans.use: To breed pigs.

loans.name: Ut's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four borrowers, all of whom live in Ompeul Commune in Siem Reap Province. The group leader, Mrs. Ut N., age 27, makes a living selling groceries in front of her house. She has been selling groceries since 2007 and currently earns approximately US$ 3 each day. She is married and has one child who is still young and is cared for by her. Her husband, aged 45, is a local construction worker.

Recently, N. sold all her groceries to customers at her store and she hopes to increase her grocery inventory to revive her business. Thus she has applied for a loan to purchase a range of groceries to sell.

These are the three other borrowers:

Han T. who sells clothes is a widow, aged 50. She needs a loan to buy additional clothing for sale.

Hiem I., 53, is a widow. She sells porridge out of her home and is requesting a loan to enlarge her business.

Onn ChanT. is 32 years old and makes a living as a motorcycle taxi driver. He needs a loan to replace his old motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a range of groceries to sell

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Mr. Som M. lives in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Long Reth, is a chicken breeder. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to provide a better life for their family. Thus, Mr. Som M. has decided to ask for a loan to buy 600 ducks and duck food to start a duck-breeding business. He hopes to increase his income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

Mr. Som M. is 49 years old and the father of six children, one of whom is an immigrant working in Thailand. Two others are farmers helping their father on the plantation and the remaining three are attending the local school. His wife is presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy 600 ducks and duck food to start a duck breeding business.

loans.name: Luy

texts.en:
Luy A., 54, is married and lives in Siem Reap province with her husband and seven of her children. She purchases and sells rice in her village and is able to make US$ 5 a day, while her husband makes around US$ 3 a day by working as farmer growing rice. Three of her children are employed as construction workers.

Luy A. is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase more rice. She will purchase rice and take off the husk with the intention of re-selling the rice and turning a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice for re-sale

loans.name: Yoeum

texts.en:
Yoeum S. is 30 years old and works as a professional tailor from her home. She has been running that business for about 10 years, and she can make around US$ 2.50 a day, while her husband is a construction worker, making US$ 3 a day. This couple has five children, three of whom are students while two are too young to attend school.

Yoeum S. would like to use this loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. The bike will allow her husband to stop paying for public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Chhung

texts.en:
Chhung L., 30, is married and lives in Siem Reap province. She grows rice and corn to earn a living and is able to make US$ 2.50 a day, while her husband has a business catching fish and re-selling them at the market to earn approximately US$ 2.50 a day as well.

This couple has three children and all of them are students. Mrs. Chhung L. is asking for a loan of US$ 350 to purchase a water pump in case her farm experiences difficulty with water.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun S., 51, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She raises pigs and together with her husband, she is a farmer growing rice. This couple earns a combined income of around US$ 6 a day.

Sun S., pictured here, has two children, one of whom is a farmer and the other one is a student. She would like to use this loan to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, rice seed and a water pump in case her farm has difficulty with water.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticide, and a pump

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Soeurn H. is a villager in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. He is a motorbike taxi driver. 

His wife, Mrs. Pach Met, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she faces a problem because she usually pays a lot of money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her field. Thus, Mr. Soeurn H. decided to request a loan to buy two oxen to breed and use to plow the field. 

He is 39 years old and the father of five children, one of whom helps the mother on the plantation while the others are enrolled in the local school. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to breed and use to plow the field.

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Run M., 37, pictured here, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She and her husband are farmers and earn a combined income of around US$ 2.50 a day. Her husband sometimes goes to fishing to earn extra money to support the family. This couple has five children; three of them are students and the other two are too young to attend school. Mrs. Run M. is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase fishing implements for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase fishing implements

loans.name: Nai

texts.en:
Mr. Nai N. was born in 1968 and now lives in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. 

His wife, Mrs. Khen Kong, is a chicken breeder. She earns a lower income than desired to provide a better life for their children. In order to improve their lives, Mr. Nai N. decided to request a loan to buy ducks and duck food to start breeding ducks. 

He is the father of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another is a laborer and the others are attending the local school. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy ducks and duck food to start breeding ducks

loans.name: Khao

texts.en: Khao S. is 29 years old and lives in Siem Reap province with her husband and four of her children. She has a business selling soup and roast beef from her home and is able to make around US$ 4 a day. Her husband, Sok S., 42, grows and sells rice and makes about US$ 2 a day. Mrs. Khao S. is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase fertilizer for her husband’s farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean V. is 39 years old and works at home, looking after her children and cooking food for them. Her husband, Sorn Sam, 49, has a business catching fish and selling them at the market to earn approximately US$ 8 a day.

This couple has seven children; five of them are students and two are too young to attend school. Mrs. Mean V. would like to take out a loan of US$ 500 to make a new investment. She plans to operate a grocery store.

loans.use: To operate a grocery store.

loans.name: Path

texts.en:
Path R., 50, is married and lives with her husband and her children in Siem Reap province. She and her husband together are farmers growing rice. Beside this activity, this couple also works collecting palm juice and refining it to make sugar palm. On average, they make a combined income of around US$2.50 a day.

This couple has five children, two of whom are students while three others are farmers. Mrs. Path R. would like to take out a loan of US$ 600 to breed pigs and dig a pond to store water. This water will be used to irrigate their crops in the dry season.

loans.use: To breed pigs and dig a pond

loans.name: Nun

texts.en:
Mrs. Nun K. is a villager in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. 

Her husband, Mr. Sorn Sim, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He now faces a problem, because he does not have enough money to grow rice during the dry season. Thus, Mrs. Nun K. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer. 

She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Ni Putu Suantini

texts.id:
Dari pengalaman yang dialami setelah bergabung dengan Yayasan DINARI melalui pinjaman yang diperoleh pada periode terdahulu, Ni Putu Suantini sudah mempunyai dua ekor induk, Maka untuk pinjaman kedua, akan dipergunakan membeli satu ekor lagi dan selebihnya untuk persiapan membeli pakan ternaknya. Untuk menambah jumlah ternaknya Ni Putu Suantini membeli satu babi penggemukan yang sudah siap menjadi calon induk lagi jenis Landrace.

Penggembangan usaha ternak ini dilakukan dengan harapan penghasilan yang didapat tidak menunggu sampai enam bulan, tetapi penghasilan dari menjual bibit babi bisa dilakukan setiap bulan sehingga dapat membantu penghasilan Made Warsanto, suaminya. Saat ini Putu Suantini  tinggal bersama Made Warsanto suaminya dan anaknya terakhirnya yang masih sekolah ditingkat dasar. Sedang anaknya pertama  pertama dan kedua  sekolah di tingkat atas diluar daerah. Dari hasil ternak inilah keluarga ini dapat memenuhi keperluan anak-anaknya yang masih sekolah. Penghasilan bersih dalam setiap dua sampai tiga bulan dapat mencapai Rp.600.000,- Harapan kedepannya usaha ternak dapat berkembang sehingga hasilnya dapat mencukupi keperluan keluarganya.
texts.en:
Ni Putu Suantini participated with DINARI foundation loan program in the past. She is now able to own two breeding pigs. She is now planning to participate in another program and she wants to use the money to buy another breeding pig and also to buy pig foods. She is going to buy a breeding pig from a Landrace variant.

Ni Putu is living with her husband, Made Warsanto, and their 3rd child who is still in Elementary school. Their first two children are already in Senior High school outside the town. Ni Putu and her husband use the proceed from this pig farming to finance the education of their children. She can earn IDR 600 thousand (around USD 57) in a 2 - 3 month period.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a piglet and it's feed

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn P. is a widow in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. She makes Khmer cake and sells it for a little money in order to support her family. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. 

On her plantation, she faces an obstacle, because she has an ox that cannot plow her field. In order to plow the rice field, Mrs. Vorn P. decided to request a loan to buy an ox to use with to the old one for plowing.

loans.use: To buy an ox for plowing.

loans.name: Lut

texts.en:
Lut L., 40, is a rice farmer who lives in Siem Reap province with her husband. She grows rice and raises pigs and makes around US$ 3.50 a day. Her husband is a fisherman and sometimes he also helps his wife in farming as well. He makes US$ 3 from these activities. This couple has four children, two of whom are students, while one is a fisherman and the youngest is too young to attend school.

Mrs. Lut L. would like to use this loan to purchase fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem S., 39, is a widow and resides with two of her children in Siem Reap province. Since 2006, she has been selling grocery products to earn a living and is able to make around US$3 a day. Her two children are students. Mrs. S. would like to take out a loan of US $1000 to purchase groceries in bulk in order to receive a volume discount and also to meet her client’s demand.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk for resale

loans.name: Penh

texts.en: Penh C., 67, is an elderly mother and operates a business from her home selling various kinds of grocery products. She is a widow and resides with two of her children in the Siem Reap province. On average, she makes US$4 a day and is aided by her child, who is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver, earning US$3 a day. Penh C. would like to take out a loan of US $800 to purchase another motorbike and trailer. The new bike will be rented to earn extra income to meet family expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a bike and trailer.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng D. is 42 years old and works as policeman in Battambang province. He makes US$3 a day and his wife who self-employed as a grocery vendor, makes around US$2 a day as well. From her home she sells soup and roast beef. She is 39 years old and has three children. Two of her children are students and one is too young to attend school. This couple also looks after their old parents.

To earn more income to help support the family, she needs a loan of US$1000 to reinvest in her grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for resale

loans.name: Thoung

texts.en:
S., 35, who lives in Kandal Province, makes a living providing printed invitation letters for wedding parties. She has been running the business since 2003 and is earning around US$ 5 per day. She is married and the mother of three children, who are still living in the family home. Her husband Sok Savy, 36, is a military policeman.

S. presently hopes to have a new investment for her husband, thus she would like to ask for a loan of US$ 1200 for her husband to use as capital to open up a shop for repairing electronics. With any remainder of the loan, she purposes to decorate her house.

loans.use: to open up a shop for repairing electronics

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila B., a 32-year-old mother, grows rice on her farm. She has only one child, which means she feels like she has  big responsibility to her. 

She doesn’t care if she has to work all day: all the sweat, working the dirt, and feeling the heat of the sun is just to make sure that she has enough food for her family. She and her husband till the land, which her father-in-law owned. Together, they work hard to meet the needs of their family. 

She would like to own farm equipment like a thresher to minimize the expenses she has during harvest. She believes that if she had the equipment, sending her child to school would not be a problem.

She is asking for a loan from CEVI of Php 12,000 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides that she needs. In this way, she believes she would triple her yield and contribute well to the family income. Specifically, she will use the loan to sustain her farm.

CEVI helps Mila sustain her business. Through credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage services, all their clients will have the chance to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To purhase pesticides and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mrs. Horn H. is a villager in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder. Since her business of breeding ducks is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks and duck food. 

Her husband, Mr. Tim Ken, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Horn H. is a 32-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks and duck food.

loans.name: Tang

texts.en:
Tang C., age 30, is a taxi driver with a private company in Phnom Penh, Battambang. He has been driving for 8 years and earns about $7 US a day. His wife, Kong Thida, 26, works selling wood from their home in Battambang province. On average, she makes $3 US a day. 
Mr. Tang C. would like to take out a loan of $1000 US to purchase a used car to rent out. This will provide extra income to help improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a used car to rent out.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena O., a 34-year-old mother of four children, is a rice grower. She lives in Bunawan Agusan Del Sur, a town known for rice farming where 35,757 people live.  Lorena started her business with a small parcel of land. Now she has acquired her own 1-hectare farm, which she and her husband till to support the needs of their children.

She is asking a loan from CEVI of Php 12,000 to purchase pesticides to increase farm productivity. She also will use the loan to buy a gallon of mega-yield and five sacks of fertilizer to have a better yield.

She wants to buy more rice field land in the future. In this way, she believes she will have a good future to give to her children. She is happy about being part of the CEVI program. Now, she enjoys the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage services they give to their clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Cheab

texts.en: Cheab S., age 26, is a professional tailor and makes about US $4 a day. She has been in this business for 8 years and her husband makes US$5 a day as a mechanic. This couple live in Battambang province and have one little child. Mrs. Cheab S. is asking for a loan from Kiva via Credit to invest in a new business. She will use the loan to operate a grocery store.

loans.use: To operate a grocery store.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en: Sarun M., age 35, is married and lives with her husband and five of her children in Battambang province. She and her husband are fish sellers and make a combined income of around US $2.5 a day. Five of their children are students. Mrs. Sarun M. will use this loan to increase the quantity of fish that she resells at market.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of fish to resell at market.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong S. is 34 years old and lives with her parents, sister and brother. She had been employed with a company but now earns a living growing rice and crops with her sister and brother. She wants to reinvest in her farmland, so she has decided to take out a loan of US $1000 to purchase rice, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase rice, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch C. is a villager in Tadork Pong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. 

On this plantation, she faces a problem, because she usually pays someone to plow the field. Thus, Mrs. Touch C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and plowing the field for cultivation. 

She is a 46-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other is a construction.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and plowing the rice field for cultivation.

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Hean K., 30, is married and resides in Battambang province, with her husband and two young children. She is a farmer, growing vegetables and oranges. She sells her oranges and vegetables at the market and is able to make about US $2 a day. Her husband, Kong Veasna, 28, pictured here, is a worker and earns US$5 a day. Two of their children are students.

Mrs. Hean K. would like to take out a loan of US $500 to purchase a  water pump. The rest of the loan will be used to purchase more orange trees.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and orange trees.

loans.name: Ith

texts.en: Mrs. Ith H. is a 41-year-old widow who lives in Tadork Pong village in Takeo province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase a cow for breeding and for plowing the field for cultivation. Mrs. Ith H. is the mother of three children, two of whom are construction workers while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding and for plowing her field for cultivation.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S., age 34, lives with her niece and has a business selling grocery products from her home. She earns, on average, US $3 a day. Chea S. is single and lives in Battambang province. She would like to use this loan to increase her supply of grocery products to meet her client’s demands.

loans.use: To increase her supply of grocery products.

loans.name: Edralen

texts.en:
Edralen L. is a 27-year-old father of five children. He lives in Bunawan Agusan Del Sur, Philippines, whose population reached 35,757 people, most of whom depend on commercial business and farming for their livelihood. He and his wife work in their field every day, because they want to establish a good future for their children. Now, they are tilling a two-hectare (~5 acre) field and all their produce is reserved for family consumption. The rest of the crops are sold to traders in Trento Agusan Del Sur.

He is asking a loan from CEVI to purchase urea and ammonium fertilizers for his farm. He will also use part of the loan to help start another business. In this way, he will be able to contribute well to the family income. Through this loan, he believes, he will be able to send all his children to school and provide them the things that they need. 

CEVI is helping Edralen establish his farm. Through the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage services that they give, more and more entrepreneurs like Edralen can expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Sarong

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarong T. is a villager in Dork Pong village in Takeo province. She is a coconut seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she has decided to request a loan to buy more coconuts, using the rest of the money to buy a cart to transport her coconuts to sell door-to-door. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Pho Sokun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. Mrs. Sarong T. is 55 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a worker in a petroleum station while the other is employed in a garment factory. Her husband is also presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts, using the rest of the money to buy a cart to transport her coconuts to sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en: Chhan N., age 46, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She has been a vegetables seller for about 10 years and makes US $7 in net profit a day. Her husband grows vegetables and provides them to his wife daily, to sell at the market. This couple, together, have seven children, three who are students.  Mrs. Chhan N. would like to use this loan to purchase a vegetable stand in the market, to help reduce the monthly rental fee.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable stand in the market.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Yan P., age 37, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She and her husband are ice-cream sellers and are able to make a combine revenue of around US $20 a day. They have been in this business for 8 years and the couple have four school-aged children. Beside their children, they need to feed two nieces. Mrs. Yan P. is asking a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike and cart to transport ice-cream for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and trailer to transport ice-cream for resale

loans.name: Kul

texts.en: Kul K., 29, is single and lives with her elderly mother, sister and brother. She is a painter, and makes US $180 a month. She is aided by her sister who is currently employed as a waitress, at a restaurant, with a salary US $150 a month. Kul K. is asking a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This will reduce the cost that she spends everyday on public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en: Chhin S. is a widowed farmer, living in the province of Siem Reap with her mother and three of her children. She grows and sells rice, and on average she makes about US$8 in revenue every day. However, it is not enough to support her family, so one of her children sends money from his construction work every month. She will use the loan to purchase rice and take off the husk, with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice for sale.

loans.name: Veang

texts.en: Veang R., 58, is an old mother who resides in the province of Siem Reap. Her husband, Seak Thy, 60, pictured here, is a rice farmer and makes less than one dollar each day. This couple has four children, two of whom are employed as construction workers. They always provide money to help raise their standard of living. Veang R. would like to take out a loan of US$700 to purchase fertilizers and rice seed for her husband’s farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and rice seed.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita J., the 27-year-old mother of two children, grows rice on her farm. Her life is totally focused on farming, because this where they get money to pay school fees, water and electricity bills, and to meet the needs of her family. She and her husband work together to raise enough food for the family. They plant rice because they love the work and find it very profitable for the whole family.

She is asking a CEVI loan of Php 12,000 to purchase the fertilizer and pesticide that her farm needs. She believes that, by doing so, she can triple her yield and earn bigger profits in her business. She also is looking into some other possible areas to augment their income. She will also use part of the loan to start another line of business. They dream of having their children graduate from college and finish a degree.

CEVI helps Teresita sustain her business. CEVI will continue to spread the seed of service to uplift the lives of the Filipinos. Through its microfinancing program, everybody is able to start a business. They are also provided with credit assistance, training, and insurance services to help their businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Oem

texts.en: Mrs. Oem K. is a villager in Tuol Tro village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to purchase fertilizer and a pump machine to make her crops more productive. Thus, Mrs. Oem K. decided to ask for a loan. Her husband, Mr. Oeun Samnang, is a fisherman. Mrs. Oem K. is 25 years old and the mother of of three children, all of whom are too young to wok or study. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: for fertilizer and a irrigation pump machine to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Din

texts.en: Mrs. Din H. is a villager in Knar Roung village in Takeo province. She is a chicken middleman. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more chicken, and she would use the rest of the money to buy mangoes to resell. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Din H. is a 60-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a translator while the other is employed in garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more chicken, and she would use the rest to buy mangoes to resell.

loans.name: Na

texts.en: Mrs. Na S. is a farmer in Tnor village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Pak Chhan, is a construction worker. Even though they have different businesses, they still earn inadequate income to support their household. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Na S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She is 35 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Chron

texts.en: Mr. Chron S. is 59 years old and now lives in Kraeng Roung village in Takeo province. He is a recycling collector. He now wants to expand his business by purchasing more recycling to resell to the factory. Thus, he is requesting a loan to buy empty bottles, cans, plastic, and so on. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions. His wife, Mrs. Choeur Yet, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Chron S. is the father of eight children, five of whom are recycling collectors also while the remaining three are enrolled in the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy empty bottles, cans, plastic and so on for recycling collection

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Mrs. Phea S. is a 30-year-old widow, and she now lives in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because her field is infertile, and she also does not have enough money to hire laborers to work the field. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Phea S. decided to ask for a loan to hire them. She hopes to increase her rice revenue, in order to support the family, with this loan.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Pork

texts.en: Pork M. is 29 years old and a resident of the Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She makes a living raising pigs which she sells to buyers after four months of raising them. To provide more income, she grows rice. She has been running her businesses for about five years. M. is married with two children; both of them are single and still live in the family home. Her husband is Neuy Block, aged 30. He is a local construction worker. To make transportation easier, M. is applying for a $500 loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work and to use for the family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Ni Wayan Dewi Artati

texts.id:
Walaupun usianya yang masih muda,namun Dewi Artati tidak berpangku tangan untuk menanti kiriman uang dari  Wayan Pri Hutama, suaminya yang bekerja di luar negeri. Sebagai kesibukan yang sekaligus sebagai pekerjaan utama adalah beternak babi.Usaha ini sudah dilakukan sejak menikah hingga sekarang. Hanya ketekunanlah yang membuat usaha ini bertahan samapi sekarang. Saat ini setiap hari sudah disibukan memelihara lima induk babi yang harus diperhatikan setiap pagi dan sore seperti memperhatikan kedua anaknya yang masih kecil-kecil. Anak pertama masih sekolah kelas dua Sekolah Dasar dan yang kedua masih balita. Wayan Tri Hutama masih menyelesaikan kontrak kerja selama satu tahun lagi baru berkumpul dengan istri dan kedua anaknya. Jadi dalam sehari harinya Wayan dewi Artati disibukan dengan kedua anaknya dan ternak-ternaknya.

Untuk pinjaman pertama kalinya ini dana dipergunakan hanya untuk persiapan membeli pakan saja, karena keperluan induk babi sudah cukup terpenuhi . Keperluan pakan ternak untuk lima ekor induk mencapai 15 kg dedak padi dan jenis makan tradisional. Dari kelima ekor induk babi biasanya diatur kehamilan induknya sehingga dalam setiap bulan dapat menjual bibit babinya. Satu induk babi melahirkan 8-10 ekor bibit babi dan yang akan dipelihara sampai satu setengah bulan dan sudah dapat dijual. Penghasilan bersih dalam satu bulan dapat mencapai Rp. 500.000,- s/d Rp.700.000,- .Dari usaha inilah Ni Wayan Dewi Artati dapat mencukupi keperluan sehari hari bersama kedua anaknya yang masih kecil-kecil dan mencukupi keperluan sehari harinya.
texts.en:
Dewi Artati is a housewife. Her husband, Wayan Pri Hutama works as a migrant worker as a laborer overseas. They have two children, the 1st one is already at elementary school and the 2nd one is still a toddler.

Dewi Artati doesn't want to just sit around awaiting for money remittance from her husband. She raises pigs to get extra money for her family. At the moment she already has 5 breeding pigs. Her daily routines are attending these pigs and also raising her two children. Her husband's labor contract at overseas will end next year, so she still have to wait for another year to get together again with her husband.

Dewi is planning to participate in the DINARI foundation's loan program. She wants to use the money to buy pig's feed. One breeding pig can produce around 8 - 10 piglets. These piglets can be sold after they are 1.5 month old. She can earn a net profit of IDR 500 thousand to 700 thousand per month (around USD 47 - 67/ month).

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Suciastini

texts.id:
Suciastini pada pinjaman periode kedua dari yayasan DINARI hanya dipergunakan untuk persiapan membeli pakan ternaknya. Saat ini Suciastini sudah disibukan dengan memelihara tiga induk. Suciatini memiliki dua putrin yang masih balita, sehingga membuat ia belum berani untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Kedua putrinya Media dan Nadia masih memerlukan perhatian lebih.

Penghasilan dari suaminya kadang tidak cukup untuk keperluan setiap harinya.Dari penghasilan ternaknya Suciastini dapat membantu pendapatan suaminya. Dari ketiga ekor induknya dalam enam bulan dapat mendapatkan penghasilan bersih sekitar Rp. 4.000.000 s/d Rp.5.000.000 setelah menjual bibit babinya. Dari hasil ternak babi inilah Suciastini dapat memperoleh tambahan penghasilan.
texts.en:
Suciastini is planning to participate in her 2nd term of loan program with DINARI foundation. She is planning to use the loan money to buy pig feeds. At the moment she already has 3 breeding pigs.

Suciati is a mother of two toddlers, Media and Nadia, who require most of her time. Therefore she doesn't have enough time to expand her business.

Her husband's income is not enough to support the family, therefore her business in this pig raising activities helps her family a lot. She can earn a net profit of IDR 4 million to 5 million per 6 month period (around USD 380 - 480 semi annually).

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Ni Putu Susilawati

texts.id:
Periode kedua dari yayasan DINARI Ni Putu Susilawati mempergunakan untuk membeli babi penggemukan untuk nantinya dijadikan calon induk. Selain itu dana selebihnya dipergunakan untuk persiapan membeli pakan ternaknya. Saat ini Ni Putu Susilawati sudah mempunyai dua induk. Pemeliharaan dilakukan dikebun belakang rumahnya agar dalam beraktifitas tidak terlalu jauh dari rumah. Kedua anaknya terkadang ikut terlibat dalam pemeliharaan babinya pada sore hari, sebab pada pagi hari harus berangkat kesekolah. Setiap hari biasanya setelah pekerjaan sebagi ibu rumah tangga selesai barulah mulai mengambil pekerjaan mengurus babi-babinya.

Suaminya adalah seorang  petani yang hanya mengandalkan hasil kebunya saja.pendapatan  dan penghasilah dalam setiap bulan masih kurang untuk mencukupi keperluan hidupnya.untuk itulah dengan tekan Ni putu susilawati merawat ternak babi untuk dapat memperoleh penghasilan tambahan.
texts.en:
The second round of funding from DINARI is going to be used by Ni Putu Susilawati to purchase pigs to be raised to become sows. The remaining fund will be used to purchase animal feed. Currently Putu Susilawati owns two sows. She raises them in her backyard so she can still do her household activity. Her two children often help in the afternoon, since they go to school in the morning. Everyday, after she is finished with her household chores she begins taking care of the sows.

Her husband is a farmer whose income from farming is not sufficient to cover all basic needs of the family. Hence Ni Putu Susilawati raises pigs to earn additional income.

Translated from Indonesian by Arliadi (Ludi) Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying sows and animal feed

loans.name: Pann

texts.en: Pann P., 53, lives in the province of Siem Reap, Cambodia, where she owns and runs a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She can plant her crops twice a year, and she was taught this by her grandfather. She is currently a good mother of seven children: five are single and two are married and live away from home. To help meet a little more of the family's needs, one her single sons is employed as a construction worker. She is married to Soun Hol, age 51, who is a domestic construction supervisor. P. hopes to have a suitable investment for her son to invest in a business of carving wood. Therefore, she decided to ask for a $500 to buy a carving machine for her son to carve the wood from the forest for sale.

loans.use: To buy a carving machine

loans.name: Lizer

texts.en:
Lizer M. owns a chemist shop in Likoni neighborhood of Mombasa, Kenya. She bought the business from its owner after being an employee in the shop. Lizer had seen the profitability of the shop while she worked there – when she had the opportunity to purchase the business, she took it and has been working to expand it ever since.

The shop sells medicines and cosmetics and also has a photocopier. Lizer purchases the medicines in Mombasa town and restocks her supplies weekly. She says that she makes a profit of about 25,000 KSH each month. This figure used to be higher, but went down due to post-election violence in Kenya. Lizer says that her profits are slowly going back up to where they were before the elections last year. 

Lizer has applied for a loan of approximately 275 USD in order to purchase more supplies of medicines and to repair the photocopier in the shop. This will be her first loan with K-MET.

Lizer is 26, single, and has two children who are both in school. She has plans to expand the chemist’s shop and hopes to open a second shop sometime in the future.

loans.use: Expansion of Chemist and Cosmetic Shop

loans.name: Rachel Mbeyu

texts.en:
Rachel Mbeyu G. sells second-hand clothes and sweets in the Likoni neighborhood of Mombasa, Kenya. She began this business six months ago. She used to sell small items like biscuits, doughnuts, balboa seeds (which are seeds from the Balboa tree, colored and sugared to sell in small packs). Second-hand clothes provide a higher profit for Rachel and she prefers to sell non-perishable items. 

Rachel purchases her stock from Kongowea Market in Mombasa from wholesalers on a fortnightly (14 days) basis. She says that kids clothes sell the fastest and that she is able to make a 2,000-3,000 KES profit in a month. 

Rachel is applying for a loan of 200 USD in order to buy more clothing and to build a stand (a kibanda) to sell the clothes from. 

Rachel relies on this business to supplement her income as a primary school teacher. She has been teaching for 29 years and is two years from her retirement. After her retirement from teaching, she will concentrate on her clothing sales in order to continue to support 2 of her 4 children who are still dependents. Rachel says “the future will open itself for me as I retire.”

loans.use: To acquire more stock of used cloths and build a "kibanda" (small stand)

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Toch S., 45, lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has owned a plot of land since 1999. She grows both rice and vegetable crops. She can plant her crops twice a year; the dry seaS. and the raining seaS.. Her husband Beung Lem, 46, who is a local fisherman. The couple is responsible for four children. All of them are single and in school. Rice is S.'s main source of income to sustain her family's living expenses. The mature rice seaS. is coming. S. needs to harvest her rice, so that she has requested a loan of $400 as capital to hire a harvester, to harvest her rice crop.

loans.use: to hire a harvester to harvest her rice crop

loans.name: Patience Wavua

texts.en:
Patience Wavua M. owns a cosmetics shop in the Likoni district of Mombasa, Kenya. She started this business in 2008 because she has always admired the profitability of this type of store. 

Patience has one employee at the store, because she also works in an office supply store that provides technical assistance for computer, photocopiers, etc.  

Patience has applied for a loan of approximately 150 USD in order to buy additional cosmetics for resale.

Patience is 28 and married with one child, a two year old girl named Joy. She hopes to expand her cosmetics shop so that she can leave her other job and manage the shop full time, becoming a “boss of her own.”

loans.use: Purchase additional cosmetics to stock her shop

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S. is 51 years old, a resident of Kompong Cham Province. She makes a living as a rice cultivator, while her husband, Chin Thol, 53, works with her. He also catches fishes for his wife to sell at the local market and he depends on fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake. He began his businesses a long time ago, and currently earns average of $2.50 per day.

The couple has five children. Two of them are single and three are married. Two of their children are employed: one is working as a security guard and another one is a mushroom grower. To make the family's transportation easier, S. needs a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Ali Gitonga

texts.en:
Ali Gitonga N. is a volunteer member of the Runyenjes Group in Runyenjes, Kenya. The group has received training from K-MET on home-based patient care services and is also part of the K-MET microfinance program.

Ali sells music and electronics in Embu, Kenya. He has both a kibanda (stall) and a shop, which he decided to rent because it provides more security. Ali and his 3 employees sell light bulbs, sockets, and electronics as well as a selection of music CDs.

He was first an employee at the kibanda, but bought the stall in 2006. In 2008, Ali bought the shop. He says that business is good, but he needs capital to boost it.

Ali has applied for a loan of approximately 675 USD in order to buy more stock of electronics and music. This is his second loan. Ali says that he noticed an improvement in business when he was able to add more variety to his stock using his first loan, so he would like to improve upon that by adding even more variety. Competition is high in the music business, so Ali wants to be able to offer different selections.

In the future, Ali would like to own a large electronics story, perhaps venturing into a wholesale business.

loans.use: Purchase of more goods

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mr. Chhun N., 35, makes a living as a rice farmer and also is a local palm climber. By palm climbing, he can tap palm juice from palm trees, boiling it to make palm sugar or turn it into palm wine for sale. He is currently earning an average of US$ 1.50 a day to help feed his family. He is married to Our Own, 33, who works with him in the farm work. Together they live with four children, all of whom are single and attend school.

N. is applying a loan to buy a cart to transport his rice crops and some material to use for climbing palm trees. The family lives in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a cart and some material to use for climbing palm trees

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecilia W. is a volunteer member of the Runyenjes Group in Runyenjes, Kenya. The group has received training from K-MET on home-based patient care services and is also part of the K-MET microfinance program.

She owns a retail shop in Gitare town near Runyenjes, Kenya. Her shop is in her own shamba (farm) and was built in 1985. She sells oils, food stuffs, flour, cabbages and bananas to the foot traffic that comes by her place on the way to town. Business used to be good, but because of the current drought and food shortage in Kenya, it has gone down. People do not have money to buy the products and have to buy on credit.

Cecilia has applied for a loan of approximately 275USD in order to add more stock and keep her business afloat until she receives payment from the customers who have bought items on credit.

Cecilia is married to a retired provincial administrator. Together they have 4 children, all of whom have finished school, though some are still dependents, since they attend college.

Cecilia wants to see her business grow and says that she is sure this loan from K-MET will help her to succeed.

loans.use: Acquire more stock for her business

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 35 years old. She sells women's underwear and robes at the central food market. Since there is no competition for her at this market, her business is doing really well.

Svetlana has been in this business for 7 years. She used to work for the military base, which got downsized and Svetlana became unemployed. Her friend said she could start her own business. Svetlana decided to try and was successful. She used to have 2 business locations, but one of the locations was not profitable so she closed it.

Svetlana would like to get a loan of 9,000 UAH to purchase 100 sets of women's underwear and 80 robes. She hopes that increasing assortment would help her to increase her sales. She got married recently and would like to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase 100 sets of women's underwear and 80 robes

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda Larano, a 43-year-old mother of two children, grows rice on her farm. Her parents taught her everything about how to plant rice, prepare the soil, and plow the field. She even knows when to apply the fertilizers and pesticides to insure a good harvest on her farm. She lives in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur, a town of 35,757 people. Farming is her life. She has been a farmer for twelve years because she believes that she will have a bright future in this kind of endeavor. 

She is asking a loan of Php 12,000 to purchase 6 sacks of fertilizer like urea and ammonium. She thinks that, by doing so, she could triple her yield and earn bigger income. In this way, she could have more to give to her family and her children. She dreams of sending all her children to college so that life will be easier for them when they grow up. 

CEVI continually helps Erlinda succeed in her business. Through CEVI's credit assistance, training, and insurance services, Erlinda can make her business grow.

loans.use: To purchase 6 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Samson Gitam

texts.en:
Samson Gitam M. is a volunteer member of the Runyenjes Group in Runyenjes, Kenya. The group has received training from K-MET on home-based patient care services and is also part of the K-MET microfinance program.

Samson has been a member of the group since 2007 and is a church minister in Runyenjes, Kenya. He also owns a small taxi business in town. Samson has had the taxi business since 2002 and now has one employee. The competition is stiff, so he tries to have the best car in the area so as to get more business. With his first loan from K-MET, Samson painted his taxi and bought some spare parts.

He has applied for a second loan of 400 USD in order to repair the car as it is currently in bad shape and not running well.

Samson is married with 5 children, 2 boys and 3 girls. Four of the children are currently enrolled in school, while the 5th, at 3 ½ years old, is still waiting to begin.

loans.use: Repair of Taxi used for transportation

loans.name: Oem

texts.en:
Oem Y., 58, lives Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She owns a plot of land to grow crops, rice and vegetables, a skill she has learned from her grandmother. She plants twice a year. Her husband is living at home and currently works with her. She is a mother of three children; three of them are single. To help a little with the family's expenses, one of her single sons is employed as a car repairer in Phnom Penh City.

Y. works hard at her business activities every day and never wastes time. To earn additional income, she needs a loan as capital to purchase cashews and re-sell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase cashews

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. N. is 44 years old and sells Cambodian food as a mobile business. She sells to her customers in her area and the business has gone well. She earns around $5 per day. She is married to Mr. Sambo and has six children, all of whom are single. To improve her business, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use as transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle to use as transportation

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. Chum N. is a farmer in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she usually pays much money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. Thus, she decided to request for a loan to buy a cow to add to the old one in order to plow the filed. Her husband, Mr. Sim Thuoy, is a chicken breeder. Mrs. Chum N. is 48 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to the old one in order to plow the filed.

loans.name: Gbènan Bernadette

texts.fr: Agée de 47 ans dame A. Gbènan bernadette, originaire de SO-Ava du département de l'atlantique au sud du Benin. Elle est mariée à MEHOU Mathias ouvrier à l'hotel 15 Janvier. Elle s'est spécialisée depuis près de 9 ans dans la distribution de plastiques en Gros et de la revente de quelques articles divers qu'elle distribut. Pour couvrir la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, elle sollicite un crédit.
texts.en:
Ms. Gbènan Bernadette A., age 47, is from SO-Ava in Atlantique County, in southern Benin. She is married to Mr. Mathias MEHOU, a worker at the Hotel 15 Janvier. For almost nine years, she has been specializing in the wholesale distribution of plastic ware and the retail sale of various items she distributes. To meet the burgeoning demands of her customers, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic goods in Nigeria

loans.name: Munavvarkhon

texts.ru:
Алимова Мунаввархон
Войдя в Центральный рынок города спросите любого кто Мунаввархон. Все ее знают. Уже десять лет занимается продажей зелени : начиная  от укропа, петрушки, чеснока, редиски, щавеля …Кроме того у нее в ассортименте имеется консервированные овощи  фрукты.
 Раньше жила и работала в Канибадаме. После смерти мужа переехала жить в Исфару .Дочерей выдала замуж. Сейчас  живет со своим внуком. Ему 18 лет.
 Покупает свои зелени  в Ходженде (в свои 53 лет она ездить за товаром сама) два раза в неделю. А также друзья поставлять с Коканда (Узбекистан) по более выгодным ценам.
Весною выращивает в своем саду укропы , петрушки , салатные листа.
Признается что конкуренция очень тяжелая  и цены стали повышаться. Она делает все что сделать свой бизнес еще лучше.И  она предлагает скидку на большие заказы  чтоб удержать клиентов .
Уже два года она кредитует свой бизнес и признается что только благодаря Микроинвест она смогла расширить ассортимент товаров. Взяв последней свой займ она купила большую партию банок и овощей чтоб сделать запас на зиму  так как  цены на них  летом ниже.
Она собираеться открыт еще одну торговую точку на следущий свой займ.
texts.en:
Upon arrival in the city's central market, ask anyone about Munavvarhon A.. Everyone knows her. She has sold leafy green vegetables for the past ten years, starting out with dill, parsley, garlic, radishes and sorrel. Her inventory additionally includes canned fruit and vegetables. Munavvarhon previously lived and worked in Kanibadam, but after the death of her husband she moved to Isfara. Her daughters married and she now lives with her 18-year-old grandson. Although she is 53 years old, Munavvarhon herself travels to Khojand twice a week to buy greens. Her friends also supply her with vegetables from Kokand, Uzbekistan at a good price. In the spring Munavvarhon grows dill, parsley and salad greens in her own garden. She recognizes that competition is fierce and prices have begun to rise. She does all she can to improve her business, and offers discounts on bulk orders in order to keep customers. For the past two years Munavvarhon has taken out business loans and she acknowledges that it is thanks to MicroInvest that she was able to expand her range of products. Taking advantage of the low summertime prices, with the last loan she purchased a large quantity of canned goods and vegetables in order to stock up for the winter. She is planning to open an additional retail outlet with her next loan.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Opening of a new retail outlet

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tanyana is married with one child. She owns a business located at the city market and sells blankets and bed sheets. She has been in this business for 2 years. Her business is still in the development stage.

Tatyana is very entrepreneurial and hard-working. She saw the demand in warm blankets was high and decided to start this business. The winters in Ukraine are cold and the heating becomes more and more expensive every year. Tatyana helps people to get warm and save on heating.

Tatyana would like to get a loan of 3,000 UAH to increase her inventory. Her goal is to develop her business more so it can fully support their family.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Mr. Thon C. lives in Hang Heng village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he gets a little rice revenue to support his family. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy rice because her family hass insufficient rice for eating. His wife, Mrs. Teas Sokha, is a coconut middleman. Mr. Thon C. is 43 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. His wife is presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice for eating.

loans.name: Zarnishan

texts.en:
Zarnishan Z. is 48 years old. She is married with three children who are currently in school. For the last 7 years, Zarnishan has sold jewelry in the local market. Gradually, her business has expanded and, currently, Zarnishan has earned 1000 USD from her work.

Zarnishan sells jewelry in the oriental style. The traditional earrings, rings, and bracelets are very beautiful and popular in Azerbaijan. Every woman has at least one set of jewelry, probably inherited from her grandmother. Zarnishan has a lot of customers and her business is rather successful and generates a stable income for the family.

Today, Zarnishan is requesting 1200 USD for a 15-month term. She is going to purchase new items of jewelry to increase the range of goods that she sells. She thanks you for all your support and promises to pay the loan back on time.

loans.use: To purchase new jewelry items for re-sale

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: Kol M., who is 58 years old and her husband, Mom Oun, 77,  reside in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. They own a plot of land close to their village, where they make a living as vegetable cultivators, growing crops like cabbages, morning glories, cucumbers, and Chinese Kale, which they are able to plant twice a year. They have three children, two of them work with their parents, growing vegetables. One their daughters is employed as a garment worker at Phnom Penh City and helps support the family. Mrs. M. is facing difficult with watering vegetable crops, so she humbly requests a loan to purchase a water pump to irrigate her vegetable crops.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump to irrigate her vegetable crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a hair dryer, hair extensions, and beauty products for resale

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir  Z. is 37 years old. He and his wife raise two children who are studying in school. For the last eight years Mahir has been selling jewelry. Mahir sells oriental style jewelry items. The earrings are very beautiful and people trust Mahir as he is very honest when assessing prices and quality. Mahir`s dream is to build his own shop because rent price is very high. 

Mahir wishes to expand his business by increasing his supplies of newer, more modern jewelry items. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1200 USD.

loans.use: To purchase newer, more  modern jewelry items for resale

loans.name: Dany

texts.en:
Mrs. Dany C. is a villager in Krassaing Chy Me village in Kampong Speu province. She and her husband, Mr. Duk Phea Rom, raise pork to sell in the local market. Their business is doing well and they want to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Dany C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more pigs to support her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with her business.

She is 27 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to support her business.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mr. S. is a rice farmer and owns a rice extraction machine. He lives in Phsaleu Village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. He is 29 years old and just married. They have not had any children yet. His wife is 26 years old and raises cattle for sell. The young couple work hard to generate income and save the money for their children's future. They are facing difficulty with  their rice farming business, Mr. S. needs two buffaloes and a cart to use for transportation. He is asking for a loan to achieve this goal. He said the loan will help his family's income by improving the farming business. His wife is shown in the photo because he was not available.

loans.use: To purchase two buffaloes and a cart

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en: Mrs. Hieng N. lives in Krassaing Chy Me village in Kampong Speu province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since she has a lot of consumers with many demands, she wants to expand her store; thus, she decided to request a loan to purchase more grocery products to support her customers’ requests. Her husband, Mr. Pheng Chheang Kang, helps his wife’s business. Mrs. Hieng N. is 53 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in garment factory while the others stay at home to do housework and help out at the store. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to support customer demand

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy S. is a 33 year old rice farmer who also works raising pigs to sell for another source of income. She raises a sow, then sells its babies, and the business has done well. She is married with four children, all of whom are small teenagers and in school. Her rice crop is one source of income for her family's living, and she raises pigs for more income. To increase her income, Soy S. needs a loan to purchase more pigs to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is 30 years old, unmarried, and lives with her parents. She sells women’s clothing at the central market. Her income is about 4,000 UAH per month.

Tatyana has been in this business for 2 years. She is very good at working with people and treats her clients well. They come back often which allows her business to grow. During this short period of time, she was able to build her own kiosk. Tatyana would like to open a second location as there is a high demand for the type of clothing she sells.

Tatyana is requesting a loan to purchase women’s sweaters. She hopes to increase sales and open a second location. Also, her business is the only source of income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase women's sweaters

loans.name: Philomène Yèyinou

texts.fr: Originaire de EKPE et agée de 26 ans, dame D. Philomène est mariée à monsieur  Gilbert SOTIN et mère de deux enfants. Dame D.  Philomène est  maitresse coiffeuse de formation et a construit son atelier proche du grand carrefour  de sa localité. Elle vend des meches à ses clientes et à d'autres personnes desireuses de s'en procurer. Au vue du nombre important des demandes effectuées par sa clientèle,elle sollicite un prêt.
texts.en:
Originally from EKPE, Ms. Philomène D., age 26, is married to Mr. Gilbert SOTIN and has two children. She is a master hairdresser by training and constructed her salon near the major crossroads of her town. She sells hair extensions to her customers and to others wanting to obtain some. Given the sizable number of orders made by her customers, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a 10 dozen hair extensions of all kinds and some hair products

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda I. sells pastry products at the Central market. She buys her goods from wholesalers, in large volumes in Panjshanbe and resells  them with profit in Isfara.  With her last loan,  Mavluda expanded her business. She says that her business has strengthen and she has increased her range of goods.

Her family life has not been a success and she is divorced from her husband. Nowadays, she lives alone in a small apartment. She is asking for a loan of 3000 somony. She wants open a small shop to sell her pastry products. This year she will enter medical college.

loans.use: To open a small pastry shop

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mean S. is 59 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She earns a living as a tailor, providing her service to neighbors, sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. From her business, she can earn an average of US$ 4 per day. She is a widow and the mother of two children. All are daughters and employed.  One daughter is working in Malaysia and the other daughter lives with her and makes her living growing potatoes to sale. S. is applying for a loan to add with her savings to purchase farm machinery. Her daughter will use the machine and also rent it to other farmers. This way she can earn extra income.

loans.use: To purchase farm machinery

loans.name: Mead

texts.en: Mr. N. is a 42 year old rice farmer. He also climbs palm trees to gather and sell palm juice and sugar. He started this business in 1990 and earns around $4 per day. He is married to Mrs. Synoeun and they do not yet have children. His wife raises poultry and cattle as another sources of income for the family. They work hard to earn their income and save much of it for future plans. Mr. N. would like to ask for a loan to purchase two buffaloes to breed for profit.

loans.use: To purchase two buffaloes to breed.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Née dans les années 1961 Affanmè un village lointain dans le département de l'ouémé au sud du Bénin, dame H. Madeleine est mariée à GBEVONON Bernadin de profession mécanicien. Dame Madeleine a cinq enfants et est revendeuse de divers. Confrontée aujourd'hui à des difficultés financières,dame Madeleine pour renforcer son activité et faire face à la concurrence de son entourage, elle sollicite son deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in the 1960's in Affanmè, a distant village in Ouémé County in southern Benin, Ms. Madeleine H. is married to Mr. Bernadin GBEVONON, a mechanic by profession. She has five children and is a retailer of various items. Confronted today with financial difficulties, she is requesting her second loan to bolster her business and to cope with the competition from those around her.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 drums of oil, 4 dozen shoes, and more

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua N. is 35 years old, a wife and a mother with five children, who are in school. She has been a food vendor for a year now. She prepares and sells kenkey (a local dish prepared from milled maize and eaten with all kinds of sauces and soups). It is a delicacy many Ghanaians enjoy daily either as breakfast, lunch, or dinner. She sells at the main business center of Agogo. Her business is doing well, and she wants to expand her operation to serve more customers.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more maize grains, vegetables, rice and assorted meat for her operation. She hopes this loan will help her increase her earnings and improve her family's well-being. She would be very grateful for this assistance. Her photo was taking when we visited her. With the loan she wants to add the sale of soft drinks to her operation so that her profit margin can be increased.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, rice, vegetables, assorted meat, etc

loans.name: Kouy

texts.en: Mrs. Kouy M. lives in Prey Ta Loem village in Kampong Speu village in Kampong Speu province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Bou Sophea, is an assistant village chief who earns a small salary to support the family. Even though they try to work hard, they still do not have much money to provide a better life for their family. Thus, Mrs. Kouy M. is requesting a loan to buy rice. She is 28 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice so her family has sufficient rice to eat

loans.name: Lay
