texts.en: Mrs. Noun is a farmer who grows rice in Veal Village, Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has been working with her husband for long time. She has three children, all of whom are teenagers. She works to generate income to support her family. Every year, She rents oxen from her neighbors to plow her farmland. Now she would like to buy her own oxen to use in her farming business. Hence, Noun would like to ask for a loan to purchase two young oxen. She said the loan will help improve her family's standard of living by reducing the cost of renting oxen.

loans.use: to purchase two young oxen

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en: Mrs. Soeng T. is a villager in Prey Ta Loem village in Kampong Speu province. She is a Pro Hok seller in the market. In this business, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy the small fish needed to make Pro Hok. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan. Her husband, Mr. Suon Sok, is a farmer who owns a piece of land used to cultivate rice. Mrs. Soeng T. is 58 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a driver while the other helps out on the father's plantation. Her husband is pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy small fish to make Pro Hok

loans.name: Holomè

texts.fr: Agée de Cinquante ans, dame H. Holomè mariée et mère de six enfants est originaire de d'adjarra dans le département de l'ouémé au sud du Bénin.Dépuis sept ans, elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de condiments, d'huile d'arachide et d'huile rouge. Pleine d'ambition de développer d'avantage l'activité, dame Holomè avait décidé de faire chaque fois une demande de financement et est aujourd'hui à son troisième crédit.
texts.en:
At 50 years of age, Mrs.Holome Houkonnou is married and the mother of six children. She originated from Adjarra in the district of Oueme in the south of Benin. For the last 7 years she has specialized in the sale of food condiments, peanut oil, and red oil. Holone is full of ambition to develop her business and has taken out several business loans. She is now requesting her third loan.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a basket of tomatoes, a crate of peanut oil and a crate of red oil.

loans.name: Naheed Farzana M.shafee Group

texts.en:
Naheed Farzana Baji is a 42-year-old married lady and resides in a city named Multan, Pakistan. Her husband's name is M. Shafee and he works in a factory for a monthly wage. She is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Her son works in a photocopier shop where he makes photocopies of documents. Naheed Baji is involved in a business making hair bands. It’s a high trend in women because they love to tie their hair in bands. Her daughter helps her in making the bands. Nabandsheed Baji has also embroidered dresses for the past 15 years. She plans to marry off her daughter when she gets the necessary amount. She is applying for a loan to buy cloth and colored thread to expand her embroidery and band-making business.

She is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Farman Baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to resell. Mumtaz Baji wants a loan to buy warm clothes (sweaters and jackets) to resell. Farzana Baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her boutique.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng S. is 41 years old and lives in the Kompong Tom Province. She makes a living raising pigs in a stall behind her house and sells them to a slaughter house six months after she begins raising them. Her husband, Yem Chon, 41, is a rice grower, as well as growing green bean on his plot of land. He is widely known. This is a skill he learned from his grandparents and he grows his crops at least twice per year. They have one child, who is a teenager and attends school.

Heng S. has applied a loan of $1200 to purchase a cow to raise for offspring and a rice mill to use for hulling rice and some green-bean seeds to regrow.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to raise and a rice mill to use for hulling rince

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en: Mrs. C. is 30 years old and works growing rice in Prolay Thom Village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. Her husband, 43, works with Mrs. C., earning revenues around KHR14000 ($3.2). She has two children, two of whom are married and two other are teenagers attending school. To improve her business by alleviating physical labor, C. would like to ask for a loan to purchase two buffaloes to add more labor for farming business.

loans.use: To purchase two buffaloes to add more labor for farming business

loans.name: Nasreen Sallah-Ud-Din Group

texts.en:
"My name is Nasreen and I’m a 43-year-old married lady. I belong to a city which is famous for its hand-made items and shrines. I married a man whose name is S. and he is a driver by profession and has driven an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for the past 5 years. I have five kids: two sons and three daughters. My elder son has a catering service for events. My youngest son is a carpenter and makes furniture. My daughters are getting an education by the grace of God. I have a boutique in which I display my clothes collection. I have a good number of customers. I have got a good reputation because I sell clothes on time with a good workmanship. I am applying for a loan to buy material (colored thread, cloth) to complete the orders of my customers.

I’m a group leader of some more women of my locality. Zahida Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her boutique. Bilquis Baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Nasreen Bano Baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes."

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for completing order

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa M. is 47 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven kids. She sells porridge and lingerie in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread. With a large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar and milk to increase production. She also wants to upgrade her lingerie sales.

She hopes to make a good income to support her kids in school. Hawa says she would be grateful for your assistance so that she can save enough to take care of her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk and lingerie

loans.name: Edwige

texts.fr: Née le 07 novembre 1976 à cotonou dans le département du littoral au sud du Bénin, Dame H. Edwige  est divorcée et mère d'un garçon. Actuellement chez ses parents, elle est revendeuse de divers, de tissus et prepare en plus de tout cela de la nourriture qu'elle vent devant sa maison. Desireuse de renforcer d'avantage son activité et de couvrir la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite son troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Born on November 7, 1976 in Cotonou, in Littoral County in southern Bénin, Ms. Edwige H. is divorced and the mother of a boy. Currently at her parents’ place, she sells various items and fabrics. And in addition to all that, she makes food, which she sells in front of her house. Wanting to do more to bolster her business and to meet the demands of her customers, she is requesting her third loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, sacks of omo (soap), and two boxes of spaghetti

loans.name: Jana Group

texts.en:
The group name is Jana; it is a group made of three ladies, who lives in Aley Mount Lebanon. 

-	Mernah: Mernah is a 25 year old married woman. She has been working in a clothing shop for two years. Mernah requested a loan of 200 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for the shop. This is the first time that Mernah has requested a loan.
Mernah is speciA. in her work because she is dynamic. Her clients are her neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she had difficulties finding the right place to open her shop. She decided on doing her business because of the need. In the future, she plans on expanding her business. 
-	Salwa: Salwa is a 32 year old married woman. She has been working in a flower shop for five years. She also sells paintings. Slawa requested a loan of 200 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase flowers for her shop. This is the first time that Salwa has requested a loan.  
Salwa is speciA. in her work because she does very nice bunch of flowers and beautiful paintings. Her clients are shops and others. In the future, she plans on expanding her business. 
-	Ramya: Ramya is a 28 year old married woman. She has been working in a clothing shop for a year and a half. Ramya requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for the shop. This is the first time that Ramya has requested a loan.
Her clients are her friends and neighbors. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Fatime Begum Ramzan Ali Group

texts.en:
Fatime begum is a 33-year-old married lady and has resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan, for the last 11 years. Her husband's name is R. A. and he sells crockery in Multan shops. He has been doing this business for the last 9 years.

Fatima baji is the mother of four kids: two daughters and two sons. All of her children are getting education from a school which is located near to the house. Fatima baji is a very devoted lady. She reduced the financial burden on her husband by making embroidered dresses. Her husband is very happy with her and feels proud. She used her income to pay off the school fees of her children.

She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy crockery to expand her husband’s business.

She is the group leader of some more women in her locality. Maqsoodan baji wants a loan to buy material (thread, elastic, cloth) for her band-making business. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food selling business. Khatoon baji and Sakina baji each want a loan to buy thread to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy crockery to resell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is 42 years old, married and a mother with six children; one is at senior high school, while the rest are in primary and junior high school. She has been selling cocoa drink and sachet mineral water for the past three years now. Cocoa drink is prepared with powdered cocoa; water is added to it with sugar and then it is left in a fridge for a while. It is served while chilled and is taken with bread. This is mostly purchased by school children because it's a tasty drink.

Felicia A. wants the loan to make headway so that she can buy more cocoa powder, sugar, loaves of bread and rubber bags. With the loan, she believes she can produce in larger quantity. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: She wants the loan to buy more cocoa powder, and sachet mineral water.

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en: Mrs. R. is a widowed rice farmer who lives in Krakor Village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has four children, two of whom are married and two are single. One single daughter is employed as a garment worker who can earn around $4 per day and help to support the family's living. One son works growing rice with R.. Because rice farming is the main source of income for the family, R. needs a loan to buy two oxen to use as physical labor for her farming business, and one cart to use for transportation.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to use as physical labor for her farming business, and one cart to use for transportation.

loans.name: Zubaida Khanum Abdul Latif Group

texts.en:
"My name is Zubaida Khanum and I am a 57-year-old married lady. I have been a citizen of a city named Multan, Pakistan, for the last 25 years. I am married to a man whose name is A. L. and he is a factory worker. I have five kids: three sons and two daughters. My eldest son drives a donkey cart for loading different items (furniture, construction supplies). Another works in a vegetable market and packs the vegetables in sacks. The others are getting education from a school which is located near to the house. I make plastic shopping bags on orders. I complete the orders in two days to earn income. I use my income to pay off the school fees of my children. I am applying for a loan to buy plastic beans for making plastic bags."

She is the group leader of some more women in her locality. Bismillah baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Qubra baji and Parveen baji each want a loan to buy thread to resell. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy marble stone to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy plastic beans for making plastic shopping bags

loans.name: Nada Group

texts.en:
This group's name is Nada; it is a group made up of three ladies, who live in Aley Mount Lebanon.

-Sawsan is a 29-year-old woman. Sawsan has been working as a private teacher for two years. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase books and some school furniture. This is the first time that Sawsan has requested a loan.

Sawsan is speciA. in her work because she is patient with students and knows how to make them study. Her clients are her neighbor’s children. She decided on doing her business because she always wanted to be a teacher. In the future, she plans on continuing her studies.

-Nada is a 24-year-old woman. She has been working in a clothing shop for two years. Nada requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop and to do some maintenance work on her car. This is the first time that Nada has requested a loan.

Nada is speciA. in her work because she has good relations with her clients. She decided on this business because she wanted to improve her financiA. situation. In the future, she plans on purchasing a shop.

-Hekmeh is a 53-year-old woman. She has been working at handicrafts for twenty years. Hekmeh requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her work. This is the first time that Hekmeh has requested a loan.

Hekmeh is speciA. in her work because she has a lot of experience. Her clients are her neighbors and others. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

About Group Loans

In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individuA. share but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports the others and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with one child. She rents a kiosk and sells women's clothing at the central city market. She has been in this business for 3 years. Natalya's salary at her previous job was way low and she decided to start her own business. Now she can make additional income for her family. Her daughter got enrolled in the university and Natalya helps her to cover tuition and living expenses.

Natalya would like to receive 7,500 UAH to increase the assortment of her goods. Natalya's business goal is to purchase her own kiosk so she will not need to pay rent and can use her income to pay her daughter's university studies.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of her inventory

loans.name: Shahnaz Mai Munir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz Mai baji is a 30-year-old married lady and has resided in a city called Multan, Pakistan for the past 20 years. She is the mother of four kids: three daughters and one son. All of her children are getting an education. Shahnaz baji’s husband's name is M. A. and he runs a grocery shop near their house. He has been doing this work for the past 14 years. Shahnaz baji is also involved in a clothes-selling business. She buys clothes from a city called Peshawar and sells them in the Multan markets. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her clothes-selling business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Razia baji wants a loan to buy cloth to re-sell. Azran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to re-sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Dame H. Christine est née en 1973 à porto-novo.Elle est mariée à GONOUVE Marcellin. Elle est mère de deux enfants. Les deux enfants sont à sa charge ainsi que deux domestiques. Elle a construit une boutique devant le domicile de son mari et y vend des condiments, des legumes , du riz, des macaronies et des tomates en boite, qu'elle achete au marché DANTOKPA, le plus grand marche du BENIN. Elle a sollicité un pret à l'approche des fetes pour pouvoir satisfaire toute sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. Christine H. was born in 1973 in Porto-Novo. She is married to Mr. Marcellin GONOUVE and is the mother of two children. The children are in her care, as are two domestics. She has built a shop in front of her husband’s home, and there she sells condiments, vegetables, rice, macaroni, and canned tomatoes that she buys at the DANTOKPA marketplace, the largest in Benin. She requested a loan as the holidays approached to be able to satisfy all her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a basket of tomates, 5 sacks of Gino rice, and boxes of macaroni of any brand

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: Mrs. S. sells vegetables, transporting them to customers' homes. She has a bicycle to use as transportation for her business. She has been running the business since 1999 and it has gone well; she earns around US$ 4 per day. She is married to Mr. Koeun and has five children, all of whom are teenagers and attend school. To improve her husband's business, S. would like to request a loan for her husband to purchase an ox to use to do hard physical labor.

loans.use: purchase an ox to use for hard physical labor

loans.name: Koy

texts.en:
Koy S., 32, lives in Kompong Tom Province. She has been working as a rice cultivator since 2000. As another source of income, she sews clothes for her villagers. She is married to Chin Hort, age 39. He works with his wife at rice growing. He also catches fish to sell, using his own nets and traps to fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake. They have one child, who is still young and attends school.

With the rice farming business, S. can grow rice twice a year, in the rainy season and the dry season. Rice farming is S.'s main way to earn income to cover her family's living expenses. S. needs a loan to purchase fertilizer, gasoline, and a pump to use for rice farming. She and her mother are pictured on their farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, gasoline, and a pump

loans.name: Louis

texts.en:
Louis N. is a 39-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of six kids. Through hard work, Louis has supported two of the kids in senior high school; one is also learning how to sew, and three are in junior high school. She is a food vendor who sells "kenkey" in her neighborhood. "Kenkey" is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy "kenkey" as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Louis wants to use the loan to buy more ingredients such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to allow her first child to enter university. She was so happy when we spoke to her during a visit.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel O. is twenty-nine years old. He is married and has no child at the moment. His wife is a hairdresser by profession. Sammy and his wife reside in Somanya in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Somanya is the native town of a tribe in Ghana called the ‘Krobos’. Though people of other tribes have migrated there as a result of their occupations, the Krobos are the dominant people in this land.

Samuel is a commercial driver. He owns a mini-bus which he uses as commercial transport. He conveys passengers and goods from his community to Accra and its environs. He has been driving for twelve good years and is full of rich experiences. Sammy says he wants a loan to repair his car so as to keep it in good working condition. It is his dream to put aside savings enough to buy a new and bigger bus.

loans.use: To repair his commercial vehicle

loans.name: Mohammad Hasham Group

texts.en:
Mirechand M. H. is the group leader of the M. H. group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for her business.

Salaha and Zynab want to take a loan for their tailoring businesses. They want to buy a new sewing machine for their businesses. Mirechand wants to take out a loan for her husband’s oil-selling business. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. Also Sakellah wants to take a loan for her son’s business selling vegetables. He wants to complete his stock.

They want to thank those who make this process of loans in Afghanistan possible, especially Kiva and AFSG who help poor people.

loans.use: to expand and improve their businesses

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Mrs. O. is 46 years old and sells chicken in the market. She is widowed with with three children, one of whom is married. One daughter sometimes helps her to sell chicken. Her business has gone well and can earn around $7.50 per day. She has regular customers, including restaurants and hotels. To meet this increasing demand, she needs a loan to purchase chickens and ducks to slaughter and sell. The loan will provide her with enough capital to use for her business.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and ducks to slaughter and sell

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.en:
Daniel Kodjo is thirty-five years old. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. His children are currently in the junior high school. His wife is a hairdresser. 

He lives with his family in Somanya in the eastern region of Ghana. The town is dominated by the Krobos, one of the many tribes in Ghana. However, there are quite a number of aliens living there as a result of work placement. 

Kodjo straightens and welds cars that were damaged in accidents. He has a workshop in the community in which he lives. He has been in this business for fifteen years. 

Kodjo wants a loan to acquire some material for his business, such as filler, steel plates, and electrodes. He wants to buy these materials in bulk, so he can also sell them to colleagues and workers in his community who use them for their work.

loans.use: To buy steel plates, electrode, filler, etc.

loans.name: Gulshan Fatima M. Ejaz Group

texts.en:
Gulshan Fatima baji is a 41-year-old married woman who has lived in Multan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. 

Multan is famous for its shrines. Every year, many people come to visit the shrines believing that their wishes will be fulfilled. Gulshan baji feels lucky to be a part of this city. 

Her husband, M. E., has a business making biscuits. He has been in this business for 10 years. Gulshan baji helps her husband to make biscuits. They both work really hard, but their burden is lightened when they hear compliments from the people who eat their biscuits. Gulshan baji is applying for a loan to buy the ingredients that they use to make the biscuits. 

Gulshan Fatima baji is the leader of a group of women in her locality. Razia baji and Shanaz baji each want a loan to buy bangles for their bangle business. Shabana baji wants a loan to buy clothes, colored thread and sketches to complete the dresses and displays in her boutique. Nasreen Begum baji and Haleema baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: 'Baji,' which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making biscuits

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana A. is 38 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children who are all in school. She has been a food vendor for twelve years in the community school in Nkawkaw where she lives with her family. 

Christiana sells "ampesi" (plantains, yams, and cassava) and rice with stew. This food is mostly purchased by school children during their break time. Ampesi is cooked and enjoyed with any kind of stew. The demand for her food now extends to adults in the community. 

Christiana wants a loan to buy more raw materials like rice, meat, charcoal. She is convinced that the loan will help her to increase her stock and safeguard her business in the events of a price hike. She will be better prepared to provide food for her customers. Christiana believes this will help her to save more for her children's educations. She says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy food, such as yams, plantains, rice, meat, fish, spices charcoal flour, and margarine

loans.name: Donohol

texts.ru: Кувандикова Донохол проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 39 лет , незамужем и имеет одного ребенка. Занимается торговлей на центральном рынке. Занимается торговлей уже 2 года , стого момента , когда она осталась одна с ребенком на руках. Для того , чтобы прокормить сына она вплотную занялась бизнесом. Для этого она решила получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Получив , дополнительное финансирование она сможета завезти новый товар и таким образом привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Donohol Q. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 39 years old, not married and has one child. She is in a retail business on the central market. She has been in this business for two years since when she became a single mother alone with her child. She decided to take up business to be able to feed her son. She has decided to get a loan for a 12 months term. With additional financing Donohol will bring new merchandise and attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah T. is thirty-five years old. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl, who are currently in the junior high school. His wife is a trader. She sells smoked fish and bread in the local market. 

He lives with his family in Somanya in the eastern region of Ghana. The town is dominated by the Krobos, one of the many tribes in Ghana. However, there are quite a number of other tribes that have migrated there due to occupation. 

Noah spray-paints damaged cars that have been welded and straightened. He has a workshop in the community in which he lives. Noah wants a loan to acquire the paint he uses to spray. According to him, there are many types of the paint with varying degrees of quality. He has been in business for fifteen years. Noah says he wants to procure the paint and other materials he works with in bulk, so he can sell some of it to colleagues and workers in his community who also use these materials in their work.

loans.use: To buy car paint

loans.name: Nor Mohammad Qaleen Baf Group

texts.en:
Nor Mohammad is the group leader of Nor Mohammad Qaleen baf group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to make a group loan for their businesses.

Bazally and Raza jan want to take a loan out for their business of tailoring. They want to buy a new machine for their business. Arozo wants a loan for her business of carpet weaving. She wants to buy supplies of basic materials for her business. Khier Begom would like the loan for her "in house bakery"  as she wants to increase her stock. Together, they are requesting a loan of 40000 Afghani for the term of 8 months.

With this loan they can increase the size of their businesses and support their families,  making a better future for themselves and there families.

loans.use: to buy supplies of basic materials for her business

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S. is 26 years old, and is a good housewife, cooking delicious meals for her family and taking good care of her children. She is married with three children; all of them are single and still live in the family home. Her husband, Choun Sokha, is 31, and makes a living selling ice directly to his clients' homes. He normally gets up in the early morning to buy ice from a factory and then sell it retail. To make transportation of the ice easier, Mrs. S. would like to ask for a $1000 loan for her husband to purchase a trailer-motorcycle to transport the ice for sale. The family lives in Kompong Tom Province.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer-motorcycle to transport ice for sale.

loans.name: Oishaby

texts.ru: Абдуллоева Ойшаби живет в одном из тажелых районов Таджикистана в районе Варзоб в поселке Чормагзакон. Возраст 55 лет , образование среднее. Замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Более 20 лет занимается животноводством. у себя во дворе имеет небольшое хозяйство , где и занимается откормкой животных. Для покупки еще одного бычка решила получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.В ее бизнесе ей помогают дети и муж.
texts.en:
Oishabi A. lives in one of the most poverty-stricken regions of Tajikistan, in the village of Chormagzakon in Varzob region. She is 55 years old, has a high school education, and is married and the mother of five children. For more than 20 years Oyshabi has raised livestock. She has a small farm on her property where she feeds the cattle. In order to purchase another bull, she has decided to take out a 12-month loan. Her husband and children help her with the business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Zubaida Khanum Fayyaz Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Zubaida khanum baji is a 43 year old married lady who has lived in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 10 years. She completed her education till 8th standard. Her husband name is F. A., who has run a food business in the food market for the past 10 years. He sells Punjabi food (Daal chawal). Punjabi people are fond of daal chawal. She is the mother of two sons and three daughters. Her sons work with their father in his food business. Zubaida baji runs a boutique in her house. She makes embroidered dresses and simple stitched dresses. People come and give her orders for the dresses, and her daughters help her with making the dresses. She is applying for a loan to buy materials (cloth, colored thread, and beads) to increase the income of her boutique. 

She is a group leader of some more local women. Irshad baji, Tahira baji, and Naziran baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their boutiques. Safia baji wants a loan to buy bangles for her bangle selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for making dresses.

loans.name: Sarwari Ali Gohar Group

texts.en:
Sarwari baji is the wife of A. G., who is a citizen of the city of Multan, Pakistan and works as a security guard on a monthly wage. Her husband has another business of making plastic shopping bags to sell at the markets. Sarwari baji is a 30 year old uneducated lady. She couldn’t get an education because her family couldn't cover her educational expenses. She knows the value of knowledge, because she believes that education nourishes a person from bottom to top. She is the mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. Her daughters are in kindergarten, but she wants to send her sons to school as well. For this reason, she makes embroidered dresses to order and earns an income. She successfully enrolled her elder son in a school with the income she made. Now she is applying for a loan to buy plastic beans for making shopping bags to increase her husband’s business. 

She is a group leader of some more local women. Qureshan baji and Razia baji want loans to buy biscuits and chips wholesale to sell to shops. Hajran baji wants a loan to buy wood for making furniture that people use for sleeping. Anwari baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy plastic beans to make plastic shopping bags

loans.name: Alexeeva

texts.en: Alexeeva N. wants to be a retailer, and rented a market stall to start her trading business. She’s experienced in this business now, as she has worked in it for more than 2 years. The business is located in the central open-air market of Orhei town. She launched her business on the 19th of April 2006. This loan is Ms Alexeeva’s first loan with MicroInvest. The purpose of the loan is to invest in her working capital. She used her own resources to purchase a booth, where she will store and sell merchandise. In the future, Ms Alexeeva would like to increase the assortment of goods for sale, and increase profits.

loans.use: To invest in the working capital

loans.name: Akramjon

texts.ru: Холмуратов Акрамджон проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 35 лет , женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет среднее образование , по специальности водитель. Но работает на рынке ЧЯептура , где имеет свой собственный магазин и , где торгует одеждой , парфюмерией и другими вещами. Кредит планирует использовать на увеличение товарооборота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Akramjon H. resides in the region of Shahrinau. He is 35 years old, married and has four children. He has a secondary school education, having trained as a chauffeur, but now works at the Chyaeptura market where he has his own store. He sells clothing, perfume and other items. He plans to use the loan to increase turnover. He will be able to repay the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Lallagha Group

texts.en:
Lallagha is the group leader of the Lallagha group. There are four members in this group. They each want to take a loan for his/her own business.

Abdul Malek and Shima want to take out a loan for their general stores; they want to make their shops larger. Also, Raza Gall wants to take out a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to buy a new sewing machine for her shop and complete her stock. Leena wants to take a loan for her brother’s business; he has a general store. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop.

With this loan they can expand their businesses and support their families and make a better future for their families. They are really happy with this small loans process in this poor country.

loans.use: buy necessary materials for their shops

loans.name: Tahira Kanwal M.gulnar Group

texts.en:
Tahira Kanwal baji is a 30-year-old married lady and has resided in a city called Multan, Pakistan for the past 2 years. Her husband's name is M. G. and he is an egg-seller. He sells egg in shops and earns a profit. Tahira baji is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Neither of her childre is of school-going age yet.

Tahira baji is a very hard-working lady. She does all the household work and stitches clothes to share the burden of her husband. Her husband regards her highly for her honest and true feelings for him. She is applying for a loan to buy eggs to expand her husband’s egg-selling business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Akbari baji wants a loan to buy tools to repair electric items. Alia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Najma baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics and a hair dryer for her beauty parlor. Manyari baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy eggs to re-sell

loans.name: Razia Liaqat Ali Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a 28-year-old married lady and has lived in a city called Multan, Pakistan for the past 28 years. She is the mother of four kids: three sons and one daughter. None of her children goes to school. Her husband's name is L. A. and he is a fruit seller and has been selling fruit for the past 15 years. He buys fruit from the fruit market and sells it in different communities of Multan. Razia baji helps her husband in arranging the fruit in their cart. She is applying for a loan to expand their fruit-selling business by buying more fruit.

She is the group leader and there is another lady in her loan group. Saira baji wants a loan to buy burgers, eggs, cooking oil, and spices for her burger joint.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy fruit to re-sell

loans.name: Sanovbar

texts.ru: Холмуратова Сановбар проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 44 года. Уже 10 саммостоятельно работает в сфере бизнеса. Открыла свой магазин и торгует одеждой и другими промышленными товарами. Торговая точка находится в центре района. Планирует получить кредит и использовать его для ввоза нового товара. Это обеспечит ей привлечение новых клиентов , а так же дополнительную прибыль. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sanovbar H. resides in the region of Shahrinau. She is 44 years old, and for the past ten years has had her own business. She opened her own store and trades in clothing and other manufactured goods. Her trade outlet is located in the heart of the district. She plans to take out a loan and use it to bring in new products. This will ensure that she will attract new customers, as well as make additional profit. Sanovbar will be able to repay the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Saidmahmadhuja

texts.ru: Темурхуджаев Саидмахмадхуджа житель района Шахринау. Женат и имеет очень большую семью. У него шестеро детей и всех их он обеспечивает сам, так как жена является домохозяйкой . Обеспечивает семью путем занятия бизнесом. Работает  на рынке где торгует продуктами питания. Кроме того он привозит уголь  из отдаленных горных селений и реализует у себя в кишлаке. Уголь используется для отапливания жилых помещений. Кредит планирует использовать для магазина ппродуктов питания , где хочет закупить холодильник , а так же увеличить товарооборот.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saidmahmadhuja T. is a resident of Shahrinav region. He is married and has a very large family. He has six children and provides for them all himself since his spouse is a housewife. He has a business that supports his family. Saidmahmadhuja works at the market, where he sells food products. In addition, he trucks in coal from remote mountain villages and sells it at his shop in town. The coal is used to heat residences. Saidmahmadhuja plans to use the loan for his grocery store. He wants to buy a refrigerator, as well as increase turnover. He will repay the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Ahmad Zaky Group

texts.en:
Ahmad Zaky is the group leader of the Ahmad Zaky group. There are six members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for his/her own business.

Shalla and Shakerya want to take out a loan for their husbands' tailoring businesses; they want to make the businesses larger and they need a small loan for this. Also, Ahmad Zaky and Ahmad Jawad want to take out a loan for their businesses of fruit cart and general store. They want to complete necessary materials for their shop. Anesa wants to take a loan for her son’s business; he sells books, pens, and so on. Also, Deeba wants to take a loan for her husband’s cosmetics business. He needs to buy necessary materials for his shop, and make his business larger.

They want to say that these loans are intended to help their businesses progress and for expanding their businesses so they are useful. They all want to thank Kiva lenders for the Kiva process in Afghanistan which supports poor people.

loans.use: make their businesses larger and better

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha O. is 29 years old and married with 4 children. All her children are schooling and she is very happy about this. She sells foodstuffs such as plantains, cocoyams, etc. She plans to increase her stock so that she can make more profit. She is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget I. is 48 years old and married with 3 children. She sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She hopes to increase her profit margin by stocking her shop with more goods. She is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs, drinks, and provisions to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence I. has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods such as rice, beans, plantains, yams, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She is 45 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty products for resale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy O. has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods like rice, beans, plantains, yams, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She is 37 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband is a farmer. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty products and hair extensions for resale

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou T. est un jeune homme de 32 ans célibataire sans enfants. Il est revendeur de friperies à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Il désire avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des friperies pour la revente. Kokou compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Kokou T. is a young man, 32 years of age, unmarried, and without children. He is a retailer of second-hand clothing Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, he would like to increase the capacity of his commerce by buying used clothing for resale. Kokou is counting on this opportunity to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth J. is 55 years old and she is a widow with 8 children. She sells smoked fish, hawking the fish within her community. She hopes to expand her fish business. She is requesting for the loan amount of 140,000 to purchase more fish to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basins for resale

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen O. is 38 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Queen sells drinks, fried meat, and pepper soup. She hopes to expand her business. She is requesting the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin city, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells hair extensions, provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more hair extensions, provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions, provisions, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria O. is 25 years old and married with a child. She sells second-hand books and she hopes to own a bookshop in future. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more second-hand books to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand books to sell

loans.name: Mihail

texts.en: Mihail T., a carpenter,  is 23 years old, and he lives in Carabetovca village, Basarabeasca district in the south-east of the country. The main goal of this client is manufacturing wooden articles. After graduating from the village school, Mihail (English equivalent: Michael) started to work with his father who’s very experienced in working wood. Both father and son process wood and work on demand, making doors, windows, kitchen furniture, etc. To improve and increase their production capacities, they need a lathe, which they decided to buy with the help of this loan from MicroInvest. Their business was launched in 2008, so this is their first loan.

loans.use: to buy a lathe

loans.name: Andreh

texts.en: Andreh is a 44-year-old married man with two children, living in Touhwitet Al Nahr near Beirut. He owns a taxi and works in Beirut and its suburbs. Andreh has driven a taxi for the last 10 years. Today he wants to borrow $1200 to repair his car.

loans.use: Repair his car

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is a 32-year-old married woman with two children, living in Fourn Al Choubak near Beirut. She has been working as a tailor from home since 1996. Najwa loves her work and has several loyal customers. Today she is requesting $400 to buy a new sewing machine, so she can improve the quality of her work.

loans.use: Buy sewing machine

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 36-year-old married man with three children, living in Jnah in Beirut. He has worked as a plumber since he was 18 years old. He inherited the plumbing business from his father. Ali wants to borrow $1200 to purchase new and improved tools for his plumbing business.

loans.use: Buy new plumbing tools

loans.name: Rania

texts.en: Rania is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, living in Shiah-Beirut. Four years ago, Rania started a new innovative business producing souvenirs and patchwork for new born babies. Her business flourished over the years, and her clientele grew. Today, Rania is asking for $1,000 to allow her to introduce new and fresh ideas to her customers.

loans.use: Introduce new and fresh ideas

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad is a 27-year-old single man living in Shiah, Lebanon. He started working with his father at the age of eight. His father taught him the secrets of the metA. fabrication business. Today, he has decided to further diversify his business by introducing new methods of formulating metals. Imad would like to borrow $1,200 to fulfill his ambitions.

loans.use: Introduce new ways of formulating metals

loans.name: Dani

texts.en: Dani is a 25-year-old single man, living in Haret Hreik-Beirut. Five years ago, he started working with a friend on home electrical projects. As an enthusiastic electrician, today Dani wants to undertake a new freelance project. He is asking for a loan of $1200 to help him undertake the project.

loans.use: Freelance electrical project

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten is a 37-year-old married woman with five children, living in Bourj Barajneh. To help her husband with the household expenses, she started working as a home-based hair dresser 10 years ago. Today, Faten wants to expand her small business by adding new services. Faten is asking for $700 to help her with this endeavor.

loans.use: Buy new hair-dressing equipment

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en: Hamza is a 57-year-old married man with one child, living in Shhim in Mount Lebanon. In 1992, he opened the first metA. lathe in Shhim. During the years, his clientele increased to cover the whole region. Today, Hamza wants to borrow $1,000 to increase his inventory to satisfy his clients' needs.

loans.use: Increase metal-working inventory

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 46-year-old married man with four children, living in Katermaya in Mount Lebanon. When he was 15 he started working in a car paint shop until he opened his own in 1983. Ali has already received several micro-loans from Ameen to improve his shop. Today Ali wants to borrow $1,200 to buy new car paints, so he can diversify the choices he offers his customers.

loans.use: Buy new car paints

loans.name: Rouaida

texts.en: Rouaida is a 33-year-old married woman with four children, living in Katermaya in Mount Lebanon. She used to sell clothes and shoes in her house. In 2006 she opened her first shop. Today, she is requesting $1,200 to buy new clothes and shoes at a good price in hopes that it will increase her sales.

loans.use: Buy more clothes and shoes

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en:
Together with his wife, Pavel intends to develop their business of pig-raising in Orhei town. They keep their animals in the yard of their house and also they store the necessary fodder there. So the purchase of fodder is the purpose of this loan from MICROINVEST.

Pavel does not have any experience in this field; his business is in the start-up phase. This is his first loan ever, not only with MICROINVEST. The future plan of this client is to increase the number of pigs and then sell them on the local market, but also to raise a new breed of pigs.

loans.use: to increase the number of pigs he raises

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
madame est une revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale, céréales et tubercules à lomé mais elle habite le quartier d'adidogomé. Elle s'approvisionne au marché local d'adidogomé.Elle sollicite ce premier crédit d'un montant de 150000F avec lequel elle pourra acheter des ignames, des maïs et des produits d'alimentation générale. 
elle est mariée et son mari est un menusier, ils ont ensemble cinq (05) enfants, avec le revenu tiré de son activité, elle pourra aider son mari et soutenir ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madam is a retailer of grocery items, grain, and tubers in Lomé, but she lives in the Adidogomé district. She gets her supplies at the local marketplace of Adidogomé. She is requesting this initial loan of 150,000 francs CFA, with which she will be able to buy yams, corn, and grocery items. She is married, and her husband is a furniture-maker. Together they have five children. With the income derived from her work, she will be able to help her husband support her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items, grain, and tubers

loans.name: Donald Rogelio

texts.es: Don Donald, tiene 44 años de edad, casado, y reside en Memorial Sandino en la ciudad de Managua,  su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 11,13 y 14 años de edad,  que estudian, ella trabaja en ventas, el Sr. Donald se desempeña de electricista industrial desde hace veinte años, el inicio como ayudante lo cual con el tiempo adquirió conocimiento y ahora  trabaja por cuenta propia, lo cual sus ingresos son mejores. Con la solicitud que esta haciendo en Afodenic es para invertir en infraestructura en la construcción de un muro frontal de su vivienda y la compra del portón principal para estar con un poco de seguridad ante los antisociales, y para poder disfrutar de las mejoras con su familia. Sus planes a corto plazo es captar más clientes y así poder generar mejores utilidades para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Donald C. is a 44-year-old married man who lives in Memorial Sandino in the city of Managua. He and his wife have three children ages 11, 13 and 14 who are still in school. His wife works in retail, while he has been working as an industrial electrician for twenty years. He started out as an apprentice and over time, he was able to acquire skills. He is now self-employed, which means that his income is greater. He will invest the loan that he is requesting from Afodenic in building a protective wall in front of his house and buying the main door so that he can safeguard his family from any delinquents. His short-term goals are to bring in more customers so that the can generate more profits for his family’s well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build protective wall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy generic products for resale

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
El señor Clemente H. H. es casado, tiene 3 hijos, ellos tienen viviendo 4 años en esa casa. 
El señor Clemente H. tiene un negocio de venta de alimentos llamado “Taqueria David” que es atendido por él y le proporciona buenos ingresos con los cuales mantiene a su familia, el negocio ya lo lleva operando 4 años.
Ahora el señor Clemente solicita un préstamo para construir losa de concreto, piso y una cochera en su casa para que de esa manera su hogar esté en buenas condiciones para que él y su familia vivan adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Clemente H. H. is married, has three children, and has lived in his house for four years. He has a business selling food called “David’s Taqueria” that he tends to. It provides a good income with which he can support his family. He has been running the business for four years. Currently, Clemente requests a loan to build a concrete slab, floor, and a garage for his house. In this way, his home will be in good condition so he and his family can live adequately.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a concrete slab, floor, and garage for his house.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.fr: Dame H. Genevieve, agée de 28, est mère de 03 enfants dont deux jumelles. Elle s'est marié à monsieur Jonas TOSSOU. Dame Geneviève est couturière de formation et a ouvert un atelier. Parallélement à sa formation, elle a crée à coté de son atelier la vente de la farine de manioc, du mais, de l'haricot et des biscuits. Elle a trouvé actuellement une opportunuité d'achat de mais à PARAKOU au nord du Benin; et etant à cour de liquidité elle a sollicité un pret.
texts.en:
Ms. Genevieve H., age 28, is a mother with three children, including twins. She is married to Mr. Jonas TOSSOU. A dressmaker by training, she has opened a workshop. During her training, she generated sales of cassava flour, corn, beans, and cookies alongside her workshop. She has for the moment found an opportunity to buy some corn in PARAKOU in northern Benin; and being short of funds, she has requested a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of corn, 1 sack of peanuts, 4 sacks of cassava flour, and more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair extensions and beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Madinath

texts.fr: Dame L. Madinath est née le 10 janvier 1975 à Cotonou et est mariée à monsieur AVOCE Hyacinth, soudeur de profession. Elle a sa charge 05 enfants dont deux de sa soeur defunte. Dame L. Madinath est spécialisée dans la vente ambulante de produit de beauté, des borsses a dents, et de pattes dentrifices de bonnes qualités. Sa clientèle s'etant agrandi, elle a contracté un pret.
texts.en:
Mrs. Madinath L. was born on January 10th, 1975, at Cotonou and is married to Mr. Hyacinth Avoce, a welder by profession. She has 5 children in her care, 2 of which belonged to her deceased sister. Mrs. Madinath L. specializes in traveling sales of top quality beauty products, tooth brushes, and tooth paste. She has requested this loan, because her clientele has increased,

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 cartons of tooth brushes, 15 cartons of tooth paste, and beauty products

loans.name: Elidió

texts.es:
El señor Elidió R. R. vive con su esposa e hijos, ellos tienen 5 años viviendo en esa casa.
El señor Elidió trabaja como mesero prestando sus servicios en diversos eventos como bodas, XV años, etcétera, el tiene 2 años trabajando en ese puesto, su esposa trabaja como chofer de carretera. Entre los ingresos de ellos 2 mantienen a sus hijos.
El señor Elidió R. esta solicitando un préstamo para contratar mano de obra y construir una herrería y piso de concreto en su casa, con el objetivo de tener mas seguridad en su hogar y así de esa manera él y su familia vivan mas cómodamente.
texts.en:
Mr. Elidió R. R. lives with his wife and children, and they have lived for five years in this house. Mr. Elidió works as a waitor, providing service at events such as weddings, quinceneras (15th birthday celebrations for girls), etc. He has had this position for 2 years, and his wife works as a driver. Between their two earnings, they support their children. Mr. Elidió R. is asking for a loan so that he can contract workers to construct some iron bars and a concrete floor for their home, with the goal of having more security en the house, and in this way, his family will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Misty McNally, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make iron bars and a conrete floor in his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and hair extensions to retail.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maria Del Carmen P. R. es casada y ella se dedica a la venta de artículos nuevos negocio en el cual ya lleva 5 años en operación y es atendido por ella, su esposo trabaja en la construcción de calles y pavimentación.
La señora Maria Del Carmen está solicitando un préstamo para comprar más artículos y surtir más su negocio para así poder obtener más ingresos los cuales ayudarán para solventar los gastos que puedan ocurrir en su hogar.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Del Carmen P. R. is married and has been selling all kinds of new items for 5 years. Her husband builds and paves roads for a living.

Ms. Maria Del Carmen is requesting this loan in order to purchase more products and restock her business so that she can obtain more profits, thus helping her cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. has been selling used clothes for the past eighteen years in the market of Apatrapa, Ghana. She relies on the income she makes from her sales to support her household in food and for payment of utility bills. Gladys is a 37-year-old wife and mother of five kids who are schooling. She was born and bred in the community. Her parents are no longer living; they passed away when she was 15 years old.

As she realized the need for expansion, Gladys decided to add eggs sales to the used clothes. She treks to the poultry farms in Kumasi to purchase the eggs. This has helped her to avoid middlemen who sell to her at high prices. Gladys is requesting the loan to enable her to inject more capital into the business to purchase more bales of used clothes and crates of eggs. She hopes she will be able to put aside savings to support her kids' education. Juliana belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame naye’ which means "God did it". She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make her business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used clothes and crates of eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Philomene

texts.fr: Née vers 1949 à Savalou dans le departement du Zou, dame T. Philomene est marié à monsieur ZODANKPO Adrien. Ils ont 06 enfants dont 02 ne sont plus à leur charge, et les quatre autres sont scolarisés. Dame T. Philomène vend de la nourriture au sein du collège privé LA GRACE situé à Avotrou dans le departement de Cotonou et elle vend des mais dans sa maison. L'effectif des élèves etant devenu nombreux cette année, elle a sollicité un pret.
texts.en:
Born around 1949 in Savalou, in Zou County, Ms. Philomene T. is married to Mr. Adrien ZODANKPO. They have six children, of whom two are no longer in their care and four are in school. She sells food inside the private middle-school LA GRACE, located in Avotrou, in Cotonou County, and she sells corn out of her house. Since the student body is large this year, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 sacks of corn, 1 sack of rice, and some condiments, meat, and fish

loans.name: Adrienne

texts.fr: Née vers 1957 à  Porto-Novo dans le département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin, dame Z. Adrienne est mariée et mère de six enfants et dont trois n'est plus à sa charge. Dame Adrienne est revendeuse d'oignon en gros et en détail. Voire actuellement la chèreté de l'oignon, elle est en difficulté financière qui ne lui permet pas de renforcer son activité. Pour ce fait, elle sollicite ce crédit.
texts.en:
Born around 1957 in Porto-Novo, in Ouémé County in southern Bénin, Ms. Adrienne Z. is married and the mother of six children, of whom three are no longer in her care. She is a retailer of onions at the wholesale and retail levels. In fact, with the current high cost of onions, she is in financial difficulty, which prevents her from strengthening her business. Because of this, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three sacks of onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy refreshments for resale.

loans.name: Puissance Group

texts.en:
Mr. M. operates a business, moving from one village to another, exchanging (bartering) school furniture, candles, sausages, and lamp oil for sacks of corn, peanuts, or manioc. His beginning capital in 1991 was US$ 160. The business prospered until 1995 when a truck carrying his goods from the village to Kinshasa over-turned during the rain, destroying the whole truckload.

As he did not have any other financial resources, his options for the future narrowed. After two years (in 1997), he re-launched his business with $100 in capital. Gradually Mr. M. has been able to stabilize his business with the profit he earns. Currently his business capital is about US$ 600. Last August he decided to join one of Hope’s groups called “Puissance,” meaning “Power” in English, and through the loan, Mr. M.’s business has been strengthened.

With his next loan, Mr. M. plans to deliver fresh fish, soaps, sugar, cans, etc. He wants to start farming in order to produce farm products. Mr. M. is 44 years old and the father of four children, aged between 6 and 26. All of them go to school.

loans.use: To reinforce his working capital

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Isaac Group

texts.en:
Céléstine has been selling second-hand clothing since 1984. She started her business with US$ 25, selling one bundle of clothes. Over the years, her business prospered through determination and hard work, and she has been able to build a loyal customer base that has stabilized her business.

With good management and savings, Céléstine has been able to increase her working capital from US$ 25 to US$ 750 today. She started with one bundle of second-hand clothing and is up to ten bundles today. Céléstine sells at Gambela market in the central area of Kinshasa, and her business makes US$ 10 per day per bundle. Céléstine is confident in her business and she is determined to someday be a second-hand clothing importer and provider for market women in DRC in general and Kinshasa in particular.

Céléstine is 41 years old, married, and has six children between the ages 8 and 21. She also takes care of a 5-year-old girl. All of the children in her household go to school. Céléstine likes her business because it has stabilized her financially. She could not imagine receiving a loan from an organization without any collateral, so she was happy to join one of Hope’s groups called “Isaac” in August 2008. Being a member of this group is empowering for her.

loans.use: To reinforce her working capital

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Bwanya Group

texts.en:
Nkola operates five radios in different parts of Kinshasa to help people who do not have cell phones communicate with their relatives and friends in different villages. He started his business in 1983. He is well-known in this field and has developed many relationships. His beginning capital was US$ 250. The business was challenging to him at first because he did not know much about running a radio. He also had to navigate renting a place, obtaining legal documents, and determining his employee’s wages. As a beginner in the field, he had to be very careful.

With determination and good management, he succeeded and was gradually able to increase his working capital from his profit and buy four more radios. His business is prospering and makes a profit of about US$ 500 per month. As Nkola has a vision of opening a big wholesale shop to provide business coming from villages, he decided to join one of Hope’s groups named “Bwanya,” meaning “Worthy” in English, last September. He plans to diversify his business with his loans by adding foods such as fresh fish, sacks of corn and miscellaneous other items. Nkola is 56 years old. He is married and the father of eight children between the ages of 10 and 39. Two of them live at home and are in school.

loans.use: To diversify the business by selling foods such as fresh fish, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Martha Imelda

texts.es:
La señora Martha Imelda G. L. es casada y tiene un negocio de venta de ropa el cual lleva 18 años de operación. Pero debido a una operación que tuvo la señora Martha Imelda, ella quedo convaleciente de la cadera y ya no puede atender el negocio, ahora el negocio es atendido por su esposo, el tuvo que dejar su empleo para poder atender a la señora Martha Imelda en su recuperación.
La señora Martha Imelda está solicitando un préstamo para comprar ropa seleccionada para así surtir su negocio y obtener más ingresos los cuales servirán para solventar los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Ms. Martha Imelda G. L. is married and has her own clothing business, which has been in service for 18 years. However, because of a surgical procedure she underwent, she has a hip disability and can no longer attend to her business. As a result, her husband now runs the business. He had to leave his job in order to help Martha Imelda with her recovery.

Ms. Martha Imelda is requesting this loan in order to purchase select apparel so that she can restock her business and earn more profits, thus helping her cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy motor oil for resale and some work tools

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia P. is 32 years old. She is divorced and has one child. She is divorced because her husband used to beat her.  Her son is 14 years old, and he is now in the first year in the junior high school. 

She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skim powdered milk and biscuits in her neighborhood at Apatrapa, a suburb of Kumasi. She lives in a typical Ghanaian home where there are lots of occupants. Such houses are called compound houses and there is no privacy.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits and more to increase her inventory. She hopes to grow her savings to support her son in school. She believes with her five years of experience she would be able to make good use of the loan.
 
Afia belongs to a village bank called ‘Adwenpa’ which means "good mind". She hopes to receive GH500 to stock her inventory. This would enable her to save more in taking care of the household.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, etc.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La vivienda de la señora María Del Carmen M. la adquirió por medio de su trabajo, por medio de un crédito de gobierno. Pero a la casa le esta haciendo falta algunas cosa, ella quiere empezar a poner el poso de concreto al frente de la casa y hacer el contrata de agua. 
En esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar a cabo la mejora y contratar el agua. Requiere del apoyo de ustedes para  poder llevar a cabo su proyecto.
La señora María Del Carmen es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilizad una hija, que esta estudiando y desea darle lo mejor.
texts.en:
Ms. María Del Carmen M. obtained a house through her job using a government loan. However, the house needs to have some improvements made. She wants to start laying pavement in front of her house and connect to the water supply.

At this time, she does not have the money needed for the home improvement and water main connection. She needs your help in order to carry out her project.

Ms. María Del Carmen is a single mother with a school age daughter under her care. She hopes to give her the best.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pavement and running water

loans.name: Silvino

texts.es: En esta ocasión el Sr. O. se ha acercado con el único propósito de ayudar a una de sus hijas, anteriormente ha obtenido con nosotros créditos para mejorar su casa pero desafortunadamente no puede continuar con sus proyectos en este instante, su prioridad es la salud de su hija, necesita de gran apoyo para poder cubrir los gasto que están surgiendo; la enfermedad que su hija padece es diabetes y ya tiene complicaciones de tipo renal. Su ayuda es urgente, muchas gracias.
texts.en:
On this occasion Mr. O.' only purpose is to help one of his daughters. Previously he has obtained loans with us to improve his dwelling, but unfortunately he cannot continue with his projects for the time being. His priority is his daughter's health, she needs much support in order to cover the costs related to her illness. She has diabetes with kidney complications. Your support is urgent. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Daughter's medical expenses

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa D. is a 33 year old trader. She is married with three children who are currently in school. She has sold used clothes through hawking for three years now, in order to take care of her family. With this business, she has been able to support one child's education, who is in the final year in the senior high school. Her major challenge over the years has been the lack of funds to increase her business. Yaa has lots of marketing experience and she is very confident that the loan would enable her to make remarkable business progress. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes and shoes of a greater variety to increase her inventory. She says her greatest joy would be when she is able to provide all her kids with a quality education to make them more resourceful in the future. She hopes to save enough to fulfill this dream of hers. Yaa belongs to a village bank called ‘Good name’. 

Yaa lives at Apatrapa, a suburb of Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Yaa is fortunate that her husband has built a two bedroom house. 

She hopes to receive a loan to make her business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more after taking care of the household.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetic products for retail.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
La señora Rosalba G. A. está separada de su esposo, vive con su Mamá, tiene 3 hijos, actualmente ella labora como operaria de producción en una maquiladora, ella cuenta con pensión alimenticia por parte se su ex-esposo y con ese ingreso que recibe mantiene a sus hijos.
La señora Rosalba G. esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar las colegiaturas y los exámenes de sus hijos para que ellos puedan seguir con sus estudios y puedan llegar a ser profesionistas en el futuro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalba G. A. is separated from her husband. She lives with her mother and she has 3 children. At the moment she is working as a production operator at an assembly plant. She receives maintenance from her ex-husband and together with her salary she supports her children. Mrs. Rosalba G. is requesting a loan in order to pay her children's tuition and exams so they can continue their studies and become prefessionals in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay tuition and academic exams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of corn, millet, beans, and some yams

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El señor  Miguel Ángel Q. y su esposa la señora Jorgelina Cagal tiene cuatro años con su negocio de venta de ropa nueva y artículos personales. Desean incrementar más variedad de productos para esta nueva temporada de verano.
 Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos para poder darles lo mejor a sus tres hijos que están estudiando. Ellos les agradecerán infinitamente su contribución para agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
For four years Mr. Miguel Angel Q. and his wife, Mrs. Jorgelina Cagal have managed their business selling new clothes and toiletries. They wish to increase the variety of products for the coming summer season. This business is the income source that allows them to give the best to their three children who are students. They will be exceedingly grateful for your contribution to extend their business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for a business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth H. es madre de familia, tiene tres hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian.
Con dos créditos anteriores de FVP ha realizado mejoras a su vivienda, tiene el proyecto de construir dos cuartos para sus niños ya que necesitan su propio espacio. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagarla con los ingresos del trabajo de su esposo el señor Oscar Izquierdo como chofer de camión de carga. 
Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth H. is a mother of three adolescent children who are currently in school. With two previous credits from Kiva field partner FVP, Elizabeth has made improvements on her home. She is working on constructing rooms for her children since they need their own space. She is requesting a loan for this purpose, and plans to repay it through the income that her husband, Oscar Izquierdo, earns as a truck driver. Her desire is that her children will have their own room and a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of two rooms on the ground floor of the house

loans.name: Laurencio

texts.es:
EL señor Laurencio S.  trabaja como taxi desde hace ya mas de treinta años el cual es su ingreso familiar.
Horita tiene un problema que su automóvil necesita unas reparaciones mecánicas pero no cuenta con el capital necesaria para poder reparar el carro.
 Esta solicitando su cooperación para poder arreglar su automóvil y así poder trabajar sin ninguna preocupación.
texts.en:
Mr. Laurencio S. has been working as a taxi cab driver for more than thirty years now. This job is his family’s source of income.

His current problem is that his vehicle needs to have some repairs, but he does not have the funds necessary to carry out those repairs. He is requesting your cooperation so that he can fix his taxi cab and continue to work without any worries.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair taxi cab

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
EL señor  Juan Antonio N. es padre de Familia tiene un hijo que desea darle lo mejor.
A la vivienda le esta haciendo falta un loso de concreto en el patio ya que cuando llueve se la inunda y es un problema para su esposa e hijo salir.
 Solicita un préstamo para poder realizar su mejora lo mas pronto posible y planea pagarlo con los ingresos de su trabaja como chofer de camión de carga.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Antonio N. has one son, to whom he wishes to give the best. He needs to pave his front yard because it gets flooded when it rains, making it difficult for his wife and child to go outside. He is requesting this loan in order to lay concrete as soon as possible. He plans on repaying the loan with the money that he gets from his job as a truck driver.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pave front yard

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
Berta has worked as a seamstress for 10 years, hand-making pants and shirts for children. Especially at this time in El Salvador, when students are returning to classes, Berta is busy filling school uniform orders for her customers. This relatively profitable period for Berta, combined with her record of punctual payment of previous loans, has given her confidence to apply for a home loan. This loan would allow Berta to install a new, more protective metal roof on her home as well as a floor in the patio area outside of her house.

Partnership with the Salvadoran Foundation for Integral Support (FUSAI)

In order to best serve its clients receiving housing loans in construction and remodeling, INTEGRAL has partnered with Salvadoran Foundation for Integral Support (FUSAI) which specializes in offering FREE technical advice for home owners in areas such as circulation, ventilation, lighting, and construction budgeting. For Integral’s housing loan clients, this means their money is used more effectively in the construction of a safer, more durable, and practical homes.
